133.content:
No ninja ever believed in magic. From the point they were trained, they were taught the basics of every single jutsu. The strange and amazing things ninjas could do made logical sense in every way. Anything a ninja did could be explained through hard science. So you could imagine Sakura's reaction to their latest mission. A protection mission for a magician was the last thing Sakura wanted to do. She being an avid bookworm, especially for the scientific, made her feel that anything anyone claimed to be "magic" was nothing more than lies.

Naruto on the other hand was excited to see a magic show, claiming to have stayed up all night learning how to do simple tricks to impress the magician. The magician apparently was very popular in other countries and had come to the Land of Fire to 'entertain the masses'. He sounded like an arrogant jerk to Sakura.

"Oh man, oh man!" yelled Naruto, "Where is he? I can't wait to meet him!"

"You're starting to sound like Sakura, you idiot..." muttered Sasuke. Sakura blushed.

Naruto retorted. "Oh shut up bastard! I've been waiting all week for this! Sanja the Great is supposed to be one of the coolest magicians ever!"

"And the most popular." spoke Kakashi, "Which is why you should remember why it is we're needed Naruto. There's no telling how a celebrity will fare in a new crowd of people, there may very well be a riot for all we know. Our job is to protect Sanja and make sure no harm comes to him."

Naruto rolled his eyes and began to think of a way to get the magician's autograph without Kakashi noticing. The sensei sighed and they continued down the road. When they finally reached the meeting place for the magician there was no one to be seen. Naruto began to look around frantically.

"Do you guys see him anywhere!? Maybe we're in the wrong spot! Are you sure this is where we were supposed to meet Kakashi-sensei?! I don't see anyone anywhere!"

"Excuse me young man..." said an old lady who had come up to the four ninjas.

"Huh? What is it, granny?" replied Naruto.

"Would you happen to have a coin I can borrow?"

"Yea sure, here you go." he flicked a coin into the woman's hand. "By the way have you seen a magician around here? He's called Sanja the Great."

"Why yes I have...you see he..." the old lady torn her cloak off, revealing a handsome looking man with a Spanish accent beneath, "...is me! Sanja the Great at your service."

He bowed while Naruto's mouth gaped open before clapping like an idiot. Sanja held the coin out in front of the team before clapping his hands together. He showed both of his hands, the coin seemed to have vanished. He then reached over to Naruto's ear and pulled out the very same coin. Naruto applauded, Sakura rolled her eyes, Sasuke just shrugged.

"How do you do Mr. Sanja." said Kakashi, "We are Team Seven and we'll be your bodyguards for your trip here in Konoha."

"Ah, and it is a pleasure to make your acquaintance Kakashi." said Sanja, taking Kakashi by surprise considering he had not told the magician his name.

"And you must be..." said Sanja, tossing the coin back to Naruto, "Naruto, correct?"

"Yea! How did you know that?" screamed Naruto as he caught the coin.

Sanja laughed and turned to Sasuke. "That one with the scowl is Sasuke, no?"

Sasuke grunted. Sanja moved over to Sakura and grabbed her hand before kissing it. "And this lovely lady is Sakura."

Sakura quickly pulled her hand away from him before wiping it on his dress in disgust. Sanja frowned and asked.

"You do not like me, Sakura?"

"No offense Mister Sanja, I'm sure you're a nice person and all. I just don't believe in magic is all."

Sanja shook his head.

"Tsk, tsk, tsk. It pains my heart when young folk say that. But just watch one of my performances my dear Sakura. You'll believe in time...Now then, shall I show you where you'll be staying?"

He lead them to the concert hall where his shows would be held and gave each of them their own personal room backstage. "Perhaps this won't be such a bad week after all." said Sakura to herself as she relaxed in her large queen sized bed.

The announcer blared his introduction to the crowd.

"Now ladies and gentlemen of Konoha...I bring to you the master of disguise! The sorcerer of the south! The incredible illusionist! Here he is! Sanja the Great!"

There was an explosion in the middle of the stage of green smoke. When it cleared, there stood Sanja in a black suit with a top hat. He bowed to the cheering audience, stopping to lift open his arm cuffs which released a flock of pigeons that flew around the audience. He took his hat off, and the birds dived into it one by one, until they had all vanished and he returned the black hat to his head. The audience was thundering with approval.

"Thank you my dear Konoha! It is a pleasure to be here at last!" spoke the magician, "I will grant you a show beyond your wildest imagination! But let me not take all the credit...Let me introduce you to my lovely assistant, a ninja of Konoha. The beautiful maiden...Sakura Haruno!"

Sakura blushed at his flattery, the manager gave her a slight push onto the stage.

"Break a leg!" smiled the manager.

Nearly everyone from the village was in attendance, from Hyūgas to the Naras. She was able to notice a mass of bright yellow hair in the audience cheering madly. Looks like Naruto got his wish to watch the show. Sasuke was sitting next to him with his arms crossed. He had a look on his face that said "How the hell did I get talked into this one?" Kakashi was no where to be seen, probably outside guarding the entrance. Sakura was blushing madly as she stepped onto stage with her arms behind her back. She had never been in front of a crowd of people this huge.

"Now my dear audience..." said Sanja, "Open your minds....and let the magic begin!"

The show was full of what a naive person would call mystical tricks. Sawing people in half, making people disappear, and even preforming levitation were all parts of the show. Sakura's job through this was to help volunteers from the audience up the stage and move props from place to place. Thankfully Sanja had her do nothing embarrassing yet. At least not until after intermission...

"Now ladies and gentlemen! I will now begin my greatest act! I shall pull a full grown rabbit from my hat! And my wonderful assistant, Sakura, will provide us with the rabbit!"
13311.title: A rabbit in the hat.

choices: He makes her do several tricks on stage.
133111.content:
"My dear Sakura!" cried Sanja, "Would you be so kind as to come over here?"

He wasn't really going to do this to her in front of all her friends was he? She stepped up the stage to Sanja, who with a flick of his hand made a table appear in a puff of smoke. He then took off his top hat, showing the audience that nothing was inside before dropping it to the floor.

"I need you to stand in my hat Sakura." he said with a smile.

She obeyed him and placed both of her feet uncomfortably inside his top hat. Sanja took out a wand from his pockets, whispering to Sakura "This will make you believe." He lifted his wand up over Sakura's head before saying to the audience.

"Now we say the magic words...Lepus mutatio!"

Sakura didn't feel any different as he lowered his wand. Sanja put his hand to the top of her head and pushed down slightly. At first Sakura thought he was just measuring her height or something strange like that, but she began to notice that he was looking taller by the second. He was pushing her into the hat! She looked down, expecting there to be an elevator or a trap door. There was nothing but her ever growing closer feet! He was actually scrunching her INTO his hat! She opened her mouth to try to say something but nothing came out, she was in utter shock. By now she was at his waist in height.

The bottom of the hat was beginning to feel quite cramped as Sakura shrunk past the 2 foot marker and keep on going. The magician had to bend over to reach her head now she was becoming so small. The brim of the hat was slowing approaching from below. The last thing she saw was Sanja smile before she was stuck inside the darkness of the hat. It felt like her entire body had been compressed inside a soup can. Her only comfort was the sounds from outside of the audience madly applauding. She felt herself being lifted into the air and onto the table.

"Now." spoke Sanja, "I shall pull my now long eared assistant out completely unharmed! Watch and be amazed!"

It dawned on Sakura what exactly Sanja had meant by pulling a rabbit out of his hat. She felt a slight tugging on her ears before being hoisted out in front of the audience. She was covered in pink fur from head to toe. Her hands and feet were no small paws that were kicking in the air. A fluffy tail had sprouted from her back. Her ears in the hands of Sanja were long and floppy and her nose had flattened and became a snout. She felt her front teeth protruding out of her mouth and long whiskers coming out of her cheeks. And she was still wearing that stupid one piece suit. Worst of all, the world seemed much, much bigger.

"Let's hear it for Sakura!" cheered Sanja. The crowd went nuts.
133111.title: Sakura, the rabbit.

choices: Sakura performs, except the final act (anthro)
1331111.content:
After the applause died down a bit, Sanja then gently picked up Sakura, who was still in disbelief.

'This has to be genjutsu. Sanja couldn't have transformed me for real!' Sakura thought. She was going to try a genjutsu release technique, just in case, but Sanja interrupted her concentration.

"Now then ladies and gentlemen, my lovely assistant will now show us her physical prowess by balancing this ball on her nose!" Sanja announced, pulling a large beachball out of thin air.

Of course Sakura struggled and shook her head no vehemently, which made Sanja smirk.

"Of course, for this trick, and every other performance she does properly, our beautiful bunny will recieve..." The mage then pointed his wand at the ball, which became a carrot. "A carrot, which will help her return to her original form."

Sakura then weighed her options. If she did the tricks, she risked public humiliation, but might regain her form. Most importantly to her, Sasuke would see.

If she didn't, she'd possibly stay a rabbit forever, and who knows what'd happen.

As the kunoichi pondered, Sanja turned the carrot back into a ball.

"Shall we begin?" he asked Sakura.
1331111.title: He makes her do several tricks on stage.

choices: She goes along with it, she had gotten that far.
Forget it, walk off the stage.
13311111.content:
Sakura sighed. She could not preform any jutsu and the audience was becoming angsty. Booing at her as she continued to think it over. She really had no choice and pawed Sanja's hand to signal 'Let me down." To which Sanja happily obliged.

"What a good sport! Let's hear it for her!" he yelled to the crowd, meeting a thunderous applause.

He tossed the ball in the air. Sakura's body reacted on it's own, like it had done this routine hundreds of times before. She titled her head up making her bunny nose parallel to the ground. Which a "WHUMP" the ball landed on the tip of her twitching nose and stood balanced. Sanja laughed, he and the audience clapped madly. Sakura aimed at Sanja and jumped, knocking the ball in the air back to him.

"Excellent, excellent!" he said catching it. He tapped it again with his wand, it rounded out and formed a giant ring. He then took a deep breathe and breathed fire on it, lighting it ablaze.

"Now, how about another trick? Jump through this hoop of fire my assistant! And I promise you will get your first carrot!"

Sakura glared at him, feeling she had been humiliated enough already. But she no choice and her body was moving on it's own again. Sanja held the ring at shoulder height, making it quite a jump. Sakura made it though, the fires brushed so close against her fur however she felt it almost catch fire. Sanja bowed to the audience, which was going nuts.

"Talented isn't she? Yes, yes Sakura. I promised you a carrot. And Sanja is nothing if not a man of his word."

He poked the ring once more, the fires disappeared and the hoop's form shrunk into a small carrot. Sanja reached down and handed it to Sakura who began to scarf it down greedily. She had had just about enough of this. As she eat, she began to notice that her eyesight was becoming higher. She was being tall again. "Good." she thought, "At least he's not a lying bastard..." Her hind legs were becoming human like again. Even her arms were becoming more human like. The carrot was almost done, but she still had all her fur, her nose, her ears, and her tail of her rabbit form. The last bite knocked her up back to her normal height. She looked at her human/rabbit form with a face of utter disgust.

"Wonderful!" yelled Sanja, "As you can see, she is not quite back to normal! She will have to preform one final trick to earn that carrot!"

With arms crossed she glared at him probably for the hundredth time that night. She took it back. He wasn't a lying bastard. Just an exploitative one.
13311111.title: Sakura performs, except the final act (anthro)

choices: The carrot in it, as promised.
133111111.content:
As much as she wanted to kill Sanja right now, Sakura needed to get that final carrot if she could have any hope of returning to normal completely. She still could not initiate any jutsu after all. Sanja looked at Sakura for approval to continue. She rolled her eyes but nodded her head to continue.

"So my dear Sakura! I suppose you can't wait to hear what you must to for your final task, huh?"

"I can hardly contain myself..." She was able to talk again.

"Well you must do what all good rabbits do, and jump!" He clapped his hands together twice and a small cage appeared from the roof of the stage, which was a good twenty feet in the air. Much too high for any normal person to reach. Sakura turned to the magician and simply stated.

"You're nuts."

"Well, my dear Sakura. If you cannot reach it...you will be stuck like this for an eternity. T'is your choice." He said with a wink.

Sakura stared back up at the cage. Looking more closely at it, she had a strong sense she could reach it. Like her legs were much more powerful than normal. She crouched down low to build up power then released it into the air. Like a loaded spring, she rocketed skyward. In mere nanoseconds she was facing the cage, which had...
133111111.title: Earning the final carrot.

1331111111.content:
There was a small flicker of orange as Sakura sped down to earth again. At least Sanja had kept his word and would reward her with a way to return to normal for her degrading stunts. She landed with two firm feet on the stage again before shooting back up to the cage. She grabbed onto the bottom and pulled it back down with her. The cable holding it snapped and both she and cage went into free fall. She did a flip and stuck the landing with her massive rabbit feet. The audience went completely wild.

"Bravo!" said Sanja, "Thank you for coming to our first show here everyone! I hope to see you all again the whole week! We'll have more exciting tricks next time!"

He motioned for Sakura to move offstage, to which she happily obliged. The manager smiled at the the two, applauding them on their performance. But Sakura didn't care, she just wanted this horrible nightmare of an evening to end. She grabbed her clothing and weapons from the bald man and continued to the dressing room. She slammed the door shut and began to eat her hard earned carrot.

Almost instantly she felt extremely cooler. Clumps of pink fur fell to the floor. She felt her long ears being sucked back into her head as well. She ate the whole thing in two bites and turned to watch her changes in the mirror, making sure there were no more stupid tricks involved. Her feet were shriveling back to normal size while she felt her nose become her old nose again. She never thought she would be so relieved to see her huge forehead again as the hair on her face began to disappear. The last thing to go was the tail which jolted back into her spine. Sakura surveyed herself in the mirror, making sure every single thing was back in place.

"So, do you believe in magic now my dear Sakura?" came an all too coy and familiar voice.

Sakura immediately tore a kunai knife from her returned side pocket and lunged at the man in the doorway. She pinned Sanja to the ground, with her knife pressed sharply into his neck. She was about ready to tear that smug smile right off the magic man's face.

"What the hell did you do to me, you bastard?!" she growled.

"You volunteered to be my assistant Sakura." he put simply, "That's why I'm always searching for a new one. None of them seemed to be too thrilled in partaking in the more...interesting bits of the show. I figured a person like you would-"

She punched him right in the stomach. "What the hell does that mean?! Have you been doing this to other people as well!?"

He was coughing in pain, but he answered. "O-of course. But none of them ever stay after experiencing the transformation. I figured it would be best to find a helper who wouldn't know anything about the trick. And when you said you didn't believe in magic I thought I could do both things at once and prove you wrong."

"Do you have any idea how embarrassed I am?! You made me make a fool of myself in front of all my friend!" Her face was turning red from yelling.

"What they think they saw...was a very elaborate and very impressive magic trick. To them...you were under the stage the whole time, the rabbit was in my hat the whole time, and human rabbit was someone in a costume. The audience thinks...they ALWAYS think that the whole display is just smoke and mirrors. And that my Sakura, is the true genius of my magic. To make the audience second guess themselves. That is the goal of any master illusionist. Now, would you kindly remove your kunai knife from my throat?"

Sakura hesitated, but slowly returned the knife back to her pack. She got off of Sanja and he dusted himself off.

"You placed your trust in me Sakura as an assistant." said Sanja, "I would not harm or cause havoc for someone who put as much trust in me as you did tonight. Besides...you make a very charming rabbit."

He sounded almost like Naruto. Sakura even blushed a his last comment.

"How would you like to become my full-time temporary assistant?" he asked, "You can perform with me until I find someone else willing to take the job. There's good pay involved. What do you say?"
1331111111.title: Normal at last.

choices: A new animal to transform into.
13311111111.content:
The only person to ever call her charming or good looking was Ino, who did so to give her confidence. Sanja was a bit weird, but he seemed earnest and kind. She was at a lose. Deep down, as strange as it was, she sort of enjoyed the whole transformation. It was...freeing. Like she was unleashing a pent up beast within her. She would never admit it, but it was fun being a rabbit.

"Well? I'm not sure I can find someone else who'd be interested..."

She sighed. "Alright, alright. For the sake of the show, and our mission..." She paused. "I guess...I'll be your assistant..."

It was like he had been waiting all day to hear her say that. Sanja leap at her and shook her hand. "Oh thank you Sakura! You won't regret this! I swear it! It will be the most fun you've ever had!"

They left shortly after that, Sakura headed for the lounging room Team Seven was given. Her teammates were waiting for her. Naruto was hopping around the room like he had eaten a dozen 'pixie sticks'. Sasuke, on the other hand, was staring up at the ceiling from the couch.

Naruto noticed Sakura and yelled. "Sakura! You're not a rabbit anymore! That show was awesome!"

"You idiot," Said Sasuke. "It was an illusion. Every thing in the show was."

"Shut up Sasuke! What about when Sakura was half rabbit and half human? Huh?"

"That was just someone in a costume."

"Come on Sakura! That was really you right?!"

Sakura was relieved that Sanja had told the truth. Even Sasuke thought it was just a simple parlor trick. "He's right Naruto. It was all a very elaborate illusion."

Naruto sulked around the room the rest of the night before going to bed, Sasuke was not far behind him. Sakura on the other hand stayed awake for a little bit longer. She took off the leotard Sanja had given her before the show and neatly folded it into a pile. Deep inside, she was excited. It was like waiting for Christmas the next day. She didn't want to fall asleep ever. Eventually though, she grew too sleepy to stay up, and passed out on her makeup table with her pajamas on.

-------------------------------------------------------

"Sakura! Wake up!" Yelled Naruto.

He was not the person she wanted to hear first thing in the morning. She yawned. "N-Naruto? W-what is it?"

"Sanja said he was looking for you. Said something about practice before tonight's show."

Sakura quickly jumped up and grabbed her leotard without even thanking Naruto. She didn't even ask where Sanja was, though she had a hunch. Bursting through the curtain to the main stage, she found Sanja juggling several chainsaws.

"S-sorry *huff* I'm late *puff*" She said through deep breathes.

Sanja tipped his hand, every single chainsaw in the air landed and disappeared within the black void. He then turned to Sakura and gave a warm smile.

"Tis no trouble my dear Sakura. Though I must say, you were in quite the hurry to get here."

She blushed and he chuckled. "But let's move to the task at hand. I had the grandest idea for a new act in tonight's show. I figured we both could use the practice."

"What sort of act is it?" She asked.
13311111111.title: The new assistant.

choices: She has rabbit like cravings/mental traits
She begins turning back into a rabbit
13311111112.content:
"No way in hell!" Sakura said. "You may have kept your word, but I don't think I can fully trust you!"

Sanja sighed. "Well I cannot blame you, but still the offer stands in case you change your mind." Sanja said.

Sakura left wordlessly for her home, just wanting to put the day behind her. Soon Sakura fell asleep, and the next day...
13311111112.title: The carrot's catch...

choices: He truly doesn't know why this is happening.
133111111122.content:
After her long and tenuous performance, Sakura slept for a very long time. She dreamed she was back on the stage again with Sanja, laughing cruelly at her. She performed trick after trick for the carrot to change her back but no matter what she did, every carrot she earned did nothing. The audience mocked her, throwing tomatoes and banana peels at her. She could do nothing but sit and cry, wishing it was over. Then she awoke with a pounding headache.

"What...what a horrible dream..." she said to herself, holding her giant forehead in pain.

It was a rainy day and she had greatly overslept. She was supposed to be at the show an hour ago. She got to her feet and walked over to her vanity mirror to quickly put on her makeup and leave for the mission. Her appearance was shocking though.

"What the..? What the hell is this?!"

Her front teeth were now extremely long, like it they had been when she was a rabbit the other night. Her ears had also lengthened again several inches, while her nose had pushed out into a snout again. There was also a slight appear of small whiskers protruding from her cheeks.

"That magician! I'll kill him!", she took off as fast as she could for the concert hall.

The long ears she was now sporting flopped in the wind as she dashed down the crowded Konoha street. She had not stopped to put on shoes so she had a clear view of her bare feet. To her dismay it looked like they were growing out again with each step. Worst of all, the crowd was becoming taller and taller. She was losing inches of height every minute wasted. She had to have lost 6 inches by the time she busted through the theater's doors. The morning show was just ending and people were making their way out of their seats.

Sakura took the hallway down the backstage and found Sanja just about to enter his dressing room. He noticed and greeted her.

"Ah, Sakura! There you are! Have you changed your mind about becoming my- OMPH!"

She pinned him to the wall with as much strength as her diminished form could muster.

"Don't screw with me Sanja! Look at my face! What the hell did you do to me?!"
133111111122.title: Back down the rabbit hole.

choices: Sakura and Sanja travel to find the one who can help
Sakura starts to train so she could find a way to control her form
1331111111221.content:
The magician was shocked both by the strength of the little bunnygirl and by the fact that he didn't really know what was going on with his spell.

"Ok now Sakura don't panic, I really have no idea of what whent wrong with my spell but I can try to help you out!"

Sakura's little form was starting to tremble and Sanja could swear he saw her face become red with rage even under the fur and wiskers.

"You better do something or I'm gonna use my techniques on you!" Sakura's voice sounded a little high pitched due to her form but it sounded angry no less.

"ok, I'll help you but please release me so I can consult my book of magics!"

After Sanja's demmand, Sakura relutantly released him and stood beside him while he searched on his wallets and bags for the book.

Some time later, Sanja pulled a very old looking book out of one of his bags. The book had a black and blue cover with writtings in gold saying "The Book of Magic".
After flipping some pages, Sanja frowned and looked at Sakura with a conserned face.

"What now? You better find out what's happening or else..." Sakura sounded really serious on her sentense.

"Well...I did but I don't think you'll like it..." Sanja tried to speak slowly as if he tried not to shock her with some bad news.

"Just say it! Come on!"

"Well...uh... I actually made a mistake while doing the trick and I'm afraid you'll be shapeshifting back and forth on your human form and this bunny form for a while-" he suddenly paused and left his arms over his head triying to defend himself of a possible attack from the bunnygirl, but he got out of his defensive stance when Sakura said "Is it permanent or I will be back to normal after this 'little while'?"

Sanja took a deep breath and resumed what he was saying "it can be permanent but there is someone who might help us cure you"

"So you can't revert it yourself then?" Sakura was starting to get angry, which was quite cute comming from a little bunny wearing pajamas.

"Now now Sakura, you got to calm down or else we are not gonna be able to find this person" Sanja said still panting from his startled state.

This seemed to calm her down a little so Sanja continued talking "Well Sakura you must know something first, even with all your ninja training you might not be able to fully understand our journey, you got to belive in magic or else you are going to be trapped in this form forever-", Sanja waited for any reaction that could come from the bunnygirl but all Sakura did was gasp and blink her huge bunny eyes.

"-or there is also the option of being a bunnygirl forever, since your form will shapeshift you could simply stay as you are and try to control the change yourself, I'm sure you are skilled enough in the arts of body control and mental discipline so you might figure a way out of this, perhaps better than mine!"

So...
1331111111221.title: I hope I knew, really!!

choices: Sakura opens the door and they both start the journey
Sakura can't still trust Sanja, she makes him go in first.
13311111112211.content:
"I want to be normal again! I don't want to train a whole lot again just to be able to control my form!" Sakura said.

"All right then off we go!" Sanja sounded enthusiastic even for a man who was just assaulted by an angy bunny some minutes ago.

"Wait I must get some supplies and finish off my preparations before we go on a journey!" Sakura uttered, a little worried.

"You'll have no need for that! The place we are going has everything you'll ever need, you'll just have to trust me and belive in magic for once!" Sanja answered her worries.

"So... where we are headed to then?" Sakura asked.

"The land of Magickhold, where all the tricks of ilusionism and the magical spells came from, even some very ancient forms of ninjutsu!" Sanja said but Sakura could hardly belive in a word.

"By your face I see you do not belive me yet, but get ready for the most amazing experience of your life and I garantee it my little bunnygirl, you'll never ever see something so astounding as the ancient land of the magicians!".

Well, Sakura had to admit, this Sanja fellow really knew how to impress a crowd, even as he spoke he made ample gests with his arms and she didn't even notice when he took out his wand from someplace concealed and started to spell some werid magic words.

In wat could be described as simply something magical, a door formed out of nowhere! It was a regular door, well not so regular in Konoha village but still very common in other nations. The door was black and blue resembling the cover of that strange book Sanja found earlyer, and its doorknob was golden with gravings of small little stars all over it.

"Okay my little friend!, ladies first!" Sanja said while he took out his top hat and made an ample compliment for Sakura to go ahead and open the door.
13311111112211.title: The journey begins!

133111111122111.content:
"How do I get myself into these situations?" Asked Sakura to herself as she lifted her paw to turn the knob. There was a bright light as the door slowly cracked open. Sakura covered her eyes from the blinding light. When she opened them, an empty void which could only be described as a portal shimmered in the air.

Sanja chuckled. "That's the spirit my girl! Now come on, off you go."

To think, she was a normal ninja girl just mere days ago. A life that seemed so far away at this point...all destroyed thanks to this frilly magician and his magic.

"Magic or not," She mumbled. "I'm not going to let it beat me."

In one swift hop, she jumped head first into the portal. It felt like entering a rabbit hole (no pun intended). Stars and planets zoomed by her face. She felt herself become compressed as she fell further into the darkness. She looked down and swore she could see another door approaching fast. She closed her eyes before she collided with it. There was a giant crash and she feel face first on a hard checkered marble floor.

She blinked several times and slowly got up. "Wha...W-where am I?"

She sat in the middle of a small room. Giant granite pillars surrounded her, protecting blank gray walls. Yet, there was a small wooden door at the bottom of the wall. It could not have been larger than a foot high. Sakura hopped over to it and reached for the knob. Suddenly the keyhole itself gave a huge yawn. Two sleepy yellow eyes appeared above it. It looked like a face was in the door itself! It spoke in a tired voice.

"Whoever it is...you are much too large to enter me. Why don't you try to get smaller."

"Um pardon me," Answered Sakura. "But I can fit through. I'm a tiny rabbit. See?"

The door blinked several times. "Why so you are! My apologizes, I was expecting someone else. Go on through then!"

The door opened up to reveal a sprawling green land of colorful houses. All of which were oddly shaped like top hats and a card houses. There were plenty of people, cloaked in garbs not unlike Sanja, conversing with each other. Sakura caught a glimpse of brooms that were sweeping by themselves, and horse drawn carriages with no horses.

"Are you going to go through or not?" Asked the door impatiently.

"Alright, alright. Sorry."

She skipped out into the great city. The air smelled of roses and cotton candy. Sakura was so absorbed by the sights and sounds, that she had already forgotten she had just conversed with a door. She also failed to notice a rather large shadow approaching her. The figure it belonged to was...
133111111122111.title: To Magickhold.

choices: Go into the cage and comfort it.
Sakura finds a bag of peanuts on the ground.
Sakura gets bored too, and leaves.
134.content:
Out of all the pointless mission Team 7 had had in the past, this one seemed like the most pointless. The circus was in town, and apparently the ringleader was worried that their main attraction would be kidnapped. You see, it just so happens this travel group had been able to acquire an extremely rare species of pink elephant. Their only pink elephant, Jumbo, was worth quite a fair amount of money on the black market. Despite the ringleader's worries, no one else seemed concerned someone would steal it. It was Naruto who voiced the team's opinion on the mission the best.

"It's the freaking HUGE elephant! Why the HELL does it need our protection? Who's going to move the dumb thing?!"

"Oh come on Naruto, you're going to scare him away. It's not his fault we're stuck here. Blame the ringleader for it." said Sakura as she pat Jumbo on the trunk.

"Still, the dobe is right. Why are we wasting time with this animal?" replied Sasuke.

"Well if you guys would rather try to kill each other in training, be my guest. I'll stand watch over Jumbo."

Naruto and Sasuke went off into the woods nearby as soon as Sakura offered to stay. "Boys..." she thought. She turned her attention to the pink elephant limbering along in its cage. It seemed so lonely all locked up by itself.
134.title: Team 7 Mission: Protect the Elephant.

choices: She manages to escape but remains transformed.
1341.content:
Sakura hopped over the 6 foot cage to join the melancholy elephant to cheer it up a bit. It must be terrible locked in a cage with no friends or anything. As soon as Sakura landed, the elephant instantly sparked to life and moved over to greet his visitor. Jumbo's giant nose blew Sakura's hair around as it got her sweet scent. Sakura reached up and scratched behind his ears.

"You're just a poor big guy locked in a cage with no one to visit you huh? I don't blame you for getting lonely."

Jumbo seemed more occupied with Sakura's face as he felt around it with his trunk. He stopped at her nose and flattened his own over it, causing Sakura to yelp a bit.

"Okay big guy, that's enough now. Can you move your trunk off my nose?"

Jumbo grunted and took a deep breathe. Closing his mouth, he exhaled through his nose. The air went down his trunk and into Sakura's nose!

"Ummph Bay Bow. But Bit Bout (Hey now. Cut it Out.)" said Sakura as she took the elephant's exhaled air.

Surprisingly it didn't smell that bad. Almost like a mixture of peanuts and grass. Maybe it was just a way of the elephant saying hello to her or something. But she knew something was happening when it didn't stop. She felt heavier almost, all around her body. She looked down and saw pudgy belly begin to form.

"But's Bowing Bon?( What's going on?)", she asked the elephant, who had taken another deep breathe.

More air surged into her. She felt something poke out of her hair. Grabbing it she felt it was her ears! They were becoming over sized and flapply like-like...an elephants! Sakura mumbled and tried to pull the elephant's trunk off her face. But it was no good. Jumbo was too firmly attached. As he took another deep breathe, Sakura panicked as she flew herself balloon out. Her skin was becoming pink from being stretched like this. Jumbo was turning her into an elephant! She gave the trunk of Jumbo one last pull and...
1341.title: Trunk's surprise.

13411.content:
The trunk's grip was way too strong to pull off. Sakura was doomed to become an elephant! As Jumbo breathed into her again she felt her fingers being sucked into her expanding hands. By the sound of two snapping sandals, she could tell her feet were getting the same treatment. Another blow came, and Sakura felt something poke out of her pants. It was an elephants tail. Another deep breathe from Jumbo caused it to jump out to full elephant size. Sakura felt more and more powerful from each breathe Jumbo blew into her, but she could still not remove his trunk.

"Bum Bon! Bop Bis Blease! (Come on! Stop this please!)" cried Sakura, with tries down her eyes.

A huge surge expanded her body out even further. Loud rips were heard as her torn clothing lay all over the ground. She was completely naked and pink now. But she also noticed that Jumbo had to turn his head up to blow air into her. She had gotten gigantic! Her stomach now covered most of her mid section, giving the impression her torso had a barrel shape to it. Her hands were no more as only pink elephant feet took their place. As far as Sakura could tell, the only thing human left about her was her hair, which resembled more of a mane now, and her face which was drenched in tears.

"By Bont Bant Bo Be Ban Blebant!(I don't want to be an elephant!)"

Sakura could now see completely over Jumbo, her legs wobbled and she lost her balance. With a giant rumble, she landed on her hands(feet). But still Jumbo refused to let go. Her entire body was that of a pink elephant, just a little smaller than Jumbo. Sakura knew what was coming next. With a giant blow, Sakura felt her head enlarge itself, all that remained was the trunk.

Jumbo began sucking. It felt like he was trying to pull Sakura's face off. But as moved his trunk back, Sakura's nose followed it. He was lengthening her nose by sheer force! Eventually, after stretching it a good two feet Jumbo released her new trunk. Sakura was now a female pink elephant.
13411.title: Sakura becomes the elephant.

choices: Tell me what's going on here
Tell me how to change back
134111.content:
Sakura could only stare at herself in shock for a few seconds, not entirely sure as to what to say, but eventually that temper of her's quickly resurfaced.

"What the hell, did you do to me?"

She trumpeted angrily not quite realizing she was speaking the language of the elephants. But as she turned to glair at Jumbo her expression softens a lot as the male pink elephant is gazing at the ground looking rather ashamed of himself. Then to her surpise Jumbo answered.

"I'm sorry, I really am, I just couldn't control myself."

From what she could hear the elephant sounded around her age, in human years.

"It's just, you were so pretty, and your scent was so sweet, and I get so lonely I couldn't stop myself. I'm so sorry!"

Tears of regret pour from the boy elephants face, and Sakura's rage dissapears instantly, so after a little fumbling she is able to thread her trunk through the bars and take Jumbo's trunk in hers. Jumbo stops sobbing but tears do continue to flow.

"Okay, take it easy now would you please..."

"Totally!" Naruto yelled.

"Whatever..." Sasuke muttered. Sakura was slightly happy, even though she had become an elephant, she had a chance to be with Sasuke, but life with Naruto?!!

'Maybe if he fed me peanuts it wouldn't be so...What am I thinking?!!!' Sakura thought to hersel 'Has my mind changed too?'

Kakashi then pulled out a coin. "Heads Naruto keeps the elephant, tails Sasuke does. The winner also gets to name it.

Both Genin nodded and their sensei flpped the coin. The winner was...

"And your kinda fuzzy, like um, like a peach. Oh, oh I got it, okay girl from now on your name is Momo-chan!"

An appropriately sized sweat drop travels down the back of Sakura's head, though admitedly while it wasn't the most original name ever, it was a lot better than what she expected from Naruto.

"Momo-chan it is, then, alright then Sasuke, Naruto it's getting late Sakura probably whent home, I'll have to talk to her about that tommorow until then Naruto you get your new friend to the animal stables."

Naruto wraps his hand around the end of Sakura's trunk and gives it a gentle tug, with a resigned huff Sakura starts trudging after her "master".

Later that night

Even if it was in the form of a transformed human girl to pose as a mate. But her thoughts drifted to spending the rest of her life with Sasuke. 1341122111.title: Kid(& Elephant)napped

choices: The two rescue Naruto and escape.
13411221112.content:
The first thing Sakura saw was a cage and Sasuke sulking in the corner. He had a strange type of handcuffs that were big and chalk colored. Two of the dark clothed ninjas tap at the cage door, trying to get Sakura's attention.

"Good, the giant elephant is awake. Come now girl."

They unlocked the door, Sasuke stood up weakly and yelled at the ninjas.

"Where are you taking her?!"

One of the ninjas laughed and kicked Sasuke right in the mouth. He slammed down to the floor, coughing up a handful of scarlet blood.

"We're taking her to her mate, the other circus elephant we captured. The boss wants to create more elephants so we can make a bigger profit. Don't worry though, you'll get your "girlfriend" back just as soon as Jumbo's had a little fun with her. And don't try to escape, those handcuffs drain all the chakra."

Sakura tried to resist but the ninja were able to put a noose around her neck. As they turned to lead her out of the prison, Sakura though to herself, "I have to do something or else I'll lose my virginity to an elephant! Think Sakura! Think! Wait a minute...can I still use jutsu like this?" She made hand seals with her trunk. "Fire Ball Jutsu!"

The blast caught everyone in the room by surprise. Both her captors were thrown back and slammed into the wall. Sasuke just started in amazement at the fiery spectacle.

"An elephant that uses jutsu...No way! Unless...?"

Sakura trotted over to Sasuke and felt her handcuffs with her trunk. He got the message and held them out against the ground. With all her massive body weight, Sakura pounded the middle of the cuffs with her feet, causing them to scatter instantly. She trumpeted at Sasuke, "Let's get out of here!"
13411221112.title: In a cage with Sasuke

134112211121.content:
As silently as a giant elephant could, the two snuck around the facility they were imprisoned in. It appeared to be one of the old underground bunkers from the Great Ninja Wars, it was filled with dank dark prisons and rusty metal doors. Thankfully most of the cells were empty with the lights knocked out. All they had to do was stay in the section in the bunker that was operational and they would find the team idiot, Naruto. There were several guards but they were no match for an Uchiha and a jutsu using elephant.

Finally they reached the last row of cells to find Naruto wearing the same hand cuffs Sasuke was in moments ago. Sasuke took the guard out with a swift kick and grabbed the keys on him.

"Thank god Sasuke! How the hell did you get out of your cell?"

"Thank...her" Sasuke pointed at Sakura, she blushed.

"There are some questions I need to ask you when we get back. For now let's concentrate on getting out of here." said Sasuke to Sakura.

With Team Seven reunited again, the hired ninjas stood no chance against them. Even when the alarm sounded, Sasuke was able to tear through them with Chidori while Naruto blew them away with Rasengan. Sakura was able to flail the ninjas away with her massive trunk. In the middle of the action, Naruto yelled to Sasuke.

"What about Jumbo? They kidnapped him too right?"

"We tore through this entire place trying to find you Naruto. They probably took him to another base of theirs. We need to report back to Kakashi-sensei and the village and let them know what's going on."

Eventually they found an entrance and broke out into the sunlight. They were in the middle of the forest somewhere, not far from the village though. Sasuke could see Konoha just over the mountain. They all made a mental note of the bunker's location and returned to the village. When they were well out of harms way, Naruto brought up a question to Sasuke.

"Oi Sasuke, what do you mean she helped you escape?"

Sasuke looked at Sakura and grabbed Naruto on the shoulder and took him out of ear shot. "Had me using jutsu caused Sasuke to catch on to me?", thought Sakura. Naruto had a confused look on his face, but was nodding along to whatever Sasuke was telling him. At last they both smiled at each other and nodded, walking over to Sakura while still talking to each other.

"Oh so that's it. By the way, have you heard from Sakura recently?" asked Naruto, "Maybe we'll have to replace her at this rate. Who do you think we should get."

Sasuke said with a completely straight face, "I always wanted to have Ino on our team. I sort of thought she was always better looking..."

Something primitive and reflexive snapped in Sakura's inner ego, which still oddly resembled her former self. "NO WAY! ABSOLUTELY NO FREAKING WAY!" Unfortunately, Sakura couldn't control herself and reared her front legs up in anger, trumpeting all sorts of curse words at them. Sasuke and Naruto were both in utter shock at her reaction.

"I...I didn't want to believe it..." said Sasuke, "It's you Sakura, isn't it? Our teammate? Only Sakura would react in a way like that."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----

Meanwhile in a dark office, a man in a fancy business suit stared at the ninja, Genjira. He took a long puff on his lighted cigar and asked in a calm voice.

"So...Mr. Genjira...you're telling me the ninja escaped?"

"Yes, sir! It is only a shame I, the Night Ninja's greatest ninja wasn't there to stop them! They also took the female elephant we had captured, apparently she was able to use jutsu and caught our men off guard."

The man in the suit drummed his fingers on his desk. He took another drag of his cigar.

"Elephants don't just...use jutsu, Mr. Genjira. There is something...off about that female, I want your best man to find out what. It might have something to do with why those circus freaks suddenly were able to get their hands on another pink elephant..."

"Well look no further sir! I, Genjira of the Night, will hunt them down without fail!"

"You do that Mr. Genjira...off you go now."
134112211121.title: Warning, elephants may be escaping convicts.

1341122111211.content:
The remaining walk back to Konoha was uneventful. Naruto was badgering Sakura with all sorts of questions which she couldn't answer due to lack of human speech. He didn't seem to mind though, at least she was keeping him company. Sasuke on the other hand was quiet the whole way. Every time Sakura tried to reach over and grab him with her trunk, he'd push her away. It was almost like he was trying to ignore her, like she had betrayed him in some way. At least Naruto was distracting her from his icy cold shoulder.

Before she knew it, they were back in Tsunade's office reporting what had happened to the Hokage. How Sakura had been able to free them. How they fought there way out. And finally, the new development.

"...So then we were walking through the woods back here." said Naruto, "And Sasuke this idea to...uh...well..."

Naruto looked to Sasuke to explain Sakura's condition. Sasuke sighed and spoke.

"We think that this elephant is Sakura. She went missing when we left her alone with the male elephant those ninjas kidnapped. This elephant reacted in a way that only the Sakura we knew would when we tested her. Besides that, the elephant can preform jutsu, a feat beyond a normal animal."

Tsunade looked mildly surprised with her chin in her hand. She got up and walked over to Sakura, gently placing her hand on Sakura's forehead. Tsunade closed her eyes, Sakura could feel her chakra gently fill her body and vibrate with her own. Tsunade opened her eyes and spoke.

"You two know your teammate well, this is indeed Sakura's chakra. Why she has become a giant elephant I cannot say. But I will look into this matter further, and send several squads to inspect the bunk you three escaped from. In the meantime I suggest you go home, though Sakura should go with one of you. It should be..."
1341122111211.title: Sakura, revealed.

choices: She returns to her old self, but can assume elephant form again.
She becomes a half elephant/ half girl.
13411221112111.content:
"...Sasuke."

Naruto groaned, living with Sakura would be amazing even if she was an elephant. Sasuke looked like he had just received a shotgun blast to the groin but regained his normal cool composure. Tsunade dismissed them and they sent out home for the second time in one day. Naruto kept the atmosphere ablaze with conversation but when it was time for him to go down the street to his house, Sakura was left with the cold dread like silence from Sasuke. Sakura, again, tried to reach out to him with her trunk but Sasuke turned and said.

"What are you playing at? Knock it off!"

Raindrops starting dropping from the heavens, the clear day had turned into a stormy night. Rain poured like a sprinkler from the sky as thunder rumbled like a drum in the distance. The rain left Sakura completely soaked by the time they reached Sasuke's house. It was very empty and dark but filled with creaks and sounds. Sakura had an uneasy feeling that something terrible had happened here.

Sasuke grabbed a towel from a nearby rack and dried himself off.

"You will stay here. Don't bother me unless it's important."

And with that, he slammed the sliding door to his room shut. The living area, which was where Sakura was asked to sleep, was dusty and filled with leftover boxes of food. Old family photos aligned the wall, but in each shot there was someone standing next to Sasuke whose face had been ripped out. The entire house seemed depressing, tainted with a dark history of hatred. This made it a little troubling to sleep but Sakura found a soft spot on the floor and curled up to go to bed.

Morning brought some much needed light to the dank house. There was a knock on the door that woke Sakura up. Sasuke, who had been up for hours already, was speaking to a messenger from the Hokage. The conversation was short and the ninja took off with his task complete, Sasuke said only three words without even looking at Sakura.

"Tsunade wants you."

Sakura excused herself from the house while Sasuke left to go train. After a short trip to the Hokage's office, Sakura found herself sitting down in a large in door gymnasium with Tsunade.

"Alright Sakura, I don't know why it is you changed the way you did. But perhaps you can explain that to me once we've finished here. You see I did some research and may have found the way to return to you normal. This is going to require immense focus and chakra control though. Are you prepared?"

Sakura nodded, she had always been an expert on chakra control so this would be easy.

"Alright, what you must do is focus your chakra and reshape in yourself. You must think of your original form and shape your chakra to meet it. If it works you should be able to return to normal."

Sakura concentrated her chakra just as the Hokage asked. She had a vivid image of what she looked like before this mess and molded her inner energies to meet that form. She could feel chakra weave around in side of her. She opened her eyes to see that she was reducing in size! It was working, she was returning to normal!
13411221112111.title: Breaking the ice.

Her forelegs also lost some size, until they became arms, with fully working hands.

More and more changes occured, until Sakura was back to her old self.

"Phew! Thank you milady!" Sakura said bowing, before noticing that she was naked. Fortunately, her sensei planned ahead and handed her a second set of Sakura's usual clothes.

"Sakura, are you okay?" The Hokage asked. Her pupil seemed normal, but she had to check.

"Uh-huh."

"I see.Well, now that your back to normal, you should be able to refocus your chakara to resume elephant form any time you want." she explained.

"I won't get stuck again, will I?"

"No, so long as you have chakara you can switch forms." Tsunade explained.

"Alright, well thank you Lady Tsunade." Sakura said, her master then accepted her thanks and excused her.

On her way to her house, Sakura's mind wandered to Sasuke. He seemed mad earlier, and the pink haired girl had no idea why.

Sakura decided to go to the training grounds.

Once she was there, She saw Sasuke kicking a bunch of logs, even splitting some in half.

Sasuke then saw Sakura and...

"Hey, back to normal huh?"

and tried to talk to Ino.

134112211121111122.title: They find most of Konoha has been transformed.

"Ino doesn't even know who I am! She said that some men gave her these peanuts!"

"Alright, I'm tired of these games! Listen Ms. Jumbo, I put a curse seal on you and dark-eyes over here. If you don't get to reproducing with your mate over there, Uchiha'll be in for a literal shock. And don't try any jutsu, or he'll die instantly!"

It was rare that any ninja ever got a break from their duties. So when Tsunade offered Sakura a break from training with the simple task of collecting kelp while on vacation, she instantly jumped at the chance. A well earned rest from the constant beatings of the Hokage was well worth collecting a bunch of plants. However, Tsunade had neglected to tell her student where exactly her "vacation" was.

"A swamp?!" She yelled, standing in front of a large that read 'Baku Bog'. "I'm supposed to relax in a muddy swamp!?"

Needless to say, Sakura was not happy with her location of relaxation. There was nothing she could do though. Faced with living in a bog for a week or facing her master's wrath, Sakura regrettably had to chose the first option. She sighed and began to travel along the narrow wooden bridge that led through the tall overgrowth. For awhile, she couldn't see anything with cattails and tall grass but at least she spotted a clearing in the water. A small wooden house with a deck was at the end of the bridge. On the porch of said house was a short plump man. It looked like he hadn't shaven in weeks, and a thin piece of hay stuck out from a missing tooth. He spotted Sakura and gave a hearty chuckle.

"Well I'll be! If it ain't one of them ninjas! Hello there pretty lady, what are you doing here in the ol' Bog?"

"I was sent here by my mistress? Lady Tsunade? And please tell me this isn't where we stay for the night."

"Oh yes. That fetchin' lady. And don't you worry. This place is much bigger then it looks."

Sakura groaned and dropped her traveling bags to the ground. The man kindly picked them up for her and led her inside. Indeed, the house was much larger on the inside. Mostly because there was only one room. Aside from a few chairs, a table, a bed, and a couch, the only things inside were animal heads. Fearsome Alligator and Crocodile skulls lined the walls, there were even huge fish presented on plaques.

"My name's Billy, by the way. I own the only house out here on the Bog. Most people are too scared to live out here. Especially city folk like yourself."

Sakura poked one of the heads of the giant lizards. "Let me guess, crocodile problems?"

Billy gave a snort. "They have something to do with it yes. But what really keeps them away is one in particular. Now pay attention here, we have rules down in the bog little lady. Rule one is you don't go traveling alone out there on the bayou. Crocs and gators are one thing, but ol' Bloodeye is a completely different story."

"Bloodeye?"

Billy unbuttoned his shirt and pulled the collar down to expose his left shoulder. Near his neck, a large portion of his flesh was missing. Bite marks covered the giant scar. It even made Sakura, a trained medical ninja, a bit sick just looking at it.

"I've lived in this swamp for all my life. I've been bitten by crocs and mauled by gators. But let me tell you this. Bloodeye is a monster. He's a big black gator that lurks in the deepest waters of the marsh. Some folks say he's called Bloodeye because when he makes his kill, blood fills the water so much that he goes blind for a bit. That's a load of hooey. His eyes are blood red. Not a hint of mercy in em. I would know. I've met him twice. And if you think my shoulder is bad, you should see what he gave me the last time I met him."

Sakura gulped. So much for a restful vacation.

Billy put his shirt back on and became cheerful again. "Down let's settle down and have us some dinner!"

The sound of saws and tree falling filled the early morning air like the thundering of a hurricane. In a clearing which had once been a beautiful forest of Konoha's massive trees, a steel monstrosity crunched over the fallen giants as if they were mere twigs. Biting, slashing, chopping a path through the entanglement of nature.

"Alright! Take her nice and slow!" Shouted a foreman in a yellow hard hat. He was shouting to the machine's operator perched a good twenty feet above him in a seat.

The machine he was driving was an impressive display of Konoha ingenuity. It's massive black treads proved their power to climb over even the most daunting obstacles while a spinning array of saw blades butchered anything in front of the vehicle. The mammoth was unstoppable.

All along the side of the machine, dozens of workers were gathering up the less bulky remains of the giant trees while two squads of elite Konoha ninja covered them, eying the dark of the forest intensely.

The machine continued to lurch forward. Bits of wood and splinters blew in the wind caused by the onslaught. Several animals, panic driven and terrified, dove further into the woods to escape the massacre of the forest. The foreman smiled a dirty brown grin.

"Keep it up boys! We'll be finished by lunch!"

As if to taunt his words, an explosion on the right side of the machine caused the metal monster to come to a screeching halt. While the workers immediately scrambled for cover or to point out the flames, the ninja jumped high in the air towards the source of the attacks.

The mysterious saboteur stood high in the shadows of a neighboring tree. The squad leader of the first ninja squad pointed in the shadow's general direction as his teammates charged forward under his barking orders.

The shadowy person held what appeared to be a large silver staff. He raised it in the air slightly before slamming it hard into the tree. As if coming to life, the tree twisted and turned in the manner that a human would. It's strong limbs reached out and grabbed the approaching ninja, subduing them into submission.

Fast approaching behind them, however, was the second squad climbing up over their fallen comrades. The shadow responded accordingly, swing his staff around and assuming a fighting position. Several thrown kunai clanged off the metal rod as the first of the ninja landed to enrage him.

This ninja was an expert in hand to hand combat and made a chakra filled swing at the shadow. Nimbly, the shadow ducked from the blow and landed his own square in his attacker's chest. The impact sent the ninja flying backwards off the tree.

A second ninja hovered just out of range of the shadow. Making some hand signs, he took a deep breathe and released a gust of burning bright fire on top of the tree, apparently consuming the shadow before he could react.

As the flames died down, the treetop had been reduced to a smoldering bushel of firewood. However, at the center of the attack was a large blackened leaf where the shadow had been standing mere moments ago. A brief gust of movement under the leaf was all the second ninja had time to notice before feeling a powerful wave of pain in her gut.

The last ninja, by now realizing the odds weren't in his favor, stood mouth agape at the one who had already caused so much trouble in the few brief seconds that had transpired. Closing his left eye, the ninja touched his right eye with his index finger focusing directly at the identity of the revealed shadow.

The shadow was a boy, no older then seventeen. His hair was black and wild, covered with bits of leaf and twigs. His eyes were green and sharp like the forest's light. His clothes, were ragged yet stylized. It was if there was a distinct pattern to the red and blue lines on the ripped white clothe that covered him like a robe. Two earrings were clearly visible on the ears that jutted out from his mess of hair. But most noticeable was the painful looking scar that took the form of three slashing lines across the bridge of his nose and in front of his eyes.

~

"Do we know the name of the attacker?" Asked Tsunade, as she sat arms folded at her desk, looking at the image of the boy produced on the table. The last ninja to fight against the boy stood ashamed in front of the Hokage and next to his two teammates, battered but alive.

"No, my lady. We've searched all records, but nothings matches. He's a complete mystery. We apologize for our lack of skill to take down this perpetrator." Replied the ninja in a deep bow.

"No, none of that. Don't blame yourselves, this little brat's been the one giving us trouble with our resource gathering for weeks now. I'm glad you at least got us an image to go by now."

Tsunade stood up and paced the floor slightly before turning out the window.

"Three weeks...And we still we don't even have a quarter of the planned lumber we need to defend ourselves."

"My lady..."

"No. There's no sense denying it. We will not be ready when the war does comes...All because of this boy...And now we don't even know who he is. He could very well be a spy for the Land of War."

As the sun set outside the window, Tsunade clenched her fists hard.

"I will not see countless numbers of my people die because of a single saboteur. Fetch Shizune for me. We must spread the word. Any information on this kid...this..."

Tsunade paused and turned to the still image of the boy. The red slash marks caught her eye first.

"...This Scar. Any intelligence on him will result in a great reward."

~

The streets of Konoha had seen cheerier days, Sakura hadn't seen its people this depressed since the Third Hokage died. The weather seemed to reflect the mood, it was midday and rainy. Soggy puddles and the peeling wanted posters of some boy Sakura didn't recognize were more colorful then the faces of anyone around her.

She was kicking her feet in chair of a restaurant, watching the moody people go about their daily business. She sighed, for she knew very well the reason behind the sadness. War was coming.

According to Kakashi, Konoha had not been in a war since before Sakura and her teammates were born. He also mentioned to them that they should prepare themselves mentally, as well as physically. They should say good bye to any of their friends, because they might not know if that would be the last that they would see them alive. They should play with the knowledge that they might have to kill for the first time. As an added effect, Kakashi gave her team the day off to reflect and mediate.

Sakura sighed. Now the mood of the people around her was starting to affect her as well.

The enemy, the Land of War, was a nation Konoha knew next to nothing about. All anyone knew was that their army had been rampaging across the globe, destroying anything or anyone in their path. It just so happened that if their determined path was to be believed, Konoha lay directly in their line of war.

Now there were whispers that Konoha wasn't prepared for battle. A lone figure, a boy in the woods that surrounded the city, had been preventing the gathering of valuable resources necessary to reinforce the city with. Without them, they were leaving everything to chance. At least, that's what the hearsay mumbled.

Grumbling, Sakura took a sip of her water. She tried to push out the thoughts of war and depression from her head. Her friends had been through worse. They'd all come out of this alright. No sense in getting herself worked up over the prattle of gossip tellers.

As if to drive home the point, a familiar obnoxious voice yelled over to her. "Hey Sakura!"

For the first time all day, Sakura smirked slightly and turned to Naruto who had been rushing over to her. Perhaps it wouldn't be so terrible a day after all. He seemed in good enough spirits to share his unending energy.

As the two of them began their trip to Kakashi's desired meeting place, Naruto rubbed the painful bump on his head. He was used to Sakura's violent tendencies towards him at this point; he never bothered to complain about them and took them with gusto. Though not a word was spoken, they both knew well enough that they were friends no matter what happened, even if Naruto longed for something more.

Yes, it was no secret that Naruto had a crush on Sakura for the longest time. Ever since the academy Naruto had done just about everything to get her attention, he was willing to do anything for her. But both of them knew it but it never really meant anything. After all, Sakura's heart belonged to another.

"So..." Said Naruto, interrupting the long silence. "How are things with you and Sasuke going?"

Sakura fidgeted around uncomfortably. She had a feeling she knew where this conversation was going.

"Uh...Things are going just fine...The date on Saturday was fun." She tried to end the topic then and there with a definitive positive remark.

"Yeah, where did you guys go again?"

"Ichimaru's..."

Naruto started to sense the awkwardness of the moment he had created and replied with a simple. "Huh..."

Grateful for an end to his probing of information, Sakura tried to change the subject to relieve the tension.

"So...What does Kakashi need us for?"

"He wouldn't say. Mentioned something about a mission though, it sucks. Here I thought we had the day off."

Sakura laughed slightly, she was picturing Naruto spending his day off slurping down ramen at the bar. The look on his face suggested that it was probably exactly what he had in mind for today, only to be rudely cut off by their teacher's urgent request.

"You...Listen to Kakashi at all?" Asked Naruto.

"Huh? What do you mean?"

"I mean...He said some stuff about saying good bye to people. You know...The war..."

The look in Naruto's eyes changed.

"Come on, Naruto. I'm sure this is all just a scare. Rumors from other countries to shake up the village. I've never even heard of a Land of War. And they're going around rampaging the world?"

"I dunno...Look around."

The people around them all had a depressed look in their eyes. It was as if someone had told each of them that it was their last day on earth. Not a cheery person in sight.

"You ever see so many sad faces in your life? What if this is real?"

"That's why we're taking precautions with the reinforcing and training."

"Right, that's my point. Kakashi's never been so serious about something before in his life. Everyone's taking this seriously. But look my point is..."

They both stopped walking at the corner of one of the busier streets of Konoha. Naruto looked at Sakura dead in the eye.

"As corny as it sounds...I don't want to lose anyone. I've never dealt with actual lose before. I've never had someone to lose before. It...It scares me."

Sakura tried to smile and reassure the blond ninja. "No one's going to die Naruto. We're all going to get through this, whatever it is."

"I....I hope you're right."

They continued walking then, Naruto somewhat relieved but still confused. It felt like he had a brick weight in his chest. The thought of never seeing one of his long sought friends again was...horrifying. Sakura looked back briefly at the city streets behind him and blinked for just a moment.

"Weird..." She thought to herself. "Why do I get the feeling that this is the last time I'll see Konoha again...?"

After their brief talk, the two barely said a word again until they reached the roof of a building near the Hokage Monument. There Sasuke and, to everyone's surprise, Kakashi were waiting for them.

Clearing his throat, Kakashi spoke. "Now then. I must apologize to all you all immediately. I know I gave you the day of to prepare yourselves for the possible battle on the horizon, but this mission was by a direct request of the Lady Hokage."

He produced a golden scroll from his pouch and summarized its contents. "In short. Lady Tsunade is summoning several of the younger squads to track down a mysterious saboteur who's been wrecking havoc on our lumber machines. As a result to his continued assaults, the amount of resources we have is painfully limited for the war. We believe he has connections to the Land of War."

"The culprit's a male?" Asked Sasuke.

"Indeed, here's a picture of him."

Kakashi turned the scroll around so the picture was in plain sight to the ninjas. It was the same boy on all the wanted posters around the city. Sakura immediately took notice to the three large scars going across his face.

"He's been given the codename Scar, as his true identity is a mystery to us. Lady Tsunade believes that by scouting through the woods surround the city, we can flush him out for the more elite ninjas to take care of him. And that's where we come in."

"I get it..." Mumbled Naruto with a grin.

"Um. Kakashi-sensei." Said Sakura. "Is there anything else we can go on? I mean just a name and a face won't be enough if we actually DO find him. Are there any details we should be wary of?"

"As I said, most details concerning his identity, including jutsu he uses, are a complete mystery to us. All we know is that his weapon of choice is a long silver staff and he tends to use nature-based attacks."

"Sounds like a tree-hugging forest hippie." Said Naruto, smacking his fist together. "We can take him easy."

"Don't get cocky bonehead." Replied Sasuke. "Remember he's been able to avoid capture of the entire village for days now."

"Exactly." Said Kakashi, folding up the scroll. "Which is why I want you three to be extra careful when we head into the woods. Remember, if he is a member of the Land of War we will no next to nothing on how to confront him. If you run into him alone, don't fight him. Find the rest of us. Understood?"

"Yes sir." All three of them replied at once.

"Good. We set off for the forest in one hour. Pack any necessities and meet me at the gates."
