"If it were obvious I wouldn't be asking the question...What kind of teammates sneaks up his own teammate anyway?"

"...You're after the guy in the woods, aren't you!?" Naruto changed the subject.

"We're supposed to be after him..."

"No, you want to fight him, right!?"

"It's of no concern to you." Sasuke turned to leave.

"Kakashi said no to fight him!"

"Shut up, you have the same thing on your mind anyway."

"...That's...That's not the point! Shouldn't you be careful!? Sakura's probably worried sick about you!"

"If you're so worried about her, Naruto, then why don't you go follow her around instead of me?"

"Aren't you two dating!? Huh!?"

Sasuke paused slightly. "...It's of no concern to you. Get lost."

Sasuke jumped back up to the tree branches and started continuing further into the forest but Naruto had the chance to get up and follow him.

"Sasuke!"

~

"Ohh...I like that one..."

"Yeah, she's a cute one. I haven't seen a real woman in months..."

"Young too. Talk about luck."

"Heh, heh. I'm getting excited just thinking about it..."

"Shall we make our entrance?"

~

For the longest time now, Sakura had the sinking feeling that she was indeed being watched. It didn't help with the fact that forest seemed to get only darker and darker the further she traveled into it. As before, the rain continued to fall contributing to the creepy feeling that was building up in her gut like the feeling of vomit.

Sensing danger, Sakura tried to move faster. Someone was definitely out there. Out of the corner of her eye she noticed a large dark shadow moving from tree to tree. Then there was another one to her left. Then behind her. She was surrounded.

WHOOSH! CLANG! CLANG! Two kunai knife that had been throw at Sakura gracefully bounced off her own knife. But the defensive position meant she had to stop moving, if only for a brief second. That was all the large shadow on her right needed.

A mountain of a man, wearing a black suit and dark sunglasses came charging out of the trees, directly over Sakura. She didn't see his shadow until it was far too late. Her body slammed into her, taking her on a long trip down to the forest floor.

Sakura counted the time it took for both of them to land on the ground.

One seconds.

Two seconds.

Three sec-

CRACK! She felt herself landing harder then she expected. The sharp pain in the side of her body suggested that she at least had broken a rib, she was also coughing up a lot of blood meaning slight internal bleeding. However, if they really wanted to kill her there, they would have done so. Meaning they wanted something from her.

"Well, lookie her! This girl's a tough one." Said the giant man, holding Sakura up with one arm.

Sakura had reached for another kunai knife and stabbed the man hard in his overly muscular arm. It amounted to little more then a paper cut for the giant as he giggled slightly and tightened his grip. Sakura couldn't breathe now.

"No use struggling now girlie. You're outnumbered and over powered now."

She tried mouthing words like "You'll get nothing out of me." The giant laughed, as did his comrades who had gathered around her. He slammed her hard into a nearby tree.

"I think there's some misunderstanding. It's not information we want..." All three of the men started laughing sinisterly. One of them even started to undo his belt.

Now Sakura really started to panic. If she could breathe she'd be yelling as loud as she could for help. It was her these men wanted. After they used her they'd probably just kill her and toss her aside. They were barbarians. Tears started rolling down her cheeks as she kicked and squirmed with all her might, but to no avail.

"Heh, too bad." Said the giant as Sakura slowly started to lose consciousness. "I was hoping for something a bit more lively while we had our fun. She's gone and worn herself out now."

Her last thoughts turned to Sasuke...

~

"Tsk. And here I had hoped we'd have some real fun. It's like doing it with a corpse while they're like this."

"No different then when you do it with your wife, right Sizuke?"

All the men gave a rowdy laugh, except Sizuke of course. The giant placed the girl down on the ground and prepared to tear her clothes off.

"Now, who gets the first go?"

He turned around. Both of his comrades were lying on the ground motionless. There was some strange web like material covering their bodies, coming out from their mouths. It appeared to look like tree roots.

Between them and facing the giant was a small boy with wild black hair and a silver staff. A three line scar covered most of his face as he stared the giant down with his eyes under his mat of hair.

"Who the hell are you!?"

"Tyger Tyger. Burning bright, In the forests of the night..." Chanted he boy.

The giant roared and charged at the boy, fists prepared to pummel him into dirt. The boy jabbed his staff into the ground once, three blades suddenly jutted out from tip of the staff. With deadly precision and quick reflexes, the boy slashed three times across the giants chest.

The giant gargled on his own blood for a brief second before collapsing on the forest floor next to his fallen comrades.

"...What immortal hand or eye. Could frame thy fearful symmetry?"

The boy jabbed his staff once more into the dirt and the blades retracted. He surveyed the bodies of the three ninja and then turned his attention to Sakura's battered unconscious body.

"Did he smile His work to see? Did he who made the lamb make thee?"
135332122.title: A Meeting in the Woods.

choices: Sakura stays with the boy for a few days.
1353321221.content:
A million and one things were going through Sakura's head. Was she dreaming? No, if she was things would be making even less sense, and the sky would be raining rice balls or something strange like that. She hadn't been exactly unconscious when she felt the boy pick her up and carry her through the trees. But that all had to be a dream, right? He was the one they were after, the one they were out to hunt...

Yet when Sakura finally did wake up, she found herself in an unfamiliar world. She pinched herself on the cheek to make sure she hadn't strayed into some sort of dream again.

The room she was in was more like a cave made of wood. Solid and sturdy wood, it was like someone had hollowed out a gigantic tree and created an over sized bedroom. Of course, seeing that Sakura expected that furniture would be primal looking or roughly made but such was not the case. Everything was delicately and expertly crafted, from the single stain glass window to her left to the smooth oak bed she had been sleeping in. Even the bed sheets were soft like sheep's wool.

Sakura slowly sat up and looked down at what she was wearing, a single long white shirt which appeared to made of cotton...she was wearing nothing else. Blushing, she covered herself up and looked around for her clothes; they were no where to be seen, not even on the chair across from the bed.

She gritted her teeth and cursed to herself. "Where am I...?"

As she tried to get up, she flinched in pain. She suddenly came to the realization that there was something binding her rib cage to a splint. Had she broken her ribs? Still sitting in bed, she paused to think and remember what had happened before she blacked out.

She was in the forest. Then there were people following her. They attacked her. They defeated her and tried to violate her. Then nothing, save for being carried through the forest by...The boy they had been after. Scar. But what had happened to the attackers? And more importantly what happened to Scar?

Sakura continued to grumble insults to herself as she pulled herself out of bed. Easier said then done with a few broken ribs, it felt like her insides were rubbing against each other. Eventually though, with a bit of time and patience, she managed to pull herself to the edge of the bed. It was there she discovered another surprise, two soft pink slippers waiting at the floor of the bed. Everything was just almost too perfect.

"...What's all this about?" She muttered as she kicked the slippers slightly, expecting a rabid animal to jump out of them.

But nothing happened, she just sighed and diligently obeyed the strange presence of the footwear by slipping them on. Standing up proven to be an even greater challenging then sitting up. But after cracking her bones slightly, Sakura was able to stand on her wobbly two feet and hobbled her way to the door which was cracked open slightly. It seemed like someone had set everything up just so, knowing exactly how she would react when she woke up. Worse, she felt like she was being watched.

Still, she put such ominous thoughts to the back of head and continued limping to the door.

The door opened with an ear shattering creak, Sakura expected that anyone around would hear it. But when she looked out into the next room, she was greeted with a rather discouraging sight.

"Stairs..." Her shoulders drooped slightly.

It was a ring of stairs, in fact, long and winding going all the way up at least three stories. Sakura groaned and braced herself for the long climb.

"Relax..." She told herself. "Just take this nice and easy...Right foot...Left foot..."

While talking comforted herself, she still winced in agony after every step was made. At least the sights around her were beautiful, if she would pause from her ordeal and looked up from her feet. Following the stairs up was an array of wooden statues, each carved as a powerful looking animal like a bear or a tiger. The statues were also expertly done and ranged in age as Sakura ascended the stairs. Eventually when she finally did reach the top, there were several empty pedestals left. At the top of the stairs was a large hickory door with the only piece of metal in the entire place so far severing as it's handle.

Sakura breathed in and out with a mixture of relief and exhaustion. Her ribs felt smashed to bits and her body ached. How wounded was she exactly? She didn't have a mirror to take a look at herself nor did she have time to look down and inspect her body. Sweat dripped down her arms as she reached out and pulled the old door open.

Opening the door, Sakura expected something grand like a large dining hall or a magnificent throne room. Instead, the view was a thousand times more beautiful. The Konoha forest lay out in front of, more open and pristine then she could ever imagine in. Bits of dew made the millions of trees sparkle like dimaonds as the sun rose in the distance, it was morning of the next day already. The door had lead to a balcony looking over the grand woods. And standing on that balcony front of her was the boy on the wanted poster.

"You..." Began Sakura.

The boy turned, his eyes invisible under his mat of hair. "I?"

There was a moment of silence between the two as the morning wind spoke for them with its usual whistling tune. Sakura was unsure of what to say to this boy, had he rescued her? She wasn't sure, but he did not appear to be hostile. Her eyes turned to her feet and then to the boy's scar, which had to serve as his eyes considering she couldn't see them to look into them.

"...Who are you?"

The boy smiled warmly. "I don't know. Who are you?"

Sakura blinked in confusion. "You...You don't know?"

But the boy pretended not to hear her second question and didn't answer, he seemed far more eager for a reply to his own question. Sakura sighed and gave him her name.

"Sakura. Sakura Haruno."

"Ah, it is nice to have a name to your face Sakura. Well done on getting up with your injuries."

Sakura winched in pain slightly at the word. "Was...I hurt that bad?"

"Very much so, though nothing life threatening. Two broken ribs, a few dozen bruises around your neck, and plenty of minor scratches."

"Did you...Rescue me?"

"Yes."

"Then thank you....Uh..."

The boy looked at her with confusion. "What?"

"...I...Uh...Don't know what to call you...You don't have a name?" She returned to her question.

"I told you, I don't know who I am."

"But...You said it yourself, it's nice to have a name to a face..."

"Indeed, it must be nice."

Sakura huffed. He was being difficult.

"You can call me whatever you wish. It doesn't matter who am I, it's what I am that defines me."

"Oh? And...What are you, exactly?"

"A protector."

"Then...You aren't from the Land of War?"

"The Land of War?"

"Yes, you know...I think...Those guys who attacked me...They were from the Land of War...The ones you saved me from."

"I didn't save you."

Sakura blinked in surprise. "You...You didn't?"

The boy took a step forward towards her. "No, I recruited you."
1353321221.title: An Awaking in the Woods.

13533212211.content:
That was the last time Sakura had any sort of vocal communication with the boy for a few days. Mostly, they just kept to themselves as Sakura's wounds slowly recovered. Though that may have seemed difficult, it was rather easy for Sakura to go for hours without even seeing the boy, the tree-building they were in was so large you could walk around for what felt like miles and not come across the same room twice.

Of course, in her condition Sakura had little time or energy to be walking around. Her ribs were still greatly injured, so much so that it hurt just to sit up at times. The boy seemed to understand this, though Sakura never complained about it, and left herbal medicine packets and some crutches at her bedside. Aside from that, he showed no interest in Sakura at all. She'd often ponder why he even brought her to his hideout to begin with.

"No, I recruited you." That last words he said to her. What did he mean that he recruited her? Why would someone deliberately take in someone who had been actively hunting them? He seemed fully aware that Sakura had been looking for him, she found a crumpled wanted poster of him at the base of the stairs after all. And yet, he had rescued her from certain death and even treated her wounds. Nothing made sense with him.

On the fourth day, Sakura woke up once again probably at around midday. She noticed that the door in the corner of the room was opened slightly, had the boy been visiting? Rubbing the sand out of her eyes, she looked around the room for signs of life.

That's when she saw it, in the corner of the room gnawing on a pillow roughly the size of her was a striped tiger easily twice the size as a normal one. It was glaring her at right with a look of death in its eyes.

Sakura was still hurt and bedridden, with no way to defend herself. What choice did she have?

She screamed.

~

"You could stir a hornet's nest a mile away with a scream like that." Said the boy.

"What the hell was that thing doing in my room! I almost had a freaking heart attack!"

Sakura was safe and sound back at the balcony of the tree again. After she had screamed, the boy had burst into the room and carried her to safety. Of course, Sakura was still just a little freaked out.

"I had lured him in there."

"You...What!? Why!?"

"To see how you would react." The boy had a completely straight face.

"To see how- I could have been mauled to death!"

"He wouldn't have harmed you until you started shouting."

"Look, I get it okay! I can tell just by looking around here that you're close to nature and everything but you put a giant tiger in the same room I was sleeping in! I'm lucky I didn't wake up dead!"

The boy stared at her blankly. He then closed his eyes for a bit longer then a standard blink.

"I'm not like you, okay!? I'm thankful that you saved me from those guys, but I must return home! There are people who are probably worried about me and-"

"Shh..." Said the boy.

"What!?"

"Be quiet."

He seemed to be listening for something, like someone was whispering in his ears. Sakura couldn't hear anything though, she gave him a puzzled and angry look.

"Fifty miles, north east..." Muttered the boy.

"Pardon?"

"They're back. Come."

"What?"

Then, without warning or responding, the boy grabbed her by the wrist. He pulled her off the balcony as both of them descended into the thicket of the forest below.

~

Sakura had long ago lost where she was. All the forest began to look the same at some point, she could have sworn they had passed the same trees tens times already.

But the look in the boy's eye suggested that he knew exactly where he was going. Like an animal obeying a distance call, he honed in on some invisible noise in the air, dragging Sakura along with him. He was carrying her piggyback styled, to avoid further injuring her. And Sakura could tell that he was being extra careful with each jump from branch to branch he made.

It was only ten minutes into their journey when Sakura finally ask. "Where are we going?"

"To watch."

"To watch what?"

When he didn't respond after ten jumps from the tree branches, Sakura became impatient and shouted.

"Will you please stop being such a mystery!? Where are we going!?"

"To see the sins of our labors."

That didn't exactly answer her question, but she kept quiet out of frustration. Talking to this guy was like talking to a water wheel, it seemed to always go around in circles.

When he came to a sudden halt, Sakura snapped back to reality.

"Behold, on the dull earth."

Sakura looked over his shoulder. Instead of miles of forest as there would normally be, she saw a virtual wasteland of fallen timber and ripped up stumps. Every area she laid her eyes on had the feel of loss and destruction. What was worse, a large steel machine was still hard at work tearing up the rest of the forest. Sakura could make out several people from Konoha walking along the sides of it.

"Wh-what are they...?"

But the boy didn't answer and instead gently let her down on the tree branch. He watched with a solemn look on his face but otherwise did nothing.

Sakura took a closer look at the forests the machine was cutting into. Animals who had long made their homes in the grand trees were scrambling like mad to escape the butchering. Sakura tugged the boy on the shoulder.

"Aren't you going to do something!? They're destroying the homes of those animals!"

"What do you care?"

"Of course I care! Can't you stop them!?"

"I could, but that's not the point."

Sakura watched in horror as one young lion got separated from its mother, the large grinding wheels of the machines violently snapped the trees closer and closer to the poor animal. She turned away, the lion didn't get away in time.

There was a serious look in the boy's eyes. "What are YOU going to do about it?"

Sakura gritted her teeth and looked at the machine. Maybe if she ran up to them, maybe if she explained what kind of damage they were doing to the woods they'd stop. Without thinking rationally, she jumped from the tree and landed hard on her feet.

The pain in her ribs was excoriating, but she ran out into the fields of fallen lumber. She didn't stop until she reached the machine.

"STOP IT! YOU'RE KILLING THOSE ANIMALS! STOP!"

Whoever was operating the machine didn't hear her, and the others walking next to it just ignored her and continued with gathering up the bits of leftover wood. She had to stop it.

In another example of irrational thinking, she started climbing up the wheels. If she could just jam something into the gears, it might be enough to halt the machine so that Sakura could explain what was going on.

At this point, she had probably undone the healing a few days of rest had done for her ribs but she didn't care. She was too focused with reaching the top of the wheel. So focused that she didn't see that the fabric of her skirt had gotten caught in the spokes of the wheel.

In an instant, she felt herself get yanked right off the wheel. She was getting pulled into the grinders! There was no safe place for her to grab, no way to pull herself free! The grinders were inches away from her head. She closed her eyes and-

Then there was the ripping of fabric, Sakura felt herself getting carried away to safety. She opened her eyes...

1353322121.content:
"How did I get talked into this one again...?" Muttered Sakura as she stepped out into the freezing cold winter day. It was so cold out in Konoha today that the frost felt like it was biting her uncovered nose.

Today's weather wasn't helping with her bad mood either. Most teams got their missions canceled today, on account of terrible and dangerous weather. Seriously, in some areas of the Land of Fire the snow was said to be up as high as seven feet. But Lady Tsunade apparently had a special mission for her, JUST her. And it being the Hokage, how could Sakura refuse? Naruto, Sasuke, and Kakashi all got the day off and were probably spending it enjoying hot springs or something.

There was no one out on the streets today, save for the occasional shop keeper desperately trying to shovel the snow off their sidewalk. It wasn't long before Sakura stood in front of the Hokage's tower.

Stepping inside, Sakura was greeted with a blast of heat which caused her to sweat under her massive coat and winter gear.

There was an angry voice on the other side of the Hokage office door. "Lady Tsunade, are all these heaters necessary? I mean we're wasting power! What will the villagers think?"

"Come on Shizune. It's nearly thirty below out there! Everyone is trying to do whatever they can to keep warm."

Sakura knocked on the door. "End of discussion Shizune, come in whoever that is!"

Meekly, the pink haired ninja stepped into the office. "Ah, Sakura! Just the person I was expecting! Come in, come in! Have a seat! Shizune, get us some hot cocoa."

Shizune mumbled something about "wasting the villager's money" but did as she was told. Tsunade was wrapped in a giant green blanket covering her pajamas, apparently Shizune had to drag her out of bed today. She must hated the cold.

"Sorry to bother you on a day like today Sakura. Actually yours and Team Guy's missions are the only ones I have assigned today."

"Team Guy? Why? What are they doing?"

"Oh they're off to some tropical island helping a rich elderly woman babysit her pet cat for a week. Normally I would only give that sort of job to some wet-behind-the-ears Genin, but Guy insisted that his team needed the time on the island for some training."

"Training my butt..." Thought Sakura.

"Anyway!" Said Tsunade, sipping a cup of hot chocolate. "Onto your mission. Are you aware what the temperature is outside, Sakura?"

"Umm...Minus Thirty?"

"Exactly! There hasn't been a day colder than today in years. Konoha has seen the arrival of some new wildlife over the last few days; animals that probably haven't been around these parts for centuries."

Tsunade stood up and looked out her office window at the winter wonderland. "One group of rare polar bears, the Momoiro Polar Bears, have made their first appearance in the Land of Fire in probably two hundred years. These bears are extremely gifted. Their rare pink hides are worth a fortune on the black market. And they're actually extremely intelligent. In fact they have created natural cures for diseases that outclass some of our own."

Sakura was beginning to dread where this mission was going. "So...You want me to observe these bears?" Sitting on her butt in the freezing cold watching a bunch of overweight bear was not something she was looking forward to.

Tsunade smiled. "Not...exactly."

"Huh?"

"Well, these bears are extremely cautious and territorial. Getting near them through normal methods has proved fruitless. But we believe we may have found a solution. And since you're my apprentice and all, I thought there would be no better person I could trust with this than you."

Getting near the bears without the usual spying methods? "What do you mean, a solution?"

"Well..."
1353322121.title: An Unusual Observation Mission.

13533221211.content:
"We have a special suit prepared for you." Tsunade said.

"A suit?" Sakura asked, she didn't see how a simple suit would confuse the bears.

"Yes, you know how ninja have to constantly expend chakra to hold a transformation jutsu?" Tsunade asked, "Well this suit is made of a combination of Momoiro skin, and a synthetic alloy that recycles chakra that one expends, so far we can only get it to work for transformation jutsu though, and even then other jutsu are unusable. When one wears the suit and activates the transformation jutsu, their body takes the exact physiology of a Momoiro bear."

"But Lady Tsunade, why not get Jonin to do this mission, if you don't mind my asking." Tsunade's youngest apprentice asked.

"During the testing period, we found that the wearer's natural hair color will become their fur color in bear form. Initially Shizune tried, but was rejected due to her coloration. That's why we need you, your hair color matches the bear's exactly." Tsunade said, looking at a somewhat embarrassed Shizune.


Sakura could see that this was important to Tsunade, and even though she wanted to stay warm, she knew duty came first to a shinobi. "Alright."

Tsunade smirked "Good, your mission begins...."
13533221211.title: A Momoiro Bear suit

135332212112.content:
"Tomorrow."

Sakura was a little confused. "Why tomorrow? I mean I'm completely prepared now...I think..." Actually becoming a bear wasn't something Sakura felt she was up to. But she knew her duty.

Tsunade rubbed her head and blushed. "Well...The thing is this suit isn't exactly easy to get in and out of. It's not dangerous, but the process takes time to prepare for the next wearer and allow the current one to leave the suit. In fact Shizune just spent all of yesterday as a bear, we just got her out of it this morning."

"You're kidding..." Come to think of it, Sakura seemed to recall seeing Tsunade walking around talking to a bear in her office yesterday. But she just assumed it was something she summoned.

Lady Shizune looked somewhat annoyed. "Not my finest moment, but yes I did spend yesterday as a bear. You don't have to worry about being cold Sakura. It's like wearing a fur coat for every part of your body."

Tsunade laughed and put her hand on Sakura's shoulder. "You see! Nothing to be worried about, right Sakura?"

"I'm not nervous." That was a complete lie.

"Well good. Here's the plan then. Be here by sunrise tomorrow morning and we'll fit you into the suit. We have plenty of time, this blizzard isn't expected to leave Konoha for another two weeks. But still, the more time you can spend with those bears the more you help the village. Okay Sakura? We're counting on you."

"Yes, Lady Tsunade."

~

Later that night, the wind howled outside as the snow continued to fall. Bits of frost clung to the windows as Sakura, still wide awake, watched from the covers of her bed. She had spent the entirety of her day doing stuff she wouldn't be able to do for at least half a month. This wasn't like the normal week a way missions she used to go on. She was actually going to become an animal and live out in the wild.

Despite what she said earlier to Lady Tsunade, she was nervous. Very nervous. Maybe it would be one thing if the animals she was observing were squirrels or something harmless. But these were giant bears, that could probably eat her feet off if they really wanted to.

There was also the matter of the suit and if it would really work or not. Lady Shizune tested it and said it worked fine, but what if there was the slim chance something went wrong? What if she was stuck as a bear for the rest of her life?

She shook it off and closed her eyes. "Don't be a coward. What would Sasuke or Naruto do? You gotta be brave..."

~

Tsunade yawned, she looked terrible. "Morning Sakura..."

"Uh, good morning Lady Tsunade."

"Shizune! Is the suit ready yet?"

Lady Shizune was in the corner looking over what appeared to be a giant brown rug. "Lady Tsunade, please. I know it's early but show some patience. It will be ready in just a few minutes."

Tsunade sighed and asked Sakura again. "Nervous?"

Sakura couldn't lie, her heart was pounding. "A little..."

Tsunade grinned. "Don't worry, it's just for a couple of weeks. We've tested this thing dozens of times and have yet to get any errors. Smile a little and make the best of it."

13533221211211.title: Stuck as a Hybrid

choices: The zipper's attached to her fur & skin
135332212112111.content:
Tsunade got up from the floor, as the Lady Hokage looked at her Ursine of a a pupil & asked, "Well Sakura, how are you feeling?"

Sakura, still looking at herself just to get a sense at what she now looked like as a Momoiro Bear, responded to Tsunade & said, "If you mean if I'm still alive, Lady Tsunade. Then yes, I'm fine." But as the other technicians got up from the massive blast of chairs, Tsunade noticed Sakura's new form & became both intrigued & worried for Sakura, as she said, "Interesting. Very interesting."

"What do mean 'interesting'?" Sakura asked, as she question her mentor's intrigue on her transformation. Then, Tsunade slowly circled the Ursine Sakura, as she answered, "Your transformation, Sakura. Momoiro Bears are known to be fully bipedal like humans. However, the suit was designed to be more like that of a regular animal walking on four legs & all..."

Tsunade then circled toward the front of Sakura & continued speaking, as she said, "...And yet for some miraculous reason, the suit fused with your body & made you a Momoiro Bear, without making you a feral bear yourself." Tsunade was right about one thing; Sakura was still herself, even though she now had the body of a Momoiro Bear. However, for some odd reason, Sakura somewhat liked being a Momoiro Bear.

Tsunade then had a chakra technician head up to a mobile lift, as he drove it toward Sakura. The Ursina Sakura turned her head & saw the chakra technician on the mobile lift approach her, then she looked back at Tsunade as she said, "Um, Lady Tsunade..What is he doing?" "Don't worry about him, Sakura. Kyono here is just making sure the zipper on the suit is still there, so we can get you out of the Momoiro Bear suit when your mission is completed."
135332212112111.title: Sakura the Momoiro Bear

choices: Sakura then runs away from Tsunade & the others (Fear)
1353322121121111.content:
The technician, known as Kyono, parked the mobile lift only inches away from Sakura's back. He then climbed onto her back to check if the suit's zipper was still there. The zipper was still there, fully zipped up, as Tsunade yelled, "Is the suit's zipper still on her?" Kyono only spread his right arm out with a thumbs up, as he then stopped doing the thumbs up and focused on trying to pull down the zipper handle.

But this was where he hits a wall; the zipper handle was stuck, so Kyono started pulling harder on the zipper handle, hoping to getting it working again. However, as Kyono was tugging on the jammed zipper handle, Sakura could feel it, as if the technician was pulling on her spine, each tug on the zipper handle becoming more painful.

Losing patience, Tsunade then yelled, "What's taking so long, Kyono? I thought unzipping these suits are easy!" "They are, Lady Tsunade. It's just that somehow this zipper handle is jammed up!" Kyono answered, as he pulled harder on the zipper handle.

But as Kyono pulled harder on the zipper handle, Sakura felt the skin & fur on her upper back being heavily tugged on by Kyono trying to get the zipper open. That was from the tugging that Sakura the Momoiro Bear quickly realized something was very wrong, as she thought, "Wait a sec..The zipper? Something's gone wrong!" But then, out of nowhere.....

RRRRIIIIIPP!!!!! Kyono managed to get the zipper & zipper handle to come off, but not without taking a large bit of flesh from Sakura's Ursine body. "OOOWWRRROOOAAAARRR!!!" Sakura shrieked, as her own scream of pain sounded like a mix between her human scream & a Momoiro Bear's roar. Then, Kyono quickly looked at Sakua's wound & realized that the zipper fused with her new body, as he saw what appeared to be Sakura's Ursine spine seen visibly in between her muscles. In slight anger, she grabbed Kyono by his right leg & threw him right through a wall, as he landed on the snow outside.
1353322121121111.title: This is gonna hurt. Literally!

13533221211211111.content:
Sakura then felt her back with her left paw, as she felt some blood on her pink fur. "Y-You...You tried to kill me!!" Sakura yelled in fear, as she ran out of the large hole she from throwing Kyono & ran off into the snowy Konoha Forest. Tsunade felt like she betrayed her own pupil from trying to open up the zipper on Sakura's back.

However, as her ninja bodyguards were about to chase Sakura, Tsunade said, "Wait!" The bodyguards stopped dead in their tracks, waiting for her to give them orders, but she said, "Let Sakura go. I just don't want her to feel like she's a monster." The ninja bodyguards nodded in respect, as they walked back to where they originated from.

Tsunade looked out the large hole, losing sight of Sakura the Momoiro Bear, as the former female ninja ran deeper into the snow-covered Konoha Forest, getting farther away from Konoha Village.
13533221211211111.title: Feeling Betrayed

choices: Lady Tsunade & her ninjas imprisoned her (Captured)
135332212112111112.content:
After a few hours of running through the snow-covered Konoha Forest, Sakura finally lost sight of the village she called 'home'.

She noticed the large chunk of skin dangling from her upper back, where Kyono tried to open the zipper from. Sakura, afraid of being captured and branded as a monster, ripped the dangling chunk of skin with her left Ursine-like hand, as the chunk of skin fell to the snowy ground. Then, Sakura felt the wound on her upper back with her right Ursine-like hand, as her paw-like fingers felt the exposed spinal column & bits of muscle and blubber on her upper back.

Sakura then saw that the sun was setting, and as that happened, the temperature began to get even colder, reaching to temperatures around Zero Degrees Fahrenheit. But as the temperature dropped, the snow began to blow harder in the wind. Most of the time, a Momoiro Bear would shrug off the extra cold due to the blubber on their bodies acting like snowsuits.

However, due to Sakura's injury on her upper back, her body temperature slightly decreased, making her body shiver, feeling the cold. "I-I....need to find....shelter." She aid, as she continued walking forward, going deeper into the depths of Konoha Forest, crossing her meaty Momoiro Bear arms for warmth.

An hour later, nightfall came. The wind howled through the darkness, as the snow & cold air bit at anyone or anything in it's path. Unfortunately for Sakura the Momoiro Bear, she was one of those things. But as she walked through the snow, the former ninja began to lose consciousness. Her movement slowed down until she slumped down on the snow-covered ground.
135332212112111112.title: Alone in Konoha Forest at Night

13533221211212.content:
It felt like a miniature vacuum had been placed inside the suit. The fur was becoming skin tight on Sakura' body. Lady Shizune was right, this thing WAS warm. Tsunade had a perplexed look on her face though.

"Hmm. It's taking longer than usual."

Sakura began to panic. "What? This that bad!?"

"No, it's probably just because we...hadn't tested it on a smaller subject. I don't think it matters though, look the first step is done. It will start to take in your chakra now."

There was a loud click as the suit warmed up. Sakura felt her chakra flow gently out from her body and into the furry suit. It was empowering it; making it almost a living entity. Her hands were beginning to feel like she was holding onto a hot coal.

"See? It's moving onto step two." Said Tsunade. "Look at your arms."

The brown bear fur looked almost like it was lighting up on fire. But really it was changing its color from dirt brown to bubblegum pink, the color of her hair. In a mere matter of moments the entire suit had recolored itself.

Tsunade and Shizune took a few steps back to give her some room.

"Alright Sakura." Said Shizune, using the most calming voice she had. "This part is going to feel really weird. The suit is going to use your chakra to reshape your entire body. Everything from your bones to your body fat is going to be molded into a polar bear's form. Try not to freak out."

Easier said than done. Almost instantly, Sakura felt a tingling feeling work its way all through her body. She was beginning to feel bloated while at the same time more powerful. Inside her body, the chakra was supercharging her muscles as well as increasing her fat. The changes were hardly noticeable at first. But eventually a slight potbelly began to appear under the suit.

While Sakura was distracted with her increasing waistline, another subtle change was occurring with her bones. They were lengthening and becoming stronger. Bit by bit Sakura's height and width were expanding. Before she even knew it, she was taller than Tsunade.

Standing on two legs was getting strange, Sakura tried taking a step but would have fell on the ground were it not for Shizune and Tsunade catching her.

"Careful Sakura." Said Tsunade. "You'd best not try to walk, polar bears aren't exactly balanced on two feet."

Sakura understood why that had given her room earlier, balancing was getting really difficult. As she grew and grew, new changes made an appearance on her body. She felt a little nub jut out from her backbone, which she presumed was her new tail. Her jaw felt a little further away from her face than before as well. She was a good head taller than both of the woman in front of her.

Eventually, she just couldn't balance anymore and landed on all fours with a rumbling thud. It was strange because she didn't feel heavy enough to shake the entire building, it must have been all her new muscles relieving the weight of the fat.

The tingling began to fade as the finishing touches of the transformation turned her completely into a polar bear. It didn't feel like she was wearing a suit at all. And the new strength as size was...oddly invigorating. Lady Tsunade walked up to her massive pink form and examined something on her back.

"Everything seems to check out...Anatomy perfect. Muscle strength adequate. Suit lock-up...Uh oh."

That "Uh oh" made Sakura feel like she was standing outside in the freezing cold, naked. Uh oh was not good. And what did suit lock-up mean?

"Lady Tsuande..." Sakura was surprised she could still speak. "W-what's wrong?"

"Well...It looks like your small size was a factor in the process. I guess the suit used up so much energy shaping you into a bear at your child-like size that it seized up. Don't worry though, it should be reversible when we get the hardware team to look at it. Hopefully, it's nothing to severe."

"Hopefully!?" Thought Sakura.

"But maybe it would be best if we canceled the mission. Your safety as a village ninja is more important than research. It's up to you if you want to go through with this, I'll talk to some of the elders and explain what happened." Tsunade sighed. She and the village elders never did see eye to eye.

Part of Sakura was screaming to cancel the mission and get this thing off of her as soon as possible. But at the same time she would have felt extremely guilty at not only letting her village down but giving Lady Tsunade further problems with the elders.

She sighed. What should she do?
13533221211212.title: Now when you say "Locked"...

choices: The bear talks back to her
The bear seemingly ignores her and goes to the others
135332212112121.content:
In the end, Sakura decided that the best thing to do was continue the mission.

There was no point in staying around the village as a bear, and if people (mainly Ino) found out, she'd never live it down. Worst of all...Sasuke might think it was her fault she screwed up and say she had no talent!

"I'll go on with it Lady Tsunade." Sakura said.

While relieved, the Hokage was still considering her pupil. "Are you sure?"

"Yes, we've come this far, it'd be a shame to waste this chance over a minor mistake."

Tsunade nodded. "Alright then," Tsunade then walked to Sakura and clipped something onto her ear. "This will allow us to track and communicate with you, just remember to keep it, and yourself, safe."

"Yes Milady, but how'll I get out of here?" Sakura asked, referencing the door's size.

Tsunade merely pressed a hidden button on her desk, and stairs appeared before Shizune explained.

"We have a special set of escape stairs for emergencies. We'll take you to the path closest to the bears before leaving you."

"Alright then." Sakura replied.

A while later, the three ladies (or two ladies and a she-bear?) had come to the outside.

"Goodbye Sakura, and good luck." Tsunade said.

"Goodbye Lady Hokage." Sakura said, before going.

As Sakura stumbled in the snow, she found a Momoiro bear.

"Found you!" Sakura exclaimed.
135332212112121.title: Grin and bear it.

1353322121121211.content:
And Sakura had thought her size was enormous. This polar bear was just gigantic, she heard of some bears reaching heights of over fifteen feet tall when standing on both legs in the north. But she had never expected to actually see one. For once, she was thankful that she too was a large bear; that thing would tower over her if she was in human form.

Sakura wasn't quite sure how to approach this monster. Lady Tsunade had apparently left out that tiny detail. Chances are if she just ran over to it and said "Hello! Nice to meet you!" she'd end up mauled to death. But if she didn't act quickly, she'd miss her chance.

"Maybe if I just calmly walk over to it, it will notice me..." She thought to herself. Taking a deep breath, she tried to encourage herself. "Come on...Don't chicken out now. The village is counting on you to do this. You gave Tsuande your word."

If she still had human knees, they're be shaking. She approached the beast as quietly as she could, hopefully it would go away and not notice her.

No such luck. When Sakura was a good few yards away from the bear, it seemed to sense her and spun around. There was blood-thirst in its eyes. Every nerve in her body was telling Sakura "Get the hell out of there!", but she couldn't move. Her legs were frozen in fear.

Much to Sakura's horror, the bear was moving closer to her. It's two foot long head was directly in front of her face, she could feel the hot steam funneling out of its nose. It was sniffing her!

"Please don't eat me...Please don't eat me...Please don't eat me..." Sakura chanted in her head.

The expression changed on the bear's face. It took a few steps back and stood up on it's hind legs. Oh no! Bears only did that when they were really, REALLY angry. There was no way to outrun it, Sakura closed her eyes and waited to feel a stinging swipe of its paw. But then the polar bear did the last thing she would have expected.

It started laughing. Not like grunting or growling, but actual laughter! It raised a paw to wipe the tears out of its eyes. That's when it said it a loud male voice.

"Harharharhar! Hello there girlie! You're not here after my hide, are you!? And stuck like that...What did you lose a bet!? Harharharhar!"

Never before had Sakura felt such a mixture of shock and relief. A bear, that had moments ago been walking on four legs like a beast, was actually talking to her!

"You...You can speak...?"

"Harhar! Of course I can! What, is this your first day being a bear?"

"Something like that..."

"Don't worry girl! Just by looking at you I can tell what happened. You're human, aren't you?"

Her cover was blown already. "H-how did you know that?"

The great bear shook his head. "Mannerisms, smell, lack of knowledge...You don't make a very good spy my dear. But don't worry, I'm not going to do anything barbaric like kill you. If anything I'm perplexed as to why the humans are so keen on getting information by having one of their own disguise themselves as one of us. Explain, if you could."

Sakura was starting to get more comfortable around the bear. He wasn't trying to kill her earlier, it was just self defense. Clearly these bears harbored no love for humans, Sakura recalled Tsunade saying that their hides fetched a high price on the black market...

"S'matter?" Asked the bear. "Come now, I already told you I won't bite. Oh right, you humans tend to be more civil in your introductions. Very well then. Name's Ichikuma, I'm the leader of a local sloth of my brethren. What's your name?"

"Sakura Haruno..."

"Sakura, eh? That's a fitting name for one of our kind. Shame you aren't a true Momoiro! Harharhar!"

The conversation warmed up a bit after that, as Sakura began her tale of how she got in this predicament.

~

About an hour later, both of them had sat down in the snow as Sakura finished her story.

"I see, so they've sent you out here to learn you say? If you weren't standing in front of my own two eyes now I wouldn't believe it. You humans have never tried to learn from us..."

"Then you can't have met many decent humans than?"

"I can't say I have." Ichikuma lifted one claw and pointed at a jagged scar going down his face. "That was from the last time I let my guard down around a human."

Sakura gulped. "W-why do you trust me then?"

"Well, firstly from you story you got yourself stuck like this just to learn from us. I'd be dishonoring the Momoiro if I just turned you away after you endured so much. And second..." He stared deep into her emerald eyes. "...You remind me of someone I knew."

The giant polar bear stood and motioned for her to do the same. "Come. I'll introduce you to the 'clan'."
1353322121121211.title: Welcome to the group.

choices: He introduces her as a human.
He keeps her identity a secret.
13533221211212111.content:
Tsunade sat, staring out into blizzard that covered all of the Leaf Village. She was on her eight cup of hot chocolate already, and just by looking outside you'd never know this was the the Land of Fire. More like the Land of Sleet and Ice.

But it was not the chilly weather that put her in the sudden chocolate beverage craze.

"Lady Tsunade." Spoke Shizune, as she sat down next to her mistress. "Please relax. Sakura is a trained ninja of Konoha, she'll be fine."

"I'm not nervous." Answered Tsunade, absentmindedly tossing the clay cup over her shoulder. "Have you spoken to the tech team in charge of fixing the suit when Sakura returns?"

Shizune sighed. "Of course, but they won't be able to find out what's wrong with it until they can physically take a look at it. If you're so nervous about Sakura's well-being why did you even let her go?"

"Again. I'm not nervous. Though you say it like I had a choice in the matter."

Shizune blinked several times. "You gave the option to choose otherwise didn't you?"

The busty Hokage closed her eyes and smirked. "Those were just words. You saw her eyes. She has the thrust to prove herself. Even if she mentally didn't want to do it, her heart had already made up its mind."

The wind howled harder as the snow slanted sideways in its fall.

"Naruto, Sasuke, and even Sakura...They're all like us when we were their age."

~

"Whacha got there boy?" Grunted A tall dark man. He was covered in fur and pelts of different animals. Judging by his beard and smell, he hadn't shaved or bathed in weeks. A long silver rifle muzzle peaked over his shoulders as he leaned over to his giant hunting dog, which was sniffing tracks in the snow.

"Blim'me. Two of 'em. So far away from 'er safe 'ome too." The massive man put his hand on his chin, making a crude thinking gesture. "Doubt we'll catch 'em today though. Ah well. Good job, boy. E'll rest er for the night."

~

"Come, come Sakura! See here?" Ichikuma pointed a single white oak tree with pink petals still resisting the winter frost. "This is the entrance to a world you've probably never known existed."

Still not yet accustomed to walking on all fours, Sakura finally caught up to the massive polar bear. "It's a tree..."

"A tree," Chuckled the great bear. "Quite. But open your eyes, girl. See clearly as one of us would."

Sakura squinted at the oak and tried focusing on it. After a few seconds of nothing, she was about to give up. Then suddenly, the tree changed. It was like it evaporated almost, it danced in the snow before becoming something else entirely. A cave entrance.

"I...I don't understand. Was that just an illusion?"

"Harhar! No, nothing so complex. You merely weren't looking hard enough and didn't notice it."

"B-but..." Stammered Sakura. "That doesn't make any sense! There had to be an illusion or something..."

"Did there have to be? Or is that just what you humans feel is the natural thing to presume?" The cave entrance appeared to have stairs leading down, which Ichikuma started walking down. "This is what we've never understood about you humans. You're so quick to judge the world and define it by your own clauses. Then when something extraordinary comes along, you discredit it. You call it impossible."

Sakura took that as a que to continue following him.

"It's sad that you people are so closed minded. I suppose that's the biggest difference between you and us. But hopefully," He turned back to face her. "You'll learn something during your stay with us."

She smiled slightly. "That's what I intend."

He returned her grin. "Good."

The 'stairs' down into the cave seemed almost man made, the way they were crafted. Sakura was beginning to feel this wasn't so much as a bear cave as it was a bear's home. It was what was at the bottom of the stairs that really amazed Sakura.

"Wh-whoa..."

It was almost like a city, only caveman style. The stairs opened up into an underground cavern with separate bear caves lined in the walls. At the center was a grand pit with a massive bonfire and bones of animals. There had to be a hundred of the polar bears, communicating with each other and going about what appeared to be normal day business. Sakura noticed there were several other stairways in the sides of the walls, there had to be an entire network of these caves underground! No wonder no one had ever been able to find these bears before!

Ichikuma stepped into the crowd. "Shall we, Sakura?"
13533221211212111.title: A Warm Welcome.

choices: Everyone of them take a liking to her, but Kusase...
135332212112121112.content:
As Sakura followed behind Ichikuma, she was taken by the beauty of the 'city'.

It was a tasteful blend of nature and human innovation, it's magnificence made her feel like she'd never get used to it.

The pink kunoichi followed after Ichikuma until they came to a nice looking home, seemingly carved of stone.

"Well, this is my den." The pink polar bear said. "Your welcome to stay here as long as you want, but I need you to keep the fact that your human secret."

Sakura understood, considering Ichikuma's past with humans, the other Momoiro probably wouldn't trust her.

'Even so,' the kunoichi thought. 'if he can get over what humans did to him, then why can't the other bears?'

"Sakura?" her host asked. "You've been quiet for quite some time."

"Oh it's nothing, I'd be glad to come and stay."

The scarred bear smiled. "Well come on in."

The two of them entered to find a stony floor with intricate, tile like carvings. Nearby was a smooth, spiral stair case that presumably lead upstairs. To the right, there was a threshold that led to the dining room, a small pool of water within.

"Cubs! We have a guest." Ichikuma cried.

"Really uncle Ichi?" a young boyish voice asked. Shortly after hearing it, Sakura saw it's owner, and two other bear cubs.

The one that spoke was small, probably the bear equivalent of a 9 year old. He was rather thin, but his eyes sparkled mischeviously.

Next was a bear about Sakura's size. The fur on it's head was long and well maintained, and styled into two small buns. Her eyes shined with sincere kindness.

Finally there was a bear so dark pink he was nearly red. Everything about him reminded Sakura of a certain avenger she knew.

"Who's this girl?" The deep pink one asked, even his voice was like Sasuke's.

"This is Sakura, she'll be staying with us for awhile." Ichikuma explained. "Sakura, these are my sister's cubs, Koji, Chira, and Kusase."

"Nice to meet you all." Sakura said.
135332212112121112.title: Meeting the locals.

1353322121121211121.content:
Sakura finished her bow, but the three cubs continued to stare at her. Again, she was beginning to feel slightly uncomfortable. She looked to Ichikuma for some sort of reaction, but alas he gave an expressionless face. Did she offend them? Was a bow considered taboo or something?

Finally, after what felt like an eternity of waiting, the smallest cub walked up to her and sniffed up at her face. He gave her what could only be described as a smile and said.

"You smell nice...Like flowers..."

Sakura blushed slightly, she'd never gotten compliment like that before, even as a human. "U-um...Thank you..."

"Hey, Koji!" Said the female bear, as she batted him over the head with her massive paw. "You'd say that to a complete stranger but not your own sister!?"

The smaller bear was being pressed down to the ground by his sister's strength. He peaked his snout out from her paw and mumbled.

"That's cause you smell like poo..."

Apparently she heard him. "Poo!? Why you!"

Sakura had to hold a laugh as the two of them tumbled over each, playfully biting and clawing at each other. Ichikuma didn't seem too phased by their squabble, and was instead interested with the darker haired male who turned to leave.

"Oi. Kusase. Don't be rude, introduce yourself."

"Not interested." Came a muttered reply, he continued up the stairs with his back to both of them. Sakura shivered, he had a terrible cold shoulder. A lot like a teammate she was in love with...

Ichikuma sighed. "I'll never understand that boy...My apologizes Sakura. As you can see, like humans, we too have our unfriendly types."

"It's alright." Sakura said under her breath. "He reminds me of someone I know..."

"What was that?"

"Oh it's nothing. You have a nice family Ichikuma-san."

At last he turned his attention to other cubs, fighting with each other still on the floor. "Thank you, now. Children! Enough!"

Instantly, they both got off of each other and snapped to attention. Then they stood in a line like a bunch of well trained soldiers, while Ichikuma paced around them like the strict drill sergeant.

"Introduce yourselves."

The smallest bear was the first to speak. "I'm Koji!"

Then the girl. "I'm Chira."

"Good. Now that that's settled. Sakura will need a place to stay for a month or so. Considering Kusase still has an attitude problem, one of you are going to have to give up a portion of their room. Which of you-"

"Oh, me!" Said Chira before her uncle could finish.

"No fair Chira! You answered before Uncle Ichi could say anything!"

"Now, now Koji." Answered Ichikuma. "Maybe it's for the best for the two girls to share a room."

Chira stuck her tongue out at the cub as he growled.

"I never get to do anything fun..."

"Why not sleep over in Kusase's room tonight then?"

"Yeah, but he's always such a grouch!"

Sakura sensed they were about to get into an argument, so did Chira. The bear nudged Sakura in the side and whispered.

"Psst. They're going to be at this for awhile. Let's go up to my room."

"Okay."

~

Chira's room continued to amaze Sakura at the feats these mere polar bears had accomplished. The bedroom was like something out of an ice palace, filled with crystals and beautiful. Everything appeared to be made out of ice, including the furniture. But when she gently touched it, it gave off a warm sensation. Chira jumped up on a low rise bed, perplexed at her new roommate's interest in what were commonplace items to her.

"What's the matter? Never seen furniture before?"

"E-err..." Sakura tried to think of a convincing cover story. "No...I was raised in the outside wilds. This is my first time here."

"Oh, so you're feral?"

"A what?"

"A feral. You know. From the outside? There are two classes of bears. Ferals, who chose to live on the outside like normal bears. And us, Momoiro that have advanced enough to live down here in the Safe Home. Didn't you learn that while up there?"

"Sorry...No I didn't. Ichikuma-san just found me in the forests and decided to take me here." She decided to be as truthful as possible. "I had no idea this place even existed."

"Huh, that's weird. Why do you keep calling uncle Ichikuma, san? That's a human term isn't it? You're really strange..."

"U-uh..." Was all Sakura could answer.

"I like you!" Smiled the bear, not even letting Sakura reply. "You can sleep over there, sorry I don't have another bed for you to stay in."

She pointed at a large couch in the corner of the room, it seemed to have more than enough room for Sakura to sleep on. But because she was not yet used to her new size, perhaps not.

Chira used her two front paws to hold up her face. "So what do you want to do before dinner, Sakura?"
1353322121121211121.title: One in the Family.

13533221211212111212.content:
"Well..." Answered Sakura. Truthfully she wanted to explore the polar bear city more. "I was thinking-"

"Oh, I know!" Butted in Chira before Sakura could finish her thought. She grinned deviously at the disguised ninja. "Let's spy on Kusase, that's always fun!"

Sakura, however, was reluctant. "Uhh. I don't think that's such a good idea. I mean...I just got here and he didn't seem too happy to meet me to begin with. I'd prefer to try and stay on good terms with everyone, the best I can."

Chira rolled her eyes. "Ohhhh. I get it. You like him don't you?"

"Wha-what!? Absolutely not! I mean, sure, he's just like-" Sakura caught herself before spilling the beans about her human life, but Chira eyed her curiously. She continued stuttering "That is...Uhh...I-I mean..."

"You liiiiike him." Said Chira in a sing song voice.

She blushed. "No I don't..."

Chira continued her taunts. "Prove it then."

The girl bear was clearly winning this little argument. With no other choice, Sakura groaned.

~

"Er. Are you sure being up here is safe?" Asked Sakura, as she tiptoed on the two story ledges outside the windows of the 'cave'. No small task considering both her and Chira's size. The real polar bear didn't seem too nervous though, aside from Sakura making a lot of noise.

"Shh, be quiet! You want Kusase to hear us?"

Sakura sighed. This must have what circus preforming bears felt like. Walking along the narrow edge on two legs was an even more daunting task when you weighed nearly a ton. As they neared a large window, Sakura heard voices in the room.

"-For the last time, Koji. You're not sleeping in my room. Now get off of me."

Sakura could picture the younger cub grabbing on the legs of his darker brothers, being dragged along the floor. But Chira had the entire view of the room, Sakura could only imagine what was going on.

"Pppppplease big brother! Chira gets to have Sakura sleep over in her room! Uncle Ichi said you'd have to let me stay in your room to make it fair!"

"He didn't say that. Now, again, get off me. I find it disturbing that I need to ask you twice."

Chira snickered under her breath. This sort of thing had to be typical in the household. Sakura was stuck in a corner of the cave/building, and was finding a hard time seeing the humor of the situation with her holding on for dear life.

"Fine! You and Chira are the biggest jerks! I'm telling Uncle Ichi on you!"

"You do that..."

Chira seemed to be having fits of laughter and whispered to Sakura. "They're always doing that, don't look so nervous. He hasn't caught me yet doing this!"

The window swung open. "I know you're out there Chira."

The girl bear yelped and fell off the ledge down onto the street below. Somehow, Kusase didn't seem to notice Sakura hiding in the corner. She looked down to make sure Chira was alright as Kusase huffed and slammed the window shut again.

"Y-you okay Chira?"

"Owww...Yeah, I just landed on my butt. He didn't see you though. You can spy on him for me!"

"What? No! I'm getting down from here!"

"Do it!" She called back. Then the polar bear girl crept under the house, probably going back inside.

"Chira..." Sighed Sakura. This was the exact sort of thing Naruto would want to do to Sasuke. She gave a short laugh to herself and quietly moved closer to the window, trying to get a peak into Kusase's room.

It was a little less nicer than Chira's. While hers seemed more fit for a princess, Kusase's was more darker and practical. There were hundreds of books and scrolls all over the place, suggesting he was a good student. Kusase was sitting on a short chair and desk, looking at something on the table. That's when Sakura heard strange noises followed by a single word, "Mother..."

She thought to herself. "Is he...crying?"

Though she couldn't get a good look at his face, she seemed to understand what was going on. She quietly turned to leave for Chira's bedroom window.

~

"So whatcha see up there Sakura!?" Asked Chira, later at dinner.

"Huh? Oh." She looked across the table at Kusase. If he had been crying, he sure didn't show it. He seemed to notice the stares he was getting and shot a quick glare at Sakura. "I didn't see anything...He just kicked Kuji out and started reading."

That answer satisfied Chira's curiosity enough. "Huh. That's so boring."

"Uncle Ichi! Tell Kusase he's gotta let me sleep over in his room! It's not fair that Chira gets to have Sakura over!"

Ichikamu grunted as he chewed on a fish bone. "It's up to Kusase who he wants in his room Koji."

"Aww come on!"

"Um. You're welcome to stay with us Koji. If Chira let's you..." Said Sakura.

Chira looked horror-struck. "Yeah! Come on Chira! Can I! Please!?"

She looked at Sakura, then at Ichikuma who gave a stern look. Finally, she sighed. "Fine."

~

Hours later, Sakura was the only one awake in the room. Koji had eaten half his body weight in sugary treats and worn himself out about an hour in, he currently was snuggled up on top of Sakura's massive bear form. Chira and her had spent most of the night just talking about things. Chira was very curious about the outside world, having never been there herself. While Sakura asked questions about the culture of the Safe Home and the Momoiro.

It had been an enlightening and entertaining night, but Sakura felt at least a little bit at home at last. She played with the necklace Lady Tsunade had given her. She remembered her words.

"Just use this to call us. You should probably report in tomorrow, for now just adapt to their culture. Try to enjoy yourselves Sakura."

She smiled to herself. Mission accomplished so far. Closing her eyes, she couldn't wait to explore around the Momoiro city after hearing so much about it from Chira.

The next day...
13533221211212111212.title: Stealthy Polar Bears...?
