Just then another voice spoke up. "Hinata, Luna! s it really the two of you?"

The wolves turned to see the familiar face of...
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: A waking wolf

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Kiba was standing there, panting but very much alive. There were no visible wounds on him but he looked very much exhausted. Akamaru was perched on his head, happily wagging his tail at the sight of his friends.

"Where's Naruto?" Asked Hinata. "Did you see him anywhere?"

"Relax, he was alive the last time I saw him. He should be safe, him and that fox-guy apparently made friends. They're probably still somewhere in the castle. Let's get out of here and find them, and that girl we're after."

Kiba took out a large key chain he had most likely found off one of the prison guards. He fiddled through the ring trying to find a key that would fit the cell door.

"Now, let's see here. Not that one. Too small. Too big. No. Wait, this might be it."

Just as the he placed the key in the lock a loud applause coming from a single person echoed in the room. Xana clapped at the dog-boy and said.

"My, my. Well done Kiba. Grills was my best bodyguard, to defeat him must have been no small task. But this is where the game ends I'm afraid. Lucky for me I came to gather Hinata dear here, else you three might have escaped."

"You!" He went to throw a punch at the old woman.

"Kiba! Be careful!" Shouted Hinata a little too late. The witch calmly hit Kiba in the stomach with a talisman, he started to cough up blood.

"How reckless, boy. Who do you think gave you those new powers anyway? You cannot touch me."

With a simple push, Kiba fell backwards completely knocked out.

"Kiba!"

"Relax, Hinata dear. He's alive. But he won't be here to save you any longer. He won't have time to do that."

"You! Naruto's still here! Naruto will be able to stop you!"

"Naruto is currently fighting head to head against my ally, Vulpes. He's quite indispose at the moment."

"What are you talking about...Vulpes sensei wouldn't-"

The witch gave Hinata a cold stare. "I told you from the beginning. Be wary of him. Vulpes has been luring you to me from the very start."

The voice that came out of Hinata's mouth was not her own. "T-that's a lie! Vulpes...he would never..."

Xana seemed to know who was speaking. "Would he not? He cares so deeply for you Aerore. He came to me willing to risk his own children to return you to normal. He's more ruthless than I am."

"I...I don't believe you!"

"Believe me or not, he's fighting Naruto as we speak. The two are most likely trying to kill each other in the most violent manner imaginable. Have no fear, it is Vulpes who will die by the end of the battle Hinata dear. I have it all planned out. Naruto will be too much for him."

"The Nine Tailed Fox..." Muttered Hinata.

"Exactly. The beast most likely wishes to destroy his bastard child. In order to win against Vulpes, Naruto will have to unleash it. And considering how angry the boy must be with Vulpes to begin with, I'd say it would only be a matter of time before your lover finds himself overwhelmed."

"B-but surely he must know that! Why would he trust you to fight Naruto if he knows you're sending him off to his death!?"

"Ah, a simple trick. See this?" Xana held up an amulet with a fox carved on it. "He believes lies so easily. He truly thinks we're allies. I merely told him that hitting Naruto with a copy of this would suppress the Nine Tailed Fox. He of course bought it."

"Vulpes...No..." Whispered Aerore.

"Oh, don't you worry Aerore. You'll be with your traitorous husband soon enough. Now...sleep..."

~

"Get up you giant oaf! We need to get out of here before the hag finds out we lost!"

Grills blinked his eyes several times. Standing over him was Nezumi, holding his still unconscious brother by the tail.

"Mmm, I'm sorry Nezumi." Grills sat up and stared at his paw.

"What are you doing you lazy bear bastard! Can't you feel that chakra up on the castle!? There's a massive battle! Something big happening and I don't want to be here when it ends!"

"That guy...He was right...We're no different then the masters..."

Nezummi jumped in the air and kicked Grills right in the head, but only succeeded in hurting his own feet.

"WHAT ARE YOU MUMBLING ABOUT YOU IDIOT!? LET'S GO!"

"I'm sorry Nezumi, but I'm not going."

"Don't say such stupid things! You know as well as I do what the witch does to those who fail at their orders!"

"Right, I'm going to go help that guy and stop her." Grills stood up. "Do you wish to come?"

"HELL. NO. I'm getting out of here while I still can! You go by yourself on your suicide mission! I was just looking for some extra muscle in case we needed it when escaping!" With that, the mouse man quickly left for the caves in the opposite direction.

"Humph. Oh well." Grills closed his eyes. "Now where are you, brother Kiba?"
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: The Setup.

choices: Xana arrives on scene and watches the fight
Back to Kiba, being awakened by Grills
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
On top of the building, a titanic battle was taking place, between The Jinchuriki of the Leaf and the Kyuubi's cub.

Naruto, having been long overtaken by the beast, had reached the three tails state, his own body and Vulpes' were locked in fierce combat.

The ground rumbled from the force of the blows, but Kit Yumi, and the few guards who were still conscious watched.

The fight was going in Naruto's favor. While Vulpes was more agile and had a clearer mind, Naruto's instincts were taking over, filling him with chakra and murderous intent. Vulpes had been thrown by a chakra claw into the ground, he yelped in pain.

"Father!!!" Yumi yelled, the cub tried to run to his father, but he was stopped by Kit.

"Stay back kid. It's to dangerous for you to get close!"

"B-but-"

"Those two aren't going to let up, do you think your dad wants you to get hurt too?"

Before Yumi could respond, another attack from Naruto created a gaping hole in the ground. Vulpes had managed to dodge and was on all fours, his left hind paw felt broken.

'Damn, why isn't this amulet working?' he thought, glaring at the jewel around his neck. 'Has that hag lied to me?'

Just then Naruto roared, the fox's cloak had turned a drak red, completely hiding his body beneath a coat of Chakra.

Vulpes smirked "Well, even if I wass lied to, I won't lose to you...Father."

The only response was another roar, before the two clashed again.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Naruto vs. Vulpes

choices: He gains his sanity at the last moment.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
"Ugh..." Muttered Kiba. His head felt like it had been in a pinball machine. When he opened his eyes, a familiar sight greeted him. "Grills again? I didn't expect for you to get up that fast...You're one tough monster."

The bear man offered Kiba a hand. "I'm sorry, but you're one to talk. Can you get up?"

"Barely." Kiba was pulled to his feet, but his legs were filled with immense pain. "I take it you're on our side now?"

"No."

Kiba blinked in surprise. "No? What do you mean?"

"I'm on my own side Brother Kiba, it's just a matter of convenience that our ultimate goals are the same. And I can use all the help I can get to accomplish my task."

"The enemy of my enemy, huh? Well that's fine by me." Suddenly his ears twitched. "What the hell is going on out there?"

"The one called Naruto is currently fighting against a powerful ally of the witch. I believe his name was Vulpes."

Kiba's eyes widened, but he gave a long sigh. "So that's what happened then? Well, let's get going to the witch Grills."

"Are you sure we shouldn't go and help the boy?"

"Nah. We'd just be getting in his way. Naruto is stronger than all of us. Whoever it is, he can handle it. Besides Hinata is counting on me. Let's go."

~

"From the very beginning, I've lead you two into our clutches." Those words which had been spoken from Vulpes mouth echoed in Naruto's head. Rage, endless rage clouded his vision. The power of the fox was seething throughout his body. He hadn't been this angry since Sasuke left. There was only one command Naruto gave to his body. KILL. Kill Vulpes. Destroy him. Rip his heart out. Let him choke on his own blood for doing this to Hinata.

He took a massive red chakra swipe at the incoming fox. Strangely enough, Vulpes didn't evade the blow. A torrent of blood flew in the air. It was as if he was purposely trying to get hit now.

"Good." Thought Vulpes. "He's so blinded by rage that he neglected to realize he's allowing the precious chakra of my father is seeping into my wounds. Just a little more and I'll be able to do it..."

Naruto made another light slash across Vulpes face.

"NOW!" Yelled Vulpes, he ran right up to Naruto and bit down hard on his shoulder. The fox-carrier roared in pain but could not move. Vulpes was slowly developing his own red aura.

"You've let your guard down Naruto." Mumbled Vulpes to the boy. "With the small amounts of my father's essence coursing through my veins, I am able to attract and drain his very being into my own body! Soon your energy reserves will be entirely depleted and then-"

But Naruto couldn't hear him. There was too much rage coursing through his mind. All he heard was chanting, steady as a war drum. "Kill...Kill...Kill...Kill..."

The red aura around Naruto doubled, another tail sprouted next to the first. "KILL!"

Instantly Vulpes was knocked into the wall with a spine shattering crack. Naruto gave him no time to take the recoil and pummeled him with a machine-gun-like barrage of blows. Blood spilled into the air like a fountain. Naruto did not even need to use chakra to damage him, the claws on his hands were enough.

Gashing wounds appeared all over Vulpes body, and there was no sign of Naruto ceasing the assault. In an instant, the tide had totally turned. Vulpes lost too much blood was too fast and was slowly beginning to black out. But still Naruto didn't let up. It was a gruesome sight to behold.

"D-damn witch..." Thought Vulpes as he stared into the hatred of Naruto's eyes. Naruto had the same eyes that he had when he first learned the fate of his beloved mate. "No, I caused this...Aerore..."

Naruto brought his hand back for a killing blow and charged up a Rasengan.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Torn to Shreds.

choices: In anger, Vulpes crosses the circle and interrupts the spell.
Xana murders Kohana, and all goes as planned
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Then, as Naruto felt the evil beast's hatred hit it's climax, the blonde regained control.

As his hand went towards Vulpes, Naruto curved it away, creating a crater in the ground. A few rocks pelted the great fox, as well as the jinchuriki, but neither were truly harmed.

Soon, the fox cloak faded, and a severly weakened Naruto stood before a fallen Vulpes, his usual healing power kaput.

After a moment, Naruto spoke.

"...You did a lot of crappy things, y'know that Vulpes?"

The fox coughed up a bit of blood. "Yes. I have...but it was all for my mate."

"...I know. You said we were alike right?"

"Yes, yes I did."

"Well, I understand. If someone precious to me died, I'd do almost anything to get them back. But, joining Xana is unforgiveable!"

"Well what would you have me do?! Just let her go? I am sorry for needing to use Kohana and Hinata, but I want Aerore to return."

"And you'd kill more and more! Xana'd probably just use the two of you, you fool!"

"Fool am I?" Vulpes spat angrily before howling. Suddenly there was an earthquake, and soon thousands of creatures that resembled Luna and Yumi appeared, as if summoned.

"Wh-what?" Naruto gasped.

"This is my entire pack, one and all sired by me, with Aerore. Not one of these cubs would let that hag live if she used us."

Just then, however, there was cruel laughter. "Oh Vulpes. Do you really think your pups could do such a thing?"

Everyone turned to see Xana, alongside an unconscious Hinata and Kohana. All three were in a magic circle, bathed in a purple light. Xana then held a dagger to Kohana's throat."But you needn't worry. You'll have that worthless bitch of yours back soon, and my dear Ren will return..."

Xana then chanted a few words and brought her weapon back for a killing strike...
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: The plan's fruition...

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
By the time it took Naruto to process what had just happened, it was far too late to do anything to help and all four in circle were enveloped in a beam of light. Just as the witch prepared to slit Kohana's throat, Vulpes had charged at her with amazing speed, considering his wounds. He bit hard into Xana's arm just as the blade touched the young girl's skin. Then, boom.

The bright light had appeared over the circle like a shield, preventing Naruto, Kit, or Yumi from entering. Of course, they still had to deal with the thousands of wolf like creatures surrounding them.

The beasts weren't even real wolves, more like shadows of wolves. They attacked in huge numbers at the three who were back to back in a circle.

"What the hell are these things!?" Growled Naruto as he batted away a few dozen of them.

"Xana said that the one called Vulpes believed that he still had his entire pack under his command." Answered Kit, dodging a wave of the shadow creatures. "In truth, I believe he had a huge disagreement with his other family members in the past. All of them split off, but apparently he still believed in his head that his pack still supported him. Either that or..."

"The witch put a spell on him to believe they never left him!" Finished Naruto.

"It's true!" Said Yumi, who was trying his best to help out in the fight. "Brother Lupus got into a huge argument with father just after mother died! He took all the other brothers and sisters and left!"

The bright light was slowly fading and dimming down, as it did so too did the attacks by the shadow creatures slow. Though the three fighers in the center of the mass couldn't see what had happened in the circle

Some of the creatures even dropped bow to their legs and bowed, muttering in some sort of unknown language.

"What are...What are they doing?" Asked Naruto.

The light was become soft enough to see a single figure in the center over four other forms.

"I...I think..." Answered Kit. "They're praying..."

Finally the attacks from the wolf creatures stopped altogether, as they bowed in respect at the massive form standing in the shaft of light. Yumi whimpered as Naruto squinted to see what was in the circle. It was...
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Crossing the Line.

choices: Seeing Naruto & Co. hurts something in Ren, and Xana has a solution...
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Once the group could see again they were beyond shocked at the sight that they beheld.

Within the broken hex circle, faintly breathing was Vulpes. He was on the ground, barely breathing with his fur a faded white color. His very essence had been stripped from him, leaving the great fox little strength and on the verge of death.

Next was Aerore. Hinata's soul had been taken from their shared body, leaving the wolf alone in the Hyuga heiress' body. She was tired and confused, mostly by the absence of her close friend.

Still standing was Xana. She was the only one unaffected physically or spiritually, but something in her mind was unhinged.

No longer was she quite so lucid, instead she seemed to have lost her mind. Her will to see her daughter was not only one of her greatest ambitions, but also one of her greatest dreams. During the spell, she was required to focus on that one person, her daughter Ren, but Vulpes' attack had caused her mind to wander back to that accursed princess.

The source of her misery. That self centered bitch...

Both were in Xana's mind as she slit Kohana's throat.

The result was both soul's had been called back, and since Hinata and Kohana's souls weren't sacrificed, a new 'Ren' was born.

What stood there now was a four legged monster, standing erect on it's hindlegs. It's fur was the color of ash, razor sharp claws were on it's cruel hand-like paws.

On it's slightly feminine body were three heads. Each one had a fierce wolfen face, and pitch black eyes with crimson irises.

Her long tail reached the ground, and looked like a fox's. Overall it was a giant and intimidating beast, nearly as great as a Biju.

Within moment's a head noticed Xana, the other two soon turned to face her as well.

"M...Mother?" the center head asked, her voice was both young and twisted, as if in great pain.

"Ren!" Xana exclaimed, tears spilling from her face as she hugged her 'daughter, "It's you my child..."

"Mother, it hurts!"
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Ren: The daughter revived?

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Of course Xana was taken aback, her hug was nowhere near strong enough to harm her beloved offspring's powerful new body. "What hurts my daughter?" the hag asked in a truly compassionate, motherly voice. The tone was unexpected, and didn't suit her in the slightest.

One of Ren's heads, the left one looked at Naruto and his companions, while the right one faced Aerore. "Them! They...Seeing them hurts me!" she whined, feeling severe cramplike pains around her heart, whilst her eyes watered from her suffering. "MAKE IT STOP MOTHER!!!" All three heads screamed.

Everyone was nearly deafened by that grand roar. Xana should've been hurt the most since she was nearest to the source of the noise, but she only held her disfigured child tighter.

Meanwhile, Aerore had ran towards her comrades unnoticed by either the behemoth or it's creator. She had walked to her mate's body and carried him by the scruff of his neck, to get him to those who could help them.

"Hinata!" Naruto shouted happily while huffing, "What happened to Vulpes and Kohana?"

"Actually Naruto, it's me Aerore." the wolf explained as she opened her jaws and released the fox she rescued. "Vulpes' essence has been taken from him, and put into that thing. It was made by Vulpes interrupting the spell while Kohana's body and Hinata's soul were sacrificed. Now both their spirits, the soul of Xana's child, and another, fouler one are trapped within that body. Now the creature's in deep pain due to the great emotion that Hinata and Kohana felt for us."

Of course, while Aerore explained, Xana was still comforting her lupine daughter. "There there Ren, mother knows how to fix this. Those wretches are responsible for you being less than you deserve to be. If you kill them, the pain will cease, and I'll give you the body you deserve."

Slowly, the powerful child arose. Her tears were spilling more fiercely now, but she responded to her mother a bit more calmly.

"Yes mother, I will get rid of them."
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: A Mother's suggestion

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Maybe it was the blood loss that slowed his reflexes, but he simply couldn't react in time to the massive beast's tail which collided right into his stomach. The carrier of the nine tailed fox was sent flying into the nearby wall, Aerore, however, had safety evaded the crushing blow, with Vulpes on her back.

"Hinata! Kohana! Please hear my voice!" Cried Aerore. "You need to fight Xana's hold! Don't listen to her!"

A bolt of electricity came out of nowhere and smacked right into the white wolf's flying form. Aerore flipped and landed on four legs, facing Xana who had a large wooden staff pointed directly at her. She was barely holding onto Vulpes with her teeth.

"Come now Aerore, surely you must know. There is no more Hinata or Kohana anymore. There is only Ren, my daughter. My love..."

Aerore placed her mate on the ground for the second time, growling at Xana as she prepared another bolt.

Xana laughed. "Yes, this is just like old times isn't it? To think it was only years ago. But let's not waste time with talk."

Kit and Yumi were free from fighting the shadow wolves and rushed to the aid of Naruto. The child-beast roared at the sight of the two of them defending the broken blonde. Yumi was busy checking on Naruto, who was jammed into the broken wall, while Kit got between them and Ren.

"Is he alive?" Asked Kit.

"I-I can't tell! He's breathing but...but there's blood everywhere mister! What are we gonna do!? Everyone is..." The poor wolf was on the verge of tears. "Is..."

Kit sighed. "You can't cry now kid. You want to protect everyone don't you?"

Yumi nodded. Suddenly Kit's ears perked up and he started smiling. Ren started grabbing her head's, howling in pain.

"We're about to get some help, anyway."

The floor behind Ren exploded open, a giant grizzly bear pulled itself up onto the battle ground, it muttered "I am sorry...". It was the bear man and on his back was a smaller body...Kiba! Kit gave a short whistle to grab Grills' attention.

"Ahh...Kit. Good, looks like we found the witch. Wake up, brother Kiba." Grills nudged his shoulders to stir the unconscious dog-boy.

"Ugh...We there already...?" Akamaru barked on top of his awakening master's head.

Yumi barked back with a happier tone. "Akamaru! Mr. Kiba! Wait, where's Luna?"

Grills lowered Kiba to his feet, he staggered slightly but was able to stand. "Don't know. Grills followed the witch's trail from the prison room. We couldn't find her...Huh."

Kiba at last noticed the grunting monster in front of him. "...What the hell is that thing? And where is Naruto?"

"He's fine...for now." Answered Kit, preparing to fight Ren who was slowly returning to reality. "We're about to get really busy though. You guys good to fight?"

The five of them took a fighting stance and surrounded the howling beast.

"Let's do it."

~

Luna was crawling through the ventilation of the castle, she had been following the smell of the witch to find Kohana and Hinata. They had gone up but suddenly...Hinata's and Kohana's scents disappeared. Now the entire roof of the castle reeked of blood.

When she had woken up, the other girls had been taken away and brother Kiba was unconscious, she knew there was no time to waste. She had to do something to save her friends. Her claws were bleeding when she dig into the side of the vertical vents. She had to hurry and do something.

~

At the top of the highest tower of the castle, the large clock had its two giant hands placed at twelve. The clock gonged but did little to drown out the sounds of fighting. Twelve loud earth rumbling rings filled the air.

DING! Aerore charged at Xana, narrowly dodging two more shots of electricity.

DONG! Kit and Grills tackled Ren while Kiba tried to hit her from above. Akamaru and Yumi attacked her from the legs.

DING! Aerore bit down on the wooden staff Xana swung around, snapping it into a bunch of little splinters.

DONG! Kit was thrown back from a giant kick, Grills held his ground though. Kiba gave everything he had into his punch but only succeeded in feeling something snap in his arm.

DING! Aerore was thrown back by a blast of magic from Xana's hand. The witch glared at the wolf and prepared to strike with a bigger lightning bolt.

DONG! Kit was slowly getting to his feet again, Akamaru and Yumi narrowly avoided being stepped on. Grills, was taking the most damage, blood was everywhere.

DING! Aerore rolled on the ground, a bolt of lightning left a gigantic crater where she had been moments again. She sprung to her feet and focused.

DONG! Kit watched in horror as the bear man Grills was sent flying into the ceiling of the underground cavern. Akamaru got kicked out of the way while Yumi desperately bit Ren's leg.

DING! Aerore rushed at Xana as her form turned into that of a wispy ghost. She jumped at the witch as she muttered something under her breath.

DONG! Kit tried to save Yumi, but the pup was smashed into the wall, next to Naruto. Kiba came in with another swing but was crushed into the ground. Kit was alone.

DING! Aerore knew she should have connected the attack with the witch, but she instead went right through her. That was the extent of her power, she was completely drained. She was alone.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Hazard.

choices: Luna! With a few of her siblings
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
The situation was dire for our heroes.

Almost everyone was bludgeoned, bloodied, and nearly broken.

Grills had long hit the floor and was moaning, unconscious. Not too far away, Kiba was besides his wounded pup.

The wildman's arms was fractured in many places, but he managed to use the less injured one to prop himself up agonizingly.

He looked around to see Naruto, barely conscious, groaning and watching helplessly as Kit did his best to evade the lightning swift attacks from his Cerberus like opponent.

Try as the foxman might, he couldn't dodge forever, and ended up with a terrible gash across his face. Reaching from Kit's forehead to his right cheek.

"C-crap!!" Kiba swore as he observed the one sided slaughter, "That thing can't be that strong!"

His words managed to reach Xana, who laughed as she looked at her longtime foe in Hinata's body. "My dear child, Ren is much more powerful than you can imagine. After all, she takes after her mother."

For a moment, Xana's attention wavered as she bragged, gving Aerore the precious few moments she needed to pounce on the demented witch.

The old woman fell over upon contact, unable to move and entirely bewildered.

She peered into Aerore's now lavender eyes, as she felt the cold enamel daggers that were wolf teeth rip her throat out, almost ending her terrible life.

Once the deed was done, Xana could feel herself bleeding out. She wasn't as strong as the others, and clung to life by the thinnest of threads.

"We may die due to your wretched child, but at least you shall perish as well." Aerore said, watching her dying victim, her muzzle dyed red.

It seemed she was now the only one able to face Ren, when she saw a very welcome sight.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: The 12 hour....

choices: Ren defeats Lupus, leaving just Luna and Ren alone...
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Though her body looked battered and beaten, there was a glimmer of strength in her eyes unlike anything Aerore had ever seen. It was her daughter, Luna, standing strong against the monster.

"Luna..."

More figures approached from behind her, including a large gray wolf with tinted orange fur going from his ears to his snout.

"...Lupus...?" Muttered Aerore, her strength was about to wane.

"Hello mother..." Spoke the large wolf in a gruff voice. "It seems we've just made it."

Luna looked around at the battle scene; it was a grizzly sight, worse then anything she could imagine. Aside the living atrocity in front of her, there were numerous bodies scattered around the floor. All bleeding, all near death, all faces she recognized. Her brother...Naruto...her father...She felt herself longing to cry, but she shuddered it off.

"Keep your chin up, little sister." Barked Lupus as he and the other two black wolves behind him prepared to strike. "There's still fighting to be done."

Aerore felt herself passing out. "Wh-what about t-the rest of the pack? A-are they...?"

"On their way. I was the first to sense Luna's call for help and was the first to arrive. Go to Vulpes, mother. This will be over soon."

As Aerore nodded and stumbled over to her husband's defeated body, the monster slowly lumbered it's way to its dying "mother". Xana lifted up her hands trying to speak to her creation, no words could come out of her mouth. Only blood. Ren sniffed Xana and gave a mournful wail.

"Mother...Mother..."

Lupus spat. "How awful, the witch has created a monstrosity of hatred and sadness. I only hope we can save the hosts before it's too late."

"Hinata...Kohana..." Whispered Luna.

Suddenly the beast howling into the air, causing a shock wave that nearly knocked the wolves off their feet. The very tower they stood on shuddered under the mix of pain and agony that emitted from the creature.

"MOTHER!"

The shadow wolf creatures that had been so patiently watching the battle the entire time now lunged at the four wolves, thousands upon thousands of them. All teeth and claws aimed at Lupus and his guard.

"Luna! Stay under our cover!" Shouted Lupus as he and his alpha pack counterattacked. They formed a protective barrier around Luna as the black shadows descended upon them like a wave of locust.

Blood and shadow spilled into the air but nothing seemed to deter the mass of muscle and fur that shielded the young wolfing.

"On my mark!" Snarled Lupus.

The three adult wolves readied their hide legs to pounce back at the shadows.

"MARK!"

Three massive slashes jetted outwards, cutting into the waves of shadow creatures like grass. They had managed to draw a line in the army of shadows, all that remained of the legion were a few stranglers that were in the outer portion of the horde.

Lupus turned to the two black wolves. "Take care of the survivors!" They nodded and then Lupus turned to his sister. "You're with me sis. Let's take this beast down!"

Ren was still loudly sobbing over Xana. The witch slowly raised a wrinkled blood stained finger at the two wolves fast approaching her daughter. But Ren merely swatted them away with a whip of her tail.

"Kill you....KILL YOU!"

Lupus caught his sister with his back before she hit the ground. They were both alright, the sudden attack had merely surprised them.

"So much for getting it while it was distracted..." Said Lupus as he licked a few drops of blood around his mouth. "Flanking it will do no good Luna, try to get it from above. Take no unnecessary risks. Do you understand me?"

"Y-yeah..." This being only her second real battle, Luna was quite nervous especially when facing such a daunting and terrifying foe. She had to be strong though, she couldn't back down from this. Not when all her friends and family had given so much for this fight. All eyes were on her and Lupus. She took a deep breath.

The turn of the tide was at hand...
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Behold. The Turn of the Tide.

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
The duel was unlike any other Luna had seen. Her elder brother Lupus was staring down the monstrous Ren as if she was merely another wolf. That was the amazing thing about Lupus, as the eldest, he always had a calm mind and a grand confidence. Never had Luna thought that anyone aside from maybe Vulpes or Aerore could best him, but seeing the wraith of bloodlust and destruction that was Ren, she was beginning to feel dread.

Obviously, this gloom didn’t reach Lupus, who was more than a tad upset at the fact that his younger brother and his reborn mother were being attacked by the daunting entity. “Now then, you miserable excuse for a bitch, let’s see how skilled you are.” The half-breed said, his sounding rather calm, only the slightest undertone of arrogance present.

Ren’s only response was a deep, primal roar, issuing from all three heads. “DIE!!!!!!”

Ren ’s right paw, now swathed in a malicious, miasmic aura went toward Lupus. He was barely able to evade it. Seizing his opportunity, Lupus growled and bit down on the beast’s arm.

Ren growled a bit in pain, but swung her arm until the offending wolf-fox let go. She once again utilized one of her tails as a whip, beating Lupus with them in fury.

“AAGHH!!” Lupus howled, his bones breaking from the force of the blows. The Gentle hearted Luna was on the verge of breaking down, and the others could barely watch. Somehow though, Lupus managed to maneuver out of the way of the lethal appendages. He did have heavy injuries, but what hurt the worst was his pride. Rarely did he lose, and even when he was a cub Lupus was somewhat vengeful against creatures who weren’t close to him. Unexpectedly, an aura of pale tangerine colored chakra enveloped his body. It was fiery like the Nine-Tails’ chakra, but much weaker. Still, the energy was strong enough that Lupus believed it could injure his enemy.

“Alright, you are pretty strong, but…TRY THIS!!!!” He cried as he rushed headlong towards Ren’s body, like a blazing missile.

There was a brilliant, near blinding flash of light, but when everyone’s eyesight returned, a defeated, blood bathed wolf laid silently on the ground, while a sizeable wound remained on the three headed she-beast’s ribcage.

“LUPUS!!!!!” Aerore howled, not daring to believe that her eldest son might be dead. “No! No! No! No…”

“Big brother!” Yumi managed to cough, “I…I can’t believe it.”

Now, the presence of utter defeat was thick in the ear, even though the two other half-wolves were fully capable fighters, they were weakened by the shadow wolves and stood no chance. Not a single warrior who had faced Ren dared cling to the hope that the amalgamated being could be bested, or even that Hinata or Kohana could be saved.

But one who had yet to face her stood her ground, albeit fearfully.

Ren looked to see Luna, who had hung back in terror throughout the entire battle, but now something within her had changed.

It was true that the fear still existed within her, but now it was being pushed aside. A more powerful, more valorous emotion had risen to the surface of the half-fox’s very being: Courage.

Courage born of love, loyalty, and the need to protect those important to you. A courage made of the most important things in life.

Now, strong enough or not, Luna was ready to fight with the entirety of her being.

Somehow, this change sparked something within Ren. She, a misbegotten “child”, combined with other foreign souls and reborn into a being of pure suffering and malice could feel something else…a strange and faint sense of warmness, with potential to grow stronger than what she felt for her Mother. Still, the beast did her best to resist this sensation, focusing solely on the annihilation of everything in her path…Starting with Luna.

“You…You…” The creature began, still confused before she managed to catch herself, “YOU WILL SUFFER!!!!!”

Even though Luna heard the threatening cry that escaped Ren’s beastly jaws, her mind was too focused to be daunted. Suddenly, a light blue chakra, more elegant than the seemingly slain Lupus’ enveloped her body, illuminating and awe inspiring.

“Big sister Hinata, Kohana, I’m sorry…” She said, before making her assault.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Show no fear...

choices: Naruto rises, ready to end this!
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Luna knew that her chances of victory on her own was nearly nonexistant, but she felt like somehow she could make a difference in fighting Ren.

The young she-wolf had watched the three headed beast carefully, and noticed that her expression changed, as if beholding a lost friend...

There was something beyond the beast inside those eyes. Something human-like.

Something in pain. It was as if Luna could feel Ren's very essence cry out for release.
Hinata and Kohana were holding the beast back? Possibly, but highly unlikely.

The little wolf in the blue energy and the mammoth-like monster stared each other down.

Each waiting for the other to make the first strike. If Luna could sweat, it'd be running down her back at this point.
The intensity of the moment was so thick you could cut the air with a knife. Was
this what it was like when Lupus, Hinata, or her mother fought? Was this how it felt to
be strong? A burning desire to protect everyone. The will to end the fighting. Enough was enough.
The first was swift and deadly...

Luna thrust her self forward, calling upon all the might within her body, using a kind of speed that would make Rock Lee envious.

Her strike at first was nothing more than a simple bite to one of Ren's paws, and yet
it seemed to cause her severe pain. The She-monster roared, trying to wave her foe off as she swung her fore paw around, but Luna wouldn't let go until she was flung upwards.

Once airborne she seized the chance and came downward, striking Ren's middle head straight on. She landed on the ground, albeit shakily. Her energy mostly spent.

Then Luna saw it. An opening. The beast had tilted its heads up and was roaring in pain. How long did she have before it snapped out of its frustration? Five seconds? Two? Didn't matter. Luna's body was already moving on its own, like she had done this thousands of times before.

All that stood in her way was the mask of doubt. Could she do this? This was undoubtedly her final attack, most of her energy had been spent getting to the battleground and fighting for as long as she had been.

No. There couldn't be any doubt, not this time. Not in herself. Not with so many of her friend's lives on the line. Summoning all her energy, Luna crouched down and prepared to strike at Ren dead center in its chest.

Just as the heads finally stopped crying out, Luna pushed off the ground. Like a miniature missile, she propelled herself into the air towards her target. She could do this. This was going to be a direct hit!

The blow hit home, landing exactly where Ren’s previous foe had last harmed her. There was an explosion of chakra emanating from the spot where Luna struck, making the canine-monster’s pain all the more excruciating.

Once more Ren howled, phantom trails of energy were seeping from her newly created weak point. It was as if a bit of her evil essence was dissipating.

Something deep seated and malicious had begun to die, it’s very soul ceasing to be. Once it truly disappeared, only internal suffering would remain.

Still, it would be several minutes before that happened

With a grand, foul cry, Ren Grabbed Luna by the hind legs and squeezed. Putting all of her remaining evil into one crushing grip.

“AAAAAAAAGGGGGGGHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!” Luna cried, feeling pain no child should ever have to feel. Her bones and muscles didn’t ache, for they were all but destroyed.

“Luna!!!” Aerore screamed, fearing that another of her precious children would be lost.

Within moments Ren’s grip loosened, more of Hinata or Kohana’s spirit taking over the accursed body.

They half-wolf cub was breathing, but her lower body was obliterated. Quickly her two remaining siblings came and managed to move her before Ren could strike again.

Inside, Naruto felt a burning desire to act. Everyone had suffered enough while he sat back, albeit badly wounded…
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Luna's battle!

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Slowly, Naruto ambled forward, fatique making his steps slow, his eyesight blurry from agony. 'I've...got to stop this...' was the only thing that ran through his mind, pain making his thoughts disorganized.

Looking at him, Aerore could see that he couldn't make it, not by himself. The power of the Nine tailed fox deserted had him, and while his own chakra reserve was vast, he was in no shape to continue. She had to help him.

Naruto was staggering, at this point walking normally was an impossible challenge. Each limp forward felt like some had taken a knife and stabbed his leg. He couldn't quit though, he couldn't back down. That wasn't his way. Just like the fight with Gaara or Kabuto, he couldn't just give up. If he just kept pushing everything would turn out fine, just like always.

"Back to normal..." Whispered Naruto. "Hah...That's a laugh..."

There was no back to normal after this. The damage had been done and now Naruto was seeing it with his own eyes. Luna was lying flat on her side, coughing up an
abnormal amount of blood. Her legs they...They just didn't look like legs anymore. They
were bent in a sickening angle. Shards of bone jutted out from the skin. If Naruto had the strength for it, he'd probably vomit at the sight of them.

As one of the black wolves dug around in a pack on its side, Naruto asked it.

"Is...Is she going to be alright?"

Producing some bandage the wolf replied. "She's alive, but only just. Every bone in her legs has been broken, combined with the dark energies of that monster it may be impossible for her to walk around again."

"It may be impossible for her to walk around again." Those words
echoed in Naruto's head like the clanging of a giant bell. The fox boy gritted his
teeth, wanting nothing more then to just deny the statement. But he didn't have to be a doctor to see the wolf was correct. Luna had lost her legs forever..

"That's so unfair..." He muttered with a twinge in his tired eyes.

"She was so young and...That's just so...unfair..."

A large shadow loomed over the distraught Naruto. Ren was moving in for the kill.

"That's so unfair..."


Ren had managed to crawl towards Naruto on all fours, her wounds had kept her from walking erect, but her lingering instincts...The drive to kill, to make them suffer.
Something was bugging her in specific. about this blonde boy. Seeing him set something off, something more than what Luna did...

Seeing him made her feel worse, it was if something pure and wholesome had fused with her reigning desire to murder him, dying her claws red with his blood... the pain was maddening, she had to end it. Faster than the normal eye could follow, her forepaw went forward.

BOOM! Her mighty claw slammed down right where Naruto had been standing. The two black wolves quickly pulled Luna backwards, attempting to avoid the blow back of the strike. As the dust cleared, Ren howled a fearsome and mournful cry. That one strike had hurt her in a way more then just physically. Slowly, she lifted her gigantic claw up out of the smoking crater.

Naruto was no where to be found. At first the beast thought it had obliterated the ninja, but it turned to the left following the sound of panting. Aerore, while breathing heavily, had Naruto's shirt collar in her mouth.

As Aerore gently set him down, Naruto covered his forehead with his hand. "...Isn't fair..."

Aerore spoke in a commanding tone, though soft and motherly. "Naruto..."

Naruto tried to turn away and ignore her.

"Naruto." She spoke once more, with a stronger tone.

He grimaced and faced the beaten wolf mother.

"Look at me Naruto, don't turn away. It isn't your fault."

"I should have gotten here faster..."

Aerore sighed. "There was nothing you could-"

"I could have done something! Anything! It's...It's because of this Luna's life is ruined! I failed her! She can never walk again now because of this! And now...now...Hinata and...and Kohana...." He covered his eyes. Naruto wasn't crying, but he was hurt real bad.

Naruto, I know your in pain, and I hurt as well," Aerore said as a tear sprung from her eye. "It's no easy thing for me to accept, knowing my youngest cub will be crippled, but we can at least save her life and the lives of Kohana and Hinata, but only if you regain your will to fight." She said sternly, trying her best not to think of Vulpes, or the horrific price of defeat...
"At least?" Replied Naruto. "At least!? If it hadn't been for you guys! If...If Hinata had never gotten involved with you..."

Naruto choked on the last words. He was redirecting all his anger and frustration at Aerore, but even that couldn't silence the sharp pain in his heart. No one had ever told him that they loved him before. Not one person. The thought of losing Hinata was...too painful.

"There is always an 'if' Naruto. A what if. Another possibility. A single desperate hope that we long to cling to, a lie to comfort ourselves in the darkest of hours."

The fox boy looked up at the white wolf. Tears were slowly dripping down her face. But Aerore continued speaking, despite a shakiness in her voice.

"I would love to b-believe that Luna c-could walk out of this u-unscathed. And that e-everything would just go back to n-normal..."

She paused and wiped her eyes with her front paw. "But I'd just be lying to myself...Life is, and always has been, about holding onto what you can as everything else slowly fades away. Life is cruel. Life is never fair. And you know what Naruto?"

Memories, solid pictures of Naruto's life growing up quickly flashed in front of his eyes. The pain of being picked on. The silent dread of being alone. Not a friend in the world to comfort him. Hell on earth. With a calm but weak voiced, Naruto answered.

"What?"

Aerore smiled. "In the end, it's always right."

In Naruto's mind he was remembering all the good times with his teammates; Sakura's violent rejections, Sasuke's constant rivalry, Kakashi's insistent request that Naruto would start eating healthier. Iruka's stern teachings, but kind words over a dinner of ramen. Shino and Choji getting in trouble with him after classes. Tsunade and Jiraiya smirking at his diligent training. Rock Lee giving him the thumbs up. And...Hinata standing there smiling at him.


Several endless moments passed before Naruto spoke again. He was talking to Aerore, but he faced the dying monster that was Ren as he spoke, looking for something within any of her six, hate filled eyes. For a moment, it seemed as if he had found it. "Let's go wild then."

Adrenaline pumping through his veins, Naruto summoned around 4000 shadow clones, half of which went forward to strike the weakened enemy.

Using one of his older ploys, the clones started with The 2k Barrage attack.
They may as well been gnats striking a T-rex, as all the attacks fell short of harm.
Lashing out, Ren decimated half of them. Within the cover of the smoke though, 500
transformed into large shuriken, which the remainder threw, scoring a plethora of small,
irritating nicks.

Once more, Ren charged a Chakra beam, and killed them. This time, she heard a stampede, and turned to see an army of Narutos riding on Aerore's back, each one wielding a rasengan.

Too weak to fire another Chakra beam, Ren suffered several more serious injuries. Each one causing her to yowl in pain, but not fell her. For none had hit her weak point. She managed to take down most, but while she was distracted, the real Naruto and Aerore leapt into the air. Ren managed to see Naruto, wielding an extremely large, lavender colored Rasengan, head towards her weak spot. Somehow though, he managed to project it, using the Nine tails' fox cloak to fire it like a missile.

It wouldn'tve made it, but Aeroe howled, imbuing her cry with her own energy. The lavender Rasengan covered in red energy suddenly took on the form of a wolf's head, and struck home.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: Howling Rasengan!

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Within moments, there was a bright flash of light which momentarily blinded all who saw it.

Naruto was barely able to raise his head to see what had occurred. Even with his superior healing skills, it would be weeks before he was fully healed. When the light had disappeared, Ren’s body was gone, and in it’s place were two glowing mists and Kohana, sleeping peacefully. One of the ethereal orbs were light lavender in color. Being around it, one could feel a soft, timid kindness exuding from it. One that, while meek and peaceful contained a powerful, nearly indomitable will.

The next soul was a faint, cinnamon color. It was much smaller than it’s lilac counterpart, and seemed highly disoriented. It was fearful, confused…a mixture of memories and faint images were within the otherwise innocent being. Slowly it flitted from Kohana, to Naruto, then Aerore and lastly Luna. When it came upon the injured pup, the spirit hovered down closer to it. Then somehow it made everyone around it feel it’s words, as it had no physical means of communication.

"Did I…Did I do this?" The specter asked. It’s voice was that of a toddler’s, yet the words were as clear and eloquent as if a learned adult had spoken them.

Slowly, the lavender orb, flew towards it’s companion. "No…You didn’t Ren. The Monster did."

In an instant, Naruto gasped and managed to call out to the larger orb…He recognized the voice. “Hinata!!!”

Somehow, the blonde could feel her acknowledging his presence.

"Ren..." Came the childish voice again. The crimson orb flickered from place to place. "That's such a nice name..."

"It's your name." Said Hinata.

"Name....My name? I have a name?"

The red orb seemed to swell with a blueish color, Naruto was filled with an indescribable happiness of the likes which he had never felt before. The orb was bouncing up and down, like a child, reflecting its true nature.

"Ren? Ren! That's my name! That's MY name! Ren! I have a name!"

A wave of happiness radiated from Hinata's spirit as well. "Yes, you have a name."

"I have a name..." Repeated Ren. Its reddish hue was returning as the spirit calmed down.

Naruto was pulling himself towards the floating entities, he still had no idea what was going on, only that this lavender spirit seemed to be Hinata. It was her essence, it was her. He reached out for it.

"Hinata...Is that you?"

This time, the spirit spoke to him. "Yes, Naruto, I am here."

"What happened to you?" The blonde boy asked.

"I'm not sure...I think this is my soul, and Ren's soul." The spirit confessed. Naruto then gulped.

"Does...Does that mean you're dead?"

"Not dead..." Came a weak voice from behind Naruto. Aerore was struggling to pull herself up, most of the muscles in her body were beyond their limits but she still somehow gathered the strength to stand. "...At least, not yet."

"Not yet?"

Aerore was still focusing on standing, but gave a strained explanation. "From what...I can gather...That entity we fought and defeated was...A combination of Hinata, Kohona, and Ren's body and souls...I'm guessing the witch intended to use Hinata's soul to summon Ren's...Then put Ren's soul into Kohona's body...Reviving her from the dead..."

"So then, what happened?" Asked Naruto.

"When Vulpes crossed the summoning circle...Something must have malfunctioned...I'm not sure what exactly but...There was a fourth presence in that body..."

"The monster..." Spoke Ren, her red orb shivered slightly.

"Yes. " Aerore affirmed. "It was thanks to Luna that most of the evil spirit was destroyed... and Hinata and Kohana for holding it back. Now we can put Xana’s wretched life behind us.”

“Who? Who is Xana?” Ren asked curiously. “I feel like I…I know her.”

No one who was still able to talk said anything, but Aerore turned her head in the direction of the hag’s corpse. “She was the witch who cursed you and my allies…and caused your sister such pain.”

“M-my sister?” The soul asked, before turning back to Luna. Yumi’s eyes were wide, as were those of the two other conscious children, but no one said a thing.

“Yes my precious Ren, but…It’ll be okay. She will live past this, but your brother Lupus and father Vulpes…They await us in our home.”

“Home? Where is our home…Mommy?” The young ball of raw Life asked.

“In the Afterlife…” Aerore explained gently. Somehow she managed to walk over to Yumi and pick him up by the scruff of his neck. He winced since his body still hurt, but was laid gently beside Luna. Looking up, he faced his last living parent. “Mother…”

“Yumi my son. With your Father and Lupus dead, we no longer have a pack leader. You are young still, yet you and Luna possess such energy, such potential. As of this moment I am going to give clan leadership to Crest…But I want you to look after Luna.”

“Yes Mother.” The cub managed to say. He looked to be on the verge of crying, yet he held it in. He had to be strong now, for with no parents and his sister crippled…He needed to show that he was capable of handling the harshness of reality.

“Also, in five years time…You shall become the next Clan leader, and I know you shall be great.” With that, she licked him and Luna once upon their brows affectionately. She then faced Crest and Wane, the two present wolf-fox hybrids and gave a bow, which they returned. Then she went besides Hinata’s orb of light, Ren’s own trailing behind her.

“Hinata…Thank you.”

The gates of heaven must have opened up, the light was so blinding that no one could see a thing. The spirit orbs and Aerore disappeared in the glowing mist. Naruto winced in pain to see what was happening, but he couldn't make anything out.

At last the blinding fog disappeared. There was nothing left save the body of a single dark haired girl lying unconscious on the ground.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: A Happy Ending?

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
The sound of silence. There was a deadness in the air, like the world had just been over a great tragedy and was bracing itself for the repercussions to come. The dying trees shuddered releasing withered leaves that rained on the ground. But in the midst of things, two young lovers walked hand in hand down the blistery woodland trail.

The invasion of Pain had been a little more than a week ago and Hinata had just fully recovered from her injuries. Naruto's mind was on the death of Nagato, as well as how his fellow shinobi were suffering. That's why he had suggested going to a place only the two of them knew about...So they could escape their suffering before Naruto left for the Land of Steel, and so that they could be together before...

Holding Hinata's hand tightly, Naruto and she drew ever closer to a certain cave-like den. Hinata felt a great wave of nostalgia overtake her. Just seeing the dwelling in the distance made her grow warm.

"Naruto..."

"Yeah Hinata?"

"Do you think they're still there?"

Naruto didn't answer, he wasn't sure how to. After the business in the underground fortress and the fight against Xana...It just seemed so long ago. Worst of all, it never felt concluded. It felt like all of them had lost something important that day, some more then others.

"Naruto?"

"I'm alright..."

As they approached, the shinobi's hopes slowly faltered like the dying leaves in the trees. The place looked deserted, it hadn't been touched in years. The cave was covered in mold and was cracking in some of the more 'soft' parts, making it look unstable. There was a fire pit, the bits of charcoal had long since blow away in the wind. Everything was dead and decayed, like a mausoleum.

Naruto spoke at last, surveying the ruins with a look of sadness in his eyes. "I feel old Hinata...Really, old. Just being here."

Hinata bent over to dig through a layer of leaves covering the ground. She found a small stone necklace of a wolf and fox and held it up like it was more precious then anything else in the world.

"I do too..."

Naruto tossed a skipping stone across the small lake next to the cave. It bounced once, then twice, and then finally sunk to the cold depths.

"What was it all for?"

"It was...For you, and Kiba...and and our friends."

Hearing this triggered tender memories within Hinata's heart.

She recalled meeting Xana, then growing more confident, her transformation, Meeting
Aerore, then Vulpes, Luna, Yumi, Kohana, reuniting with Naruto, telling him and Kiba the
truth, Vulpes' betrayal, and meeting with the spirit of Ren.

Then the goodbye. All of there memories, tender and untouched for years. suddenly she broke down and cried. Instantly the blonde shinobi knelt down and hugged her.

"Oh Naruto...Why, why did they have to suffer?" Hinata sobbed.

"Because of Xana and maybe Vulpes...but that was because he was in love. At least
Kohana, Luna, and Yumi are still alive right?" He tried to console her, but it seemed futile.

"But we had a part in it, we...We helped ruin their lives." Hinata cried, caught between anger and agony. "It's not fair, it's not!!! If only we had never met them, if I hadn’t met Xana, then maybe it would've been b-better for them."

As she stifled cries into his shoulders, Naruto himself remembered something. A wise saying a friend had told him.

"Hinata, there is always an 'if'. A what if. Another possibility. A single desperate hope that we long to cling to, a lie to comfort ourselves in the darkest of hours. I'd love to tell you that after we left everything was okay and now they're pretty happy, but I'd just be lying to myself...Life is, and always has been, about holding onto what you can as everything else slowly fades away. Life is cruel. Life is never fair. But y'know...In the end, it's always right somehow."

Hinata choked on her tears slightly, slowly trying to calm herself down. Slowly trying to be strong, knowing full well who Naruto was quoting.

They owed them all so much.

Naruto smiled and reached for the stone amulet, still clutched in Hinata's hands. The markings had left imprints in her skin she was holding onto to it so tightly. With tenderness, she released her grip on the necklace and slid it into Naruto's hand.

She let go of it.

"Still...It'd be nice to see them all again...You know...Just to know how they're doing-"

A rustling in the leaves behind them caused both of them to spin around.

"Sister Hinata? Naruto?" Said a familiar voice, made deeper and stronger by age.
1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.title: In the end...

1533121112111212212111121111111111121211.content:
Stepping out of the bush an older, larger Yumi appeared, his body having a some new, painful looking scars, trophies of battles passed and trials survive. He was a little bigger than Akamaru, and looked alot like Vulpes, with the kind of smile the ninja had seen Aerore use.

"You two have barely changed." He laughed running towards them. "I really
missed you guys, and Kiba and Akamaru. How are they?"

"They're fine." Hinata said after composing herself and wiping the last of her
tears. "They were hurt in a battle, but nothing too serious. How have you been?"

Being asked about his life since their last meeting made Yumi's expression to change.

He had become more serious, like he too had aged. "Hard. A lot has changed...After you guys left we found out that Luna really never would be able to walk again, after that I went through training with my older brothers. I began to become a warrior for my clan and fought many foes, I can’t say I won every fight, and every loss wasn’t graceful…Even so I’ve gotten stronger and survived, and Luna received a kind of gift."

"Gift? Whaddya mean?" Naruto asked.

"Remember when she struck the Monster while it had taken Sister Hinata and Kohana? I think that when she did, some of that stuff that spilled out was magic that Xana had put on Hinata."

"But Xana cursed my body, not my spirit, right?" The Hyuga heiress asked, becoming confused.

"To be honest I'm not sure, but mom told me...way back before we met you guys that magic affected one's being, not just their body. So maybe when the evil was being purged the curse began to break. Anyway she got your old power."

"You mean she can become human?!" Hinata gasped wide eyed.

"Yes. As a matter of fact she's human right now, and visiting Kohana's kingdom. It turns out she's an excellent ambassador. Right now she and Kohana are working together to make a safehaven for our clan. It may take a few years, but we have a better future than we had a long time ago."

"Well I'm glad to hear it Yumi." Hinata said hugging him softly. Her worries had been eased by this information, "I hope that everything works out for you. Afterall you'll be leading your pack soon."

"Yes. Kinda like how big brother Naruto wanted to become Hokage. I bet he will, the
way he beat down Xana's Monster."

"Speaking of which...Whatever happened to Kit and Grills?"




Suddenly a large figure began romping around in the trees behind them. Naruto and Hinata looked alarmed but Yumi made an annoyed face.

"Oh, come on...I didn't want to be followed..." He muttered.

Bursting from the trees was a giant bear like creature, it had on white robes as well as a shield strapped to its back. Naruto and Hinata relaxed, they knew who it was almost immediately.

"Master Yumi!" Roared the bear creature. "I'm sorry, but you were ordered not to leave my sight. I cannot allow you to wander off again."

Yumi glared. "Spare me please, Grills. I'm allowed to come here whenever I want."

"Grills?" Said both Hinata and Naruto.

The bear man blinked a few times. "I'm sorry, I vaguely recall you two from somewhere..."

"Naruto and Hinata..." Muttered Yumi.

"That's right, from the incident with the witch...Yes, I'm sorry, it's all coming back to me now."

"I can't believe it..." Said Hinata. "What are you doing here, Grills?"

"After the fight with the beast, Master Yumi succeeded in allowing both me and Master Kit to join up with their clan. It was a generous offer indeed after all the harm we had caused. I was given the position of the young master's babysitter."

"Bodyguard!" Growled Yumi.

"So Kit is a part of the clan now too?" Ask Naruto.

Grills paused for a moment, and looked down. "I'm sorry, Master Naruto. Master Kit declined and left on his own some time ago."


"Really?" Naruto asked, he looked a little dissappointed, "It's weird, but I miss the guy."

"So do I, but Kit was always that kind of man." Grills said calmly, “More than likely he's out there somewhere doing some soul searching."

"I'm sure we'll meet him again someday though." Yumi said before sitting down, Grills did the same. "So how have you two been these past years?"

Smiling, Naruto and Hinata began to relay tales of their adventures. Stories of growth, strange happenings, the loss of other close friends, and how they had been fighting Akatsuki. Yumi and Grills listened attentively, but after they finished, the Wolf-fox had a question.

"So are you two still together?"

"Well...Umm...We didn't break up but things didn't have time to take off." Naruto said, "Pervy sage had us leave a little bit after I healed up entirely, and we haven't had much time to ourselves lately....For awhile we were kind of scared to get together until Hinata told me that she loved me. " The blonde said holding his girlfriend's hand tightly.

"After that and the fight against Pain, we got together again and came here to see you guys again." Hinata continued, "And we're glad we did."

Yumi smiled bittersweetly. "Your lucky you chose today....We're leaving for Kohana's nation tomorrow."



A sharp wind from the east blew in, cascading between the group as a slight pause filled the air. The heaviness set in as a creeping realization began to dwell over the assembly of friends.

"So...You guys are leaving for good then?" Asked Naruto.

Yumi gave a melancholy response. "Yeah...At least for a long time."

"I'm sorry Master Yumi, but we can always make a trip back whenever you please. You aren't leader of the pack yet."

"I see that our 'barn girls' have caught your attention Miss Hyuga."

"Er, yes. They all look rather nice." she said.

After hearing that Sheriff gave another hearty laugh. "I'll be sure to tell them that they meet your approval Miss Hyuga."

Blushing at Sheriff's response Hinata asks him "I noticed that all of them see to be naturally like this; how did they get like this?"

Hearing her question Sheriff let out another of his hearty laughs. "They get that way from drinking our 'Kenkō-Kenkō Milk' (Healthy-healthy milk), and our 'Kenzen'na seichō Milk' (Healthy growth Milk). Would you like some Miss Hyuga?"

"Yes, how much will either of them cost?"

"Well our 'Kenkō-Kenkō Milk' is priced at 1100 yen, and our 'Kenzen'na seichō Milk' goes for 600,000 yen a serving."

After hearing the difference in prices Hinata asks "Why is the 'Kenkō-Kenkō Milk' and 'Kenzen'na seichō Milk' so differently priced if they do the same thing?"

"The answer to your question Miss Hyuga is that 'Kenkō-Kenkō Milk' is a vastly deluded version of the 'Kenzen'na seichō Milk' that would take months of drinking it to get the same results as drinking two servings of 'Kenzen'na seichō Milk'."

"Just to let you know Miss Hyuga right now we just had a few of our girls just received a promotion leaving us with a few job openings, and one of the benefits we give our workers is two free servings of our 'Kenzen'na seichō Milk' everyday."

1533322211.content:
"Lady Hinata!" called out a voice in the distance. They were close, but not close enough to Hinata who was wandering around in grass so tall that it seemed to block out the sky. Hinata did the only thing a six year old lost in a forest could do, she sat down and cried. The sobbing was partially due to being lost and alone and partially due to the giant scrapped knee she had while running away.

Her family had decided to celebrate her birthday this year by going on a small picnic in the woods around Konoha with close members of the main branch (and Neji whom her father insisted on bringing along for some reason). The party went as would be expected, the adults sat and had conversations while the children ran around and played in the many nooks and crannies around the forest. Indeed, all was going well until the kids found themselves growing bored of the usual games.

"Let's play hide and seek!" said one of them. "In this big forest and with the people we have, it will be fun!"

Everyone, including Hinata, agreed. The only one who showed no interest in the game was Neji, who had been spending the entire party glaring at everyone from the top of a tree. This didn't seem to bother any of the children, most of them were willing to play without him, but it was Hinata who approached him.

"Come play with us Brother Neji, it will be fun."

Neji shot an angry pair of eyes at the young girl. He had no interest in childish games, not when he could be training. But Hinata did not give the impression of leaving without a fight, so Neji agreed. "Very well. I'll play your little game. However, you have to be 'it' Sister Hinata."

And so she too agreed to his terms and after counting to one hundred she began searching the forest for the other children, being sure to leave behind kunai knives every so often so that she wouldn't get lost.

Little did she know, Neji had been closely following her since she had finished counting. He chuckled to himself at his own skills at stealth and for his own amusement stole the kunai knives as Hinata placed them on the ground. When he was sure Hinata would get lost, he made his way back to the picnic before disposing of the knives so that no one would suspect him of being involved in Hinata's disappearance.

It didn't take long for Hinata to find herself completely lost and when she tried to turn around to find her way back to the picnic she found that her trail of kunai knives had been cut off. Needless to say, she was terrified.

"I'll just have to press on," she said to comfort herself. "They'll find me eventually."

But minutes turned into hours, and before long darkness crept over the forest. Hinata was tired from walking so much and she was nowhere nearer from finding the exit. Back at the picnic, all of the children returned to the party after growing bored. Hinata's father took notice of his daughter's absence and questioned the children, but they did not know where she was in the forest. Angered, her father sent a search party to look for Hinata.

Meanwhile in the forest, by a bit of misfortune Hinata wandered into a nearby cave hoping to find someone who could help her find her way back. There was no one inside the cave, no one except a few playful furry animals who startled the young heir. Hinata had managed to stumble into a bear cave and at that very moment the mother of the cubs was just returning from her hunt.

In the pitch black of the cave all Hinata could see was a pair of big red eyes and a mouthful of fangs charging at her. She screamed and scrambled out of the cave, she made it only to trip on the way out and badly scrap her knee. Once outside she limped for the tall grass, hoping to hide from the 'monster' chasing her.

And this is where she found herself, she attempted to stifle her cries so that the giant bear after her wouldn't hear her. But it didn't do any good, the bear could find her easily by the smell of blood.

It got closer and closer. Hinata felt the hot tears drip down her face. She had never been so terrified in her life.

"Lady Hinata!" called out the voice again, it too was closer but not as close as the monster chasing her.

Finally, the bear poked its horrible mangy snout out of the brush and stared right at her with its cold glowing eyes. It growled a horrible bloodthirsty roar and charged right at Hinata. She didn't even have time to scream...

~

"Hinata!" shouted Hanabi, kicking her sister's bed. "Wake up you're going to be late for your mission!"

Hinata jumped from her horrible nightmare. That's all it was, a memory from the past come back to haunt her for some reason. She breathed in and out a few times trying to compose herself, she was so shook up that she had been crying. It had been awhile indeed since she had thought back to her sixth birthday, the day she developed her terrible fear of bears. Melissophobia it was called, ever since she was rescued from that mother bear that frightening night she couldn't bare to be in the presence of one of the furry mammals no matter how friendly the animal was. Her father took her to doctors to attempt to cure her of it, but no treatment ever seemed to stick. Not that it ever seemed to get in the way of her training or daily life, her father just didn't like the fact that his heir would have such an embarrassing weakness. After the tenth attempt to cure it, however, he just gave up trying and Hinata learned to live with it.

"HINATA!" Hanabi shouted again, Hinata had been spacing out the entire time.

"W-what is it, sister?"

"You have a mission with your team today, remember!? You need to get going or you'll be late!"

"R-right...Um...What was it again?"

Hanabi sighed. "Can't you remember anything? Your team's supposed to..."
1533322211.title: Bearly asleep.

15333222112.content:
"Yours team's supposed to go to that ninja clan that is visiting with Lady Tsunade. Probably to do odd-jobs for them and the like."

The clan of ninjas Hanabi was referring to were an odd bunch. They were perhaps one of the last group of nomadic ninjas left in the world, they traveled the land staying in no country for too long and retaining a neutral position in most types of conflict between the bigger ninja nations. It was because of their neutral position that they were usually welcomed into most ninja countries with no questions asked. A neutral party traveling between various nations was seen as a good thing as the clan traded with each country as they went along, sometimes they even had news to share all of which were highly valued especially by nations such as Konoha. Aside from being a known nomadic clan, however, no one really knew much about them. Not what their techniques were, not their system of government, not even their leader's name. This was why Lady Tsunade had arranged for a personal welcome with the leader of the clan. The whole village saw this as an opportunity, and everyone was doing their best to make the clan feel welcomed.

"T-that's right...Thank you Hanabi."

"Don't thank me yet. Father is on his way upstairs, he already very angry with you for oversleeping on such an important mission for the village. You might want to sneak out through the window before he comes up."

And with that, Hanabi left Hinata alone in the room. The Hyuga heiress quickly tore off her silk pajamas and threw on her usual outfit; dark blue pants, gray fuzzy coat, black fishnet shirt. She finished putting everything on just in time for her bedroom doorknob to start violently turning. She dove out the window as the door to her bedroom opened to reveal her very angry father. This was going to be a very eventful day.

~

Hinata had just managed to escape getting a lecture from her father (though she felt terrible about running away like that and was sure he'd be even more angry with her when she returned home today). She jumped from rooftop to rooftop heading for the nomadic clan's assigned spot in the forest's outside of Konoha. Lady Tsuande had offered them lodging within the village itself, but for some reason their leader preferred that his people remained in the woods, so the Hokage granted an entire clearing to them. It was by some odd coincidence that the spot she gave them was the very spot where Hinata's family had that picnic so long ago.

"Maybe it has something to do with my dream I had." Hinata thought to herself, but quickly shrugged it off. It was just an odd nightmare she had, nothing more.

But she was in for a huge and frightening surprise when she arrived at the clearing to find her teammates cleaning and pampering a group of large furry animals. All the feeling in her knees suddenly gave away.

"B-b-bears!?"

Kiba was the first on her team to take notice of her. As he turned to greet her, he failed to notice that the hose he had in his hand to wash the bears with was spraying Shino. "Oh. Hey Hinata! We were wondering when you would show up!"

"Kiba, what the hell are you doing!?" Yelled Shino as he stood drenched in water.

"Huh? Oh, sorry about that Shino. You could probably use the bath anyway with all those bugs crawling on you, right?"

"That's funny...The one who comes from a family of smelly dog keepers is talking to me about proper hygiene!"

"What!? Why you...!"

The two went at each other from there while Hinata still stood frozen in fear at the sight of the three bears who were puzzled as to why their bathers suddenly started fighting with each other. Shino and Kiba didn't stop until a strange man separated the both of them.

"Cut it out, both of you. Your sensei placed her trust in me to make sure you didn't kill each other, and I aim to keep that promise."

The man looked like no one Hinata had ever seen before. He was tall and muscular and wore little to no clothing, save for a pair of leather pants covered with feathers that traveled up the sides of the legs. His torso and arms were covered in beads, multicolored feathers, and bands. His black hair was long and done up in a ponytail with another single large golden feather tying it together. With both boys in hand by their collars, the man finally took notice of Hinata.

"And who might you be little miss?"

But Hinata was still on her knees unable to move at the sight of the bears. They seemed to be responding to this large man and followed him closely as he approached Hinata to help her up.

"B-but...t-the...b-bears...," was all she managed to get out.

"The bears?" said the man. "Oh, you needn't worry about them. They're all very well behaved and won't harm anyone unless you give them reason to."

He was beginning to worry when Hinata's reaction didn't change. Even her teammates were starting to take notice to her unusual behavior.

"Hinata? You okay?" asked Kiba.

"...I-I...d-don't like...b-bears..." she said, instinctively rubbing the spot on her knee where she tripped and fell so many years ago.

"Well, there's other things that need to be accomplished elsewhere if you'd feel more comfortable away from the bears. Come on now."

The man dropped Shino and Kiba like a sack of potatoes and gently picked up Hinata before whispering something to the bears following him. After that, he told Shino and Kiba to get back to giving the bears a bath and carried Hinata away.

~

Sometime later, after she recovered from the initial shock, Hinata discovered that the man's name was Gunther. He was the leader of the clan of nomadic ninjas, if they could even be called ninjas. Unlike the ninjas of other villages, they carried no kunai knives nor did they even wear headbands. They were also 'more closer to the Earth' as Lady Tsunade put it, growing crops to feed themselves and communicating with the nature around them. This explained why they had several bears traveling with them.

"The gold-feather clan, as they like to be called, use the bears as protectors of sorts," explained Lady Tsunade to Hinata and her team. "They believe the bears to contain spirits of their ancestors and hold them as sacred animals. In return, the bears provide the clan with gifts of honey and their steadfast protection from enemies."

"So, they're much like the Nara clan and their affinity with deer." said Shino.

"Precisely. Which is why you are all are to show the utmost respect around the bears. No fainting," she added, her eyes trailing to Hinata.

Hinata gave a yelp of surprise and bowed in apology. "I-I apologize, Lady T-Tsunade. I can't h-help myself. I have a t-terrible fear of bears."

"Hmph, then you'd best take the jobs that do not involve interacting with them as Gunther suggested. We don't want to give our guests the wrong impression about us, so I want you all on your best behaviors!"

"Yes ma'am!" all three said in unison.

After that, Hinata's day went on with little trouble. She did her best to steer clear of contact with the bears which was easy enough considering most of them spent time around the woods far outside the ninja's camp. She was given jobs such as kitchen work and herb gathering, while Kiba and Shino focused on any jobs concerning the bears. The gold-feather ninjas were extremely friendly the entire time, and appreciated all the help that the team gave them no matter how trivial the task.

Before long, the sun was setting and it was time to leave. The ninjas gave the team their thanks and everyone was looking forward to their jobs tomorrow. But just as Hinata headed down the road back to the mansion, she was approached by...
15333222112.title: Ninjas or shaman?

153332221121.content:
Hinata slowly headed down the path as dusk overcame the surrounding woods. She turned around just for a brief second, she could have sworn she heard something behind her. Activating her Byakugan, she scanned the area behind her. There was no one around for several hundred yards.

"Hey there!" said a booming voice behind her.

Hinata screamed and fell flat on her butt. The person who had been behind her towered over her. It was Gunther! He apologetically reached his hand down to help her up.

"Sorry about that," he said, hoisting Hinata to her feet. "I didn't mean to scare you like that, Miss Hinata."

"I-It's no trouble..." Hinata replied sheepishly, recalling what Lady Tsunade said about maintaining the village's image. "I-I just thought y-you were one of the bears..."

Gunther frowned. "You have nothing to fear of them. Lady Tsunade spoke to you all already, didn't she? The bears are our clan's guardians. They will only harm our enemies and even then only at our command."

"I-I know..." Hinata did her best to sound reassured, but Gunther was able to see right through her.

"Why do you have such a fear of bears, if you don't mind me being so straight forward?"

"It's a l-long story..."

"Well, I have time if you do. Come, let's head to my tent. I'll fix up some nice tea and we can have a chat."

Before Hinata could even decline or oblige, Gunther grabbed her around the waist and threw her over his shoulders next to a few dead animals that he had been hunting. She didn't make much of a fuss as she thought it would be rude considering the leader of the clan wished to have tea with her. Nevertheless, she wasn't exactly looking forward to this tea party. The two made their way back to camp.

~

The camp was much more quieter at night than it was during the day. Most of the ninjas were gathered in their own tents, cooking whatever they had hunted during the day for their supper. Gunther and Hinata only saw a few faces as they headed for Gunther's tent which was on a large cliff that overlooked much of the Konoha forest. Gunther's tent was much larger and decorative than the other tents Hinata had seen around the camp, and impossibly so the inside of it appeared to be even bigger than the outside let on.
