Hinata was gently set down on a pile of feather pillows in the center of the tent surrounding a warm glowing fire. Gunther took off his own caught animals and turned for another section of tent behind a wall of beads.

"Let me just set these down and prepare the tea. Feel free to look around."

But Hinata was already enraptured by the many sights and smells of the tent. The air was full of incense and smoke, which gave an otherworldly feeling to Gunther's home. Hanging from the ceiling by bits of string were various stuffed birds and animals, some of which Hinata had never seen before. A squirrel with two heads. A bird that appeared to be part horse. But most imposing of all the decorations was the giant stuffed bear with golden fur that shone like the sun. It had to be standing in over fifteen feet in length on its hind legs and was almost touching the top of the tent. Hinata shivered at the thought of encountering such an animal while it was living.

Gunther returned with two cups of steaming liquids. "Drink this, it'll warm you right up."

Hinata bowed as she took the warm cup and carefully drank the contents. It tasted sweet yet spicy. Like a creamy mixture of honey and cinnamon. Gunther took a sip of his own cup and gave a refreshed sigh.

"It's an ancient recipe passed down by our clan. We normally exchange these cups only when meeting with important visitors or guests."

"W-Well, thank you. I'm h-honored." said Hinata, as her eyes trailed yet again to the stuffed bear behind Gunther.

Gunther turned his head. "Ah, you're looking at our patriarch. The founder of our clan."

"Your clan f-founder was a bear?"

"Mm. Yes and no," Gunther reached into his waist pouch and pulled out a long pipe. "Our clan has always had a close affinity with animals, particularly bears. Legends say that our ancestors were so close to the bears that they weren't human at all, That they were able to change between human form and bear form at will. But such arts are lost to time, that bear you see behind me is said to be the man that united our people together with the bears permanently, and he was the last member of our clan to be able to shift forms like in the legends."

He blew a ring of smoke out of his pipe and smiled. "Now then, why are you so afraid of bears? I know people fear them in the wild, but I have never meant someone so paralyzed in fear by the sight of one."

So Hinata told him her tale of her youth. How her own clan celebrated her birthday and how it quickly turned into chaos when she disappeared. She was sure to go into great detail concerning the bear that attacked her. All the time, Gunther listened intently and when she finally finished he sat back and thought for a moment.

"You are aware," he spoke. "That that bear was only trying to protect it's young? That it was probably more afraid of you than you were on it?"

Hinata found that hard to believe, the thought of the red eyes and fangs still terrified her to this day. "I-I suppose."

Gunther snorted black smoke out of his nose. "Yet you still retain an irrational fear of bears. Hmm, what if I were to say there may be a cure to your aliment?"

"Oh n-no...Many of o-our village's greatest d-doctors have attempted finding a c-cure. Nothing worked though..."

"The cure would be very unlike any other cure you've tried so far. In fact, it is a trial that all of our young members entering adulthood must go through in order to earn their place in the hunt. But..." There was a hanging tone in his voice.

"B-But...?" asked Hinata.

Gunther suddenly had a very serious look on his face. "Now pay attention Miss Hinata. What I am about to tell you is one of our clan's most ancient jutsu's. It is a part of our culture and is never shared with outsiders, even the very act of telling you of its existence is punishable by exile from the clan."

"T-Then why mention it to me?"

There was a surprised look on Gunther's face, like he hadn't thought about why he did it. "Well...Because you are of the Hyuga clan and are well renowned in the village of Konoha. Helping you would be a boost to my clan's reputation in your village. And..."

His voice trailed off. A warm look suddenly glowed in his eyes. "And your need sounds sincere and dire. As a man, I cannot look away from your plight. Not while I have the power to cure it potentially."

Hinata was somewhat shocked by his answer. She felt honored, no one had ever really given her the amount of respect like Gunther just (except for Naruto). She nodded and calmly said. "W-Well, after hearing your cause for such reasons, I must at least hear your proposal."

He grinned. "Then I will not stretch the truth about the process. Simply put, I will turn you into a bear."

Hinata stood quiet for a full thirty seconds before answering. "W-what?"

"Using the ancient jutsu passed down by our patriarch, you will slowly turn into a bear and learn to live as one. The actual transformation takes roughly a week, during which you will come to the camp normally. Once you've changed, I will tell your superiors that you're helping me with a specific task and you'll live like a bear for two full weeks. After which, the spell will wear off and you'll slowly turn back to normal over the course of a week. In other words, the entire process will take a month."

Hinata was speechless, dumbfounded was a good word to use.

"As I said, this is a rite we put our young through. They are turned into bears and sent out to live on their own in the wild. There they commune with other bears and learn to become a part of the family. It is something I hope you will learn to do, and by doing so you will be cured of your fear of bears."

There was no rational way to describe what was going on in Hinata's head. She had lived most of her life in fear of bears, but to actually BECOME one!? It seemed absurd...yet...it also felt so crazy that it would have to work. She sat there with her mouth open, lost in thought.

Gunther sensed her confusion. "I understand such a bizarre offer would make it hard to give an answer immediately. So I will await your response by the end of the day tomorrow. You will have twenty four hours to think it over."

Hinata still didn't move.

"Off you go then. Stay safe." Gunther picked her up again and carried her outside and all the way to her home. He left her on the doorstep and after she was scolded by her father for being both late to go to her mission and late to return home she went to sleep.

Ultimately, Hinata decided...
153332221121.title: A remedy to the fear.

1533322211211.content:
Hinata had a dreamless sleep that night, the majority of the reason for it was that so much was on her mind that she hardly had any time to sleep at all. It didn't seem possible. Sure, there had been jutsu that transformed people into other animals, but they worked vastly differently then what Gunther was suggesting. The user of the jutsu's true form would not be altered but merely replaced by another. This jutsu had to be more like a shape-shifting spell, if Hinata used it her true form would be that of a bear's.

There would be no going back for a month. She'd be stuck in the form of the thing she feared the most for four whole weeks. It seemed insane. What could that accomplish that dozens of therapy sessions and medicines couldn't? But then why did it seem so plausible, like Hinata needed to do it? Why did the thought of it both excite her and terrify her?

Hinata awoke groggily the next day, this time she was sure to be on time when going to the camp for she woke up at the crack of dawn.

As she sloppily put on her clothes and headed downstairs for some breakfast, her mind still turned to Gunther's offer. This wasn't going to be an easy decision. On the way down, she looked around at her life. Gunther said that the first week the changes would slowly begin, what sort of changes would they be exactly? Would her family notice them? Would her teammates?

What about when she left for the woods for half a month? Her family would probably buy any excuse Gunther gave them, in fact they might even be proud of her for being chosen for such a specific assignment from an honored guest of Konoha. She imagined the look on her father's face when she told him that she not only completed the 'assignment' given to her by the head ninja of the gold-feather clan but also conquered her foolish fear of bears.

Of course, that was assuming that this idea would even work. It was one thing to live as the thing you feared the most, but it was quite another to face it. Then there was the fear of the jutsu not working. What if because Hinata was an outsider something went wrong? What if she somehow got stuck as a bear for the rest of her life? This could probably be the biggest risk she'd ever take in her life.

Hinata didn't stop thinking about it, not even as she walked outside and headed for the ninja camp. Her head was so far in the clouds that she didn't even see Naruto running around backwards on his hands heading straight for her. They collided right into each other.

"Omph," grunted Naruto as he landed on top of Hinata. "Oh, sorry about that Hinata. I didn't even see you there."

Hinata's face turned completely red, suddenly her own problem with deciding on what to do didn't seem to be the biggest thing on her mind. Naruto's face was literally inches away from her own.

"Here, let me help you up at least."

"T-thanks...W-what were y-you doing h-here, Naruto?"

"Training! I need to get stronger so I asked Rock Lee if he knew any good training exercises. He told me that running around Konoha on my hands backwards is sure to make me faster and stronger."

"That's crazy." said Hinata, a little more bluntly than was usual for her.

"You know, I thought it would be too but..." Naruto flexed. "I'm starting to feel stronger already, and it builds endurance like crazy."

Naruto laughed and put his hands behind his head. "I guess no matter how stupid or insane something seems, you'll never know if it will work or not unless you try it. If you're not willing to make the risk then you can't ever go forward, right? You can sit around at home and hope things will get better for you or you can take the risks and just maybe change things for yourself for the better."

There was a slight pause after that. Naruto laughed again. "I guess I sound pretty goofy then, huh?"

"N-No, not at all. It w-was quite profound."

"Really? Huh. Anyway, I got to get back to training before the sun rises and we go on another mission. Where are you headed?"

"T-The nomadic ninja camp. My t-team was assigned to help them there."

"Ah, well good luck. Maybe we should hang out sometime later, I could use the break."

"Y-Yeah...Maybe later..."

And with that, the blonde did another handstand and went right back to running. Hinata watched him until he disappeared and smiled to herself. Naruto was right, this was a chance to improve herself and if she didn't take it she'd regret it forever. The clan was only in the village for a month. She had to do this now or there'd never be another chance like it. Her mind had been made up and she walked confidently to the camp.

~

The day of work went by no differently then the previous day. Though Naruto's little speech inspired her, Hinata couldn't get over her fear of the bears though she did try to help Shino and Kiba once. They were supposed to help with the birth of a new bear, but one of the larger started to approach Hinata and she froze up again. Gunther had came to her rescue and she spent the rest of the day chopping firewood and helping with the cooking. Still, she was determined to go through with Gunther's idea.

When the sun finally set and her teammates said their goodbyes, she headed straight for Gunther's tent. Inside, the giant man was waiting for her underneath the stuffed patriarch. There was a large cauldron bubbling over the fire, adding a new smell to the scent of incense.

"Seeing you here," said Gunther. "I am to assume that you've made up your mind."

"Y-Yes." said Hinata.

She clenched her fists together and bit down hard, trying to build up as much courage as she could. At last she spoke, without stuttering and will a clear confident voice.

"I want to do it. Make me into a bear."

Gunther smiled warmly. "I knew you'd be brave enough to go through with it. There's a spirit inside of you not much different than others from my clan. You have a strong thirst to proof yourself Hinata, and that will always make you stronger. Now, we can begin..."

He motioned to the giant cauldron in front of him, Hinata leaned over and peered inside. It contained a bubbling golden liquid. The strangest thing was that when Hinata stared long enough into the cauldron, she could have almost sworn something bear-shaped was forming with the bubbles. Gunther presented her with a cup.

"Take this and dip it into the cauldron. Once you have a healthy amount of the contents in the cup, you must drink the entire thing."

Hinata took the cup. This was it, her last chance to turn back. She quickly found her resolve bubbling like the liquid in the cauldron, Gunther saw the troubled look on her face and smiled warmly again.

"Having second thoughts?"

"N-no...Just nervous..."

"There's no need to be. The drink is as sweet as honey. You'll be back to normal before you know it, and all for the better. Now drink up."

Hinata nodded and dipped the cup into the cauldron. The golden liquid slowly worked it's way into the cup like sap. After what felt like an eternity the cup was finally filled almost all the way up to the top. Gunther raised his own cup of what appeared to be tea as if to give a toast.

"To curing you of your fears."

Hinata closed her eyes and swallowed. She opened them in surprise. The liquid DID taste sweet, it was very sugary and Hinata found herself enjoying the taste. When the last of it trickled down into her stomach Hinata looked intently at Gunther. She didn't feel any different.

"W-What happens now?" she asked.

"Now, you just go home and rest. You'll feel no different than you normally will. The changes will probably have already begun first thing in the morning of the next day, so try not to wake up surprised. But the changes won't be so noticeable that we will have to pull you from your duties."

"Okay, t-thanks again." bowed Hinata as she turned to leave.

"By the way," added Gunther. "The average size of a female bear your age is about nine to ten feet, the bears we raise are very large. You may want to look into a temporarily larger wardrobe."

Hinata nodded and left for home.
1533322211211.title: Yes it is.

15333222112111.content:
It had been the first night in awhile since Hinata had slept so soundly. Whatever was in the cauldron had really filled her up and made her really tired, the moment she got home she went straight to bed and passed out instantly.

The next morning Hinata lazily stretched and sat up, completely forgetting about what happened yesterday. She casually eyed her alarm clock. Seven o'clock. Odd, she had came in last night at seven o'clock, but she didn't remember much after that. Did she really fall asleep for twelve hours? And why did she feel so much more heavier for some reason? It was like there was a heavy weight in her stomach. She looked down and yelped.

"Wha-wha-what happened to me?"

Her clothes, which she had fallen asleep in last night, were no longer a perfect fit on her. Her stomach was now protruding out from under her jacket by several inches like a giant potbelly. It jiggled when Hinata poked it, pure fat. To Hinata's horror, it wasn't just her belly that had grown. Everywhere felt a little bigger; her butt, her breasts, her arms, her thighs, everything! Standing up, Hinata tried to get a better look at herself only to discover her view of her room seemed a little bit higher than usual.

Her clothes looked a little small on her now, like she had a miniature growth spurt overnight. Looking over to her door frame (which had her height marked on it from year to year) she discovered that she was over three inches taller since her last measurement, making her effectively five feet tall. What had happened!?

You may want to look into a temporarily larger wardrobe. Gunther's advice from last night replayed in Hinata's mind.

Was that what he meant by looking into bigger clothes? There was only one way for her to find out, head to the ninja camp and ask him. Hinata waddled over to the door. Unfortunately these were the largest clothes she had right now, no other outfit she had would be any different. She would just have to endure it during her duties until the day was over and go quickly buy a new outfit that would fit her.

She took one step out the door before doubling over in pain. Her stomach was growling fiercely, she felt famished! But if she stopped to eat breakfast, she'd be late for her job at the ninja camp. Her stomach rumbled again, there was no winning this fight.

"...I-I suppose a little s-snack won't hurt..."

~

Thankfully everyone who was supposed to be up at this hour in her house were no where to be seen in the kitchen. Hinata opened the fridge and immediately started to chow down. It wasn't until a half an hour later did she finally stop eating and her giant belly had grown even bigger. But it took that much food just to sate the unending hunger in the pit of her stomach.

Feeling embarrassed, she headed straight for the ninja camp, not stopping for anything. Who knows what someone would say if they saw her like this? She felt like she was carrying a bowling ball for a belly.

She eventually reached the ninja camp to discover that Gunther was at the entrance waiting for her, much to her relief.

"Ah good," he said, waving hello to Hinata as she approached. "I see that the changes are already going along smoothly."

"Y-you mean this was s-supposed to happen?" asked Hinata, pointing at her large muffin top.

"Of course." he stood next to her and measured his height with his hand. "Bears are much larger mammals then we are, you have a lot of growing you need to do over the course of the next week. I did mention that you should find a larger wardrobe, didn't I?"

"Y-yes! But I d-didn't think this is what you meant!"

"Oh don't make such a fuss. Your changes are coming along smoothly, have you eaten yet?"

Hinata blushed. "Yes, I...a-ate all the food in our fridge."

Gunther laughed. "Sounds about right, your body needs the food to grow. You'll be eating much more each day until the changes are complete. Judging by the outfit you're wearing, I'd say you don't have any larger clothes, right?"

"W-well..."

"I figured as much. Not to worry, I'll give you some time after lunch to run a few 'errands' in the village. You can spend the extra time you'll have to get more fitting clothes. I expect by then you'll have grown even more, so be sure to pick the largest outfits you can find."

This was all happening too fast, Hinata's head was spinning. She knew she was going to be in for a headache, but this was too much.

"By the way, you'll be working with someone else today. I believe you two know each other."

Working with someone while blowing up like a balloon wasn't Hinata's idea of a good time. "W-who is it?"

It was...
15333222112111.title: Beginnings.

choices: Their first chore is buying food for the bears
Their first chore is buying natural hygienic materials
153332221121111.content:
"Your partner will be Naruto Uzumaki." Gunther told her, "He noticed your comrades and offered to help out of his own time. I got to speak with him and he mentioned you, naturally I thought he would be a good companion."

"O-oh...Naruto will be working with me..." she trailed off, more to herself than Gunther. She could feel her heart beat go faster and faster, spending time alone with Naruto would be wonderful, but what if he was off put by her sudden changes? Hinata was already feeling embarrassed, thinking of him pointing out how big she had gotten. Gunther had noticed her blush.

"Are you ok Hinata?"

"Oh? I'm f-fine...Just a little hungry maybe." Hinata said half-truthfully. Gunther nodded to her.

"Well don't worry, I'll make sure we feed you something." he said going through a bag and handing her a satchel, it gave off a sweet smell. "For now have these."

Looking in Hinata saw some small blueberries. Instinctively she reached down and ate them. They were delicious.

"Bears are mostly carnivores so you may prefer meat, but these berries should sate your hunger if it really bothers you." the nomad explained. "If you ever need them just let me know, and I'll provide them."

"Oh, thank you." Hinata said before devouring some. Her eyes widened at how delicious it was. She decided to try just a couple more and save some for later. "So, do you know where Naruto is?"

"He's over at the Village entrance gate. he'll have a list of the things you're supposed to do."

"Alright. I'll be off Gunther. Thank you."

"You're welcome, be safe." Gunther said waving.

Several minutes later Hinata arrived at the village entrance and looked for Naruto. She didn't have to wait long as she saw him asleep next to the post. The kunoichi giggled to herself a little at how cute he looked. She wanted to just watch him or awhile, but decided it would be best to awaken him.

She poked him gently with one finger, and he instantly took a pained expression.

"Ow!" he cried. "What was that?"

"Oh Naruto are you alright?" Hinata asked fearfully. She reached out to him and noticed that her nails had grown sharp, not unlike Kiba's. She gasped inaudibly when she saw a spot of blood on them.

"Yeah...A bug must've bit me or something after I fell asleep." he said before looking at Hinata oddly. "Hey Hinata you look different...You did something with your hair right?"

Hinata looked at her hair and it was the same as before. Naruto had registered that she looked different, but not why. She was somewhat relieved and a bit surprised.

"Um...Something like that." Hinata replied before eating a blueberry. "B-but I'm here to help with the mission."

"Oh right, they sent you to help me." Naruto said smiling, "Honestly I'm glad they didn't tell anyone like Kiba or Shino...They'd be no fun at all. Anyway lets go."

"S-sure." Hinata said happily, she was glad that Naruto seemed happy to have her around.
153332221121111.title: A Dream come true or a nightmare?

1533322211211111.content:
The walk back to the village could not have been more awkward for Hinata. All the while during the journey, people were staring at her and her pudgy stomach sticking out of her jacket. Some of the villagers who recognized Hinata pointed and said things like "Isn't that the Hyuga heir?" or "My word, what did that girl eat?" This embarrassed Hinata to no end, she blushed the whole way and snacked on some blueberries in a vain attempt to block out the stares.

At least having Naruto around with her lightened the mood somewhat. While Hinata never said one word the entire walk, Naruto made up for her silence by talking nonstop. He'd tell her all sorts of things: what sort of training he was going to do later, how his last mission went, and even what he was planning on eating later. Hinata couldn't help but laugh a few times. So long as Naruto was there to make things easier for her, perhaps this whole process wouldn't be so bad after all.

When they at last arrived in the market district of the village, Naruto got more serious again.

"Alright," he said. "What's the first thing we need to do on the list Hinata?"

He had handed Hinata the list for safekeeping, or rather Hinata insisted on carrying the list so that nothing would happen to it. It could have been a bit too overcautious, but with Naruto it was wise to not take chances.

"U-um..." said Hinata, trying not to get blueberry juice on the paper. "It says t-the first thing on the list is...to c-collect the listed foods for the bears."

Hinata caught herself drooling after reading the first few items of food. Roasted smoked pork. Fresh salmon and tuna. Even fruits and berries of all kinds. This was going to be slightly more challenging to do than Hinata had initially hoped for.

"Well?" smirked Naruto. "Where do we begin?"

Hinata picked something less tempting to start with, the fruits and vegetables, having already a sack full of blueberries handy- albeit it was rapidly being depleted - Hinata could tide herself over when picking out most of the foods. Her stomach was growling something fierce, however.

Naruto gathered up the bags, he demanded that he carry most of it claiming it would be good training. He grinned. "What next?"

The list of food had them running all over the village. From the butcher to the fish vendor, Naruto and Hinata both were getting well acquainted with the merchants. And the food kept piling up into one big mountain in Naruto's arms, he was struggling to keep it all from falling over.

Hinata on the other hand was struggling with her own internal battles. She was already completely out of blueberries when they finished half of their itinerary and was feeling famished again, just like she did this morning when she cleaned out her kitchen. It was taking every ounce of willpower and mental strength to not dive on the glorious mountain of delicious food Naruto was carrying and chow down.

When they finally finished, Naruto grunting and groaning under the weight of all the food, Hinata sighed in relief.

"S-shall we head back now, Naruto?"

Naruto took slow and heavy steps forward and managed to spit out. "S-sure...N-no problem...I-I can do this...H-how long is it u-until the camp again, Hinata?"

"A g-good mile at least, Naruto."

And with that Naruto gave a giant groan and the entire mountain of food started to shiver violently. Hinata could sense that Naruto was quickly losing his edge over holding the entire thing up. Reacting quickly, she came to his aid.

"P-Please, Naruto let me help you with that."

With just one hand, she grabbed the bottom of the pile were Naruto was holding it. It felt odd. For some reason, even though she knew she was putting pressure on it to lift it up, she felt like she wasn't holding anything at all. She tried lifting up a little harder and...

"Woah! Hey! What the heck's happening, Hinata!?"

She wasn't even sure if she could answer that herself. From her point of view, it looked like she had lift not only the entire mountain of food but Naruto as well several feet into the air with one arm. That had to be ridiculous though, she could never be that strong. But there she was, holding up the pile of treats like it was a cardboard box with Naruto's feet dangling around underneath it.

Naruto finally let go and landed flat on his butt. His eyes widened as he looked up at Hinata. "Wow! I mean...Wow! I had no idea you were that strong Hinata!"

"I-I had no idea e-either..."

"Are you going to be okay carrying it back like that? I mean, I did offer to carry it all myself but it looks like you don't even need me!"

"Y-yes, this isn't that heavy," she replied as she used her other hand to get a better grip.

"Well, if you're sure..." he dusted himself off. "Shall we head back to the camp then?"

And with that, they both made their way as quickly as they could back to the nomad's camp. After all those chores, it was already lunchtime and Naruto was as hungry as Hinata at this point. It didn't help that Hinata was receiving even more stares carrying the food as she was. But she shrugged it off and they made it to the camp just before noon came around. To Hinata's surprise Gunther was there waiting for them.

"I was wondering when you two would arrive back here. Lunch is already being served around the campfire, why don't you come with me Hinata and we'll put the food in storage."

Hinata followed him as Naruto ran off to claim a seat by the main fire in the middle of camp. Gunther led her to what appeared to be a log cabin smoke house and told her to set the food down in the corner.

"You didn't eat any of the food, did you Hinata?" he asked.

"N-no. But believe m-me, it was tempting."

"I know it was. You could have called that a little test of sorts, and you passed with flying colors. It is easy as a bear to lose yourself to the nature of the beast. You must keep a clear mind, a focused one. You are human first, only in bear form."

"U-Um. Mr.Gunther...H-How did I exactly carry that huge pile of food here? It f-felt like nothing to me."

He laughed. "That's merely your new found energy being used to its potential. You'll find yourself growing even stronger as the days go by."

He led Hinata out of the hut and slammed the door shut. "Now that that's all done, let's go get something to eat. You'll no doubt want to replenish that lost energy and you'll be heading back to the village again afterwards."
1533322211211111.title: Temptation.

15333222112111112.content:
Lunch went on without any truly interesting happening. Like yesterday, all of the camp gathered in front of the grand campfire at the center of the settlement. Everyone from the gold-feather clan who saw Hinata didn't seem all that surprised by her appearance, Gunther must have had a discussion with them beforehand. Kiba and Shino, who hadn't seen Hinata all day, on the other hand responded with a general shock that would be expected.

"Hinata, is that you!? What in the world happened!?"

Hinata was afraid that this would have happened, unfortunately Naruto handled it with his usual grace. "What do you guys mean? Her new hairstyle doesn't look that bad."

"What- Are you dense Naruto!? Can't you see how swollen she looks?"

Naruto looked at Hinata long and hard, making the poor girl blush and feel even more uncomfortable. "Hmm...Yes?"

This got Kiba even more agitated. "What do you mean, yes!? Are you blind as well as stupid Naruto?"

"What did you say dogbreath!?"

Their argument began to quickly escalate after that. Hinata tried her best to think of something that would cease the fighting between the two, but her mind was going blank. Thankfully, Gunther saw the rising conflict and quickly stepped in, having prepared a story beforehand.

"Children, stop this bickering at once or I'll have you all thrown out of the camp. Hinata accidentally ate one of the poisonous berries from the fauna around here. It isn't deadly but causing swelling, which is why she looks like this. You can stop your worrying, we've already given medicine for it. Right, Hinata?"

Hinata gave Gunther a look a relief and nodded. "Y-Yes, I'm fine."

After that outburst, things settled down until lunch ended. Kiba and Shino went back to gathering firewood from within the forest while Naruto and Hinata looked over the list Gunther gave them to find out what they had to accomplish next (but not before Hinata personally thanked Gunther in private for covering for her). The next item up was to gather weapon supplies, which confused the both of them.

"Aren't these guys peaceful?" asked Naruto. "I mean, it's no business of ours, but what could they want with this stuff?"

Hinata shrugged, she didn't know the answer either. It was unusual for Konoha to vendor off weapons to people from outside the village excluding underground black market dealings. Gunther probably had his reasons to ask for such things and it wouldn't be any trouble for them to get the weapons, it was just odd was all.

And truthfully, Hinata didn't care about what task they had to complete for Gunther now. As Gunther had pointed out during their brief talk after lunch, Hinata had grown even more over the course of the day. It didn't look like much but her belly was definitely sticking out further then it had been just this morning. Her clothes were all tightly wrapped around her chubby form and quite frankly it was becoming difficult to walk in them. Gunther must have sensed her discomfort and said to her.

"Looks like those clothes are starting to dig into you. You should probably go find a larger outfit when doing the next thing on the list, don't worry about not finishing before dark."

So, hastily they made their way back to Konoha with Naruto wondering what the rush was.

"O-Oh," explained Hinata, trying to use the excuse Gunther gave everyone. "I-I just need to g-go get some bigger clothing. I need s-some relief from the s-swelling of the berries."

"Well, I guess we can stop somewhere real quick then. We got all day after all."

They decided it might be easiest to shop for clothes before going to pick up a heavy shipment of weapons, so they headed back to the market place in search of a 'larger' clothing store. It was proving harder to find then what was initially expected, apparently there just weren't many people of a 'bigger scale' in Konoha that the village would need such a store. After searching around for almost an hour, Hinata was about to just go ask Choji where his family shopped for clothes until Naruto loudly pointed out.

"Hey Hinata, look!"

He was pointing to a store just across the street from them. The outside looked normal enough, save for the giant billboard with a buxom and plump woman on it with big red letters reading 'Big and Beautiful'. It appeared to be a big and tall shop went for women, or as the sign read "The shop for the big beauty in all women!" Hinata had to blush again at the thought of entering such a store.

"Come on, let's check it out!"

He grabbed Hinata by the hand and dragged her all the way to the inside. Sure enough, all the outfits within the store were for plus sized women. There were outfits of all different styles, just like normal clothing only they were much bigger and baggier looking. It was unlike anything Hinata had ever seen before. Thankfully, no one was inside that would see her save for a large brunette woman putting new clothing on the racks. She must have been an employee.

"Well? What are you waiting for?" smirked Naruto.

Eventually Hinata decided on...
15333222112111112.title: Finally, clothes.

choices: It was all an odd daydream...She actually decides on normal looking clothes.
Later Hinata has consumes some ramen, and sees Gunther about her persona change
153332221121111122.content:
"Oh, I think I'll take this one!" Hinata said at last picking one outfit she thought was perfect. It was a fishnet jacket over a low cut black blouse that fit her expansive body well. With it cam a pair of excessively short shorts and high heeled black sandals. Looking in the window and striking a sexy pose Hinata faced Naruto. "What do you think? Does it suit me Naruto?"

The blonde had a surprised expression. He had never seen Hinata act in such a way, but the Hyuga heiress was feeling different. PArt of her wondered if it was part of her changing, but she decided to go with the flow.

"Uh? Well yeah it does look kinda nice." Naruto replied. Somehow Hinata decided to draw closer and grab his hands.

"Really? You think so? I was worried you wouldn't like it." Hinata said happily, but she said it in a low whisper that seemed to make Naruto flush.

"H-hinata? What're you doing?!" Naruto asked backing away. "You're acting odd."

"I know, but it feels right she said before she kissed Naruto full on the lips. She then moved one hand behind his back and met no resistance. She had no idea what was going on, but she was enjoying it so much she didn't notice her bear tail grow thorough her clothes or her ears move atop her skull and become the same as a bear's. A minute passed before Naruto and her separated.

"Wh-what got into you Hinata?" Naruto asked, caught between shock and enjoyment. It wasn't his first kiss, but it was definitely his most enjoyed one. "You're usually so shy and reserved."

"Thats because I like you Naruto. I just didn't know how to say it." she said before pulling him into a tight embrace. Naruto was only lucky that it didn't hurt him with all of her newfound might.

"You what?! And when did you put on those fake ear accessories." he asked when he wriggled loose.

"I'll tell you over some ramen, my treat." Hinata replied paying for her new clothes. "I need to get some solid food and I know you enjoy it."

"Ramen? Well I guess it's fine by me." Naruto said, "But no more lovey stuff, not for now ok?"

"All right." Hinata replied grabbing him and running off. Whatever had caused her to change she was glad that she at least confessed her feelings
153332221121111122.title: WTF?!?!

1533322211211111221.content:
She ran off into the sunset, which for some reason had a giant smiling face on it. Hinata looked and saw rivers of golden honey flowing by her and mountains of food, much like what she and Naruto had been carrying earlier.

Drooling, she jumped face first into the pile of tasty goodness with Naruto still holding onto her. She ate mouthful after mouthful of delicious food. As she did, she felt herself swelling to ridiculous proportions but also felt herself not caring in the slightest. She just kept eating and eating.

"Hinata!" called Naruto, his voice sounded misty and far off.

~

"Hinata!" yelled Naruto, banging on the door of the changing.

Hinata sat up with a jolt (which was hard to do considering her current girth). She must have fallen asleep while trying on clothes, even though the dream looked and felt so real. To her embarrassment, she still had the revealing outfit she had been eyeing lying rumpled up on the bench with its hanger still on it.

"Definitely not..." she thought to herself, as she stepped outside patting her head to make sure there were no 'bear ears' that had grown in.

"S-Sorry, Naruto...I-I don't mean t-to be difficult b-but can I get another o-outfit?"

Thankfully, he didn't seem to mind. But it didn't help that it still made Hinata feel like a typical girl being difficult with clothing. Moving as quickly as she could, having already wasted who knows how much time taking a nap in the changing rooms, Hinata grabbed a few modest looking outfits that seemed to be in her new size. She didn't want to waste more time trying them on.

She partially threw them at the cashier, who was the big looking woman seen wandering around the store earlier. The woman gave her an odd look but quietly rung up all the clothing and put them in a bag. Secretly, Hinata was completely unaware that the woman had sneaked in the very revealing-looking outfit Hinata had been looking at in the changing room into the bag with the other clothing.

Thanking the cashier, Hinata grabbed the bag and Naruto by the wrist determined to leave the store as quickly as possible. Once they were a good distance away from the shop with Naruto confused as to what was going on, Hinata said to him.

"S-Sorry, I just felt really u-uncomfortable there."

"Huh, well okay. You shop really weird."

She blushed. The memory of her daydream came to mind, making her entire head completely red. Naruto grinned warmly, completely unaware of what the shy girl was thinking about.

"Did you...Want to change into your new clothes?" he said.

Hinata slowly began to realize that her tight clothing was beginning to tear in some places. She was in such a hurry to leave the store that she completely forgot why she had even bothered to go there in the first place. In fact, she was sure she felt a few stitches rip right above the back of her pants.

With a slow nod, Naruto led her to the nearest restroom on the streets of Konoha. Once inside, she ripped off her much too small clothing just in time. Every breath she made was straining the material of her old clothes to the point of bursting. She had to give a sigh of relief when she stood in her underwear in the bathroom stall, her body fat finally freed from its tight prison.

It was beyond strange to look down at herself and see a giant stomach where there had been a trim flat belly not a day before. But it was even more strange when she reached into the bag and pulled out the outfit she was sure she left behind in the changing room.

"H-How did this get here!?" she cried out loud.

She didn't have time to think though. An hour had been spent finding her clothing and it would probably take another three to complete the task of gathering the weapons requested by Gunther. If they were going to get back before nightfall, she couldn't afford to waste any time at all. With a sigh, she began putting on the low cut blouse and fishnet shirt.

She emerged from the bathroom, dreading the reaction Naruto was going to give her.

"Hey, not bad!" he said with a smile. Hinata wasn't sure if he was serious or just being polite though so she changed the subject with a blush.

"W-We should get going, N-Naruto..."

From the thick of a crowd of people, a person wrapped in a black cloak watched them speed off for the weapon merchants. He was covered up so that no one could see any part of his face save his mouth which had a twisted smile on it.

"So that's the target, huh?"
1533322211211111221.title: Reality.

choices: strange looking Ninja, and they seemed dangerous.
15333222112111112211.content:
Time passed and the two genin managed to arrive back at the golden feather camp. They had had a long day of doing chores for their clients, but at last it was done.

When they finally found a place to rest, Hinata had smelled something in the air. The scent was nice and smoky, it was more than likely some kind of roasted fish. Almost possessed by the fragrance she began to walk off, surprising Naruto.

"Huh? Hinata? Where're you going?" he asked. It took her a second to register that her crush had asked her a question.

"Oh? Well I smelled some fish cooking and I wanted to see where it came from." she confessed, "I'm starting to get hungry."

"Me too." Naruto said, "Checking out where the smell is coming from is a good idea."

"Th-thanks." Hinata said blushing. The heavier kunoichi and her blonde companion went to the other side of the camp where they saw Kiba and Shino taking a break. They were sitting on logs near a small campfire. The fish was cooking there, making Hinata lick her lips.

"Hey Kiba, Shino. What're you guys doing?"

"We're resting." Kiba said laying back. "We've been at work all day. We just now finished cooking."

"Ah, sounds like you were working hard too. Me and Hinata had to do a bunch of chores too."

"Did you?" Kiba asked to Hinata before getting a surprised expression. "H-hinata, you changed your clothes!"

"Y-yeah...I had to buy new ones to keep my old ones from ripping." she said blushing. "You don't mind do you?"

"N-no not at all. It looks great." Kiba said, his eyes on the fishnet skirt and low cut top He could see her developing cleavage so well, and if he focused he could see through her-

WHACK!

"OW!!!" Kiba shouted, he looked and saw that shino hit him. Apparently he noticed his teammate's actions.

"Uh, Shino why did you smack Kiba?" Hinata asked.

"There was a deadly bug on his head. Incredibly poisonous." Shino answered giving Kiba a knowing glare. The wild man got the message.

"Oh." Hinata said before her stomach grumbled. She then blushed. "I guess I'm a little hungry."

"Same here. I could use a bite." Kiba said. "I'll go find Gunther."

"Ok. hurry up about it!" Naruto shouted.

After half an hour though Kiba had not yet returned, and Gunther had arrived.

"Oh hey everyone. How are you?"

"We're good. We wanted to know if we could eat yet though." Naruto said a bit irritated. "Did Kiba get you?."

"Kiba? No he didn't." Gunther said, now growing thoughtful. "I hope he didn't wander off. He may know the area, but some of our bears laid claim to some territory. He could be in danger."

"We better look for him then." Shino said. "Knowing him he may have done just that out of carelessness. I suggest we split up."

Nodding, the Genin split up to find Kiba.

Hinata went off on her own and began to search with her byakugan despite her hunger.

"Kiba? Are you here?" she shouted looking about when she saw him, with another figure not far off.

It was a...
15333222112111112211.title: Later.

153332221121111122112.content:
Hinata froze in terror, for Kiba was currently asleep on the back of a very large bear which was staring right at Hinata. Maybe it was just its overwhelming size, but Hinata felt like she was six years old again staring down the face of the angry mother bear. She shivered as it approached her, so close that it started sniffing her face. It's head had to be the size of her entire torso, even blown up like it was now.

Kiba groaned from on top of the bear. It seemed to sense him stirring and leaned over in a slight bow so Kiba's feet could touch the ground. The dog ninja rubbed his eyes as he touched down, slowly stumbling around as if he had just woken up from being knocked out.

"Thanks..." he mumbled to the bear, it seemed to roar back in response and turned to leave back down the path from where it came.

Hinata waited until she was sure the bear had vanished into the shadows before going over to comfort Kiba. He seemed somewhat startled when she grabbed him by the shoulder, as if he hadn't even noticed she was there.

"K-Kiba, where have you been? Are you a-alright?"

"Hinata? Ugh, my head. Where am I?"

Hinata explained how he had simply vanished after he went to go get Gunther and the rest of the group was worried when Gunther mentioned not seeing him. She finished up with saying that she only found him just moments ago being carried by the bear.

"...I honestly don't remember anything," he said, still rubbing his head. "I know after I left the campfire I went down the path to Gunther's tent then..."

He winced as if there was a sudden pain. "...Just waking up in the mass of fur, which I guess was the Shinpo."

"S-Shinpo?"

"Yeah, he's the head bear that oversees all the other bears that guard the clan. Gunther introduced me and Shino to him when we had to bath the bears. He's like their commander, didn't even let us near him. Only Gunther could go up to him."

Then why did Shinpo go up to Hinata and sniff her like that? Was it because of her transformation? Did he sense what was happening to her or did he somehow know because Gunther spoke with him. Whatever the reason, Hinata shuddered again. This Shinpo bear was very intimidating indeed.

"My head is killing me," Kiba said at last.

"Come on t-then," replied Hinata. "Let's go find the others, G-Gunther will know what to do."

And with that, the two of them headed back the way Hinata came. The others were sure to be back at the campsite now to report their findings and Gunther was sure to want to hear what had happened to Kiba.

~

"I-I-It was an honest mistake my lady! Please! Have mercy!"

A young girl dressed in fancy attire and with hair done up in pigtails tapped her foot angrily at the groveling man before her feet. She had the air of nobility in her presence and a lasting sense of self entitlement as was clear in the manner of which she addressed the begging man.

"An honest mistake? An HONEST mistake!? How stupid are you, you grubbing fatso!?"

She folded her arms and looked down at the man. He was dressed in rugged clothing stretched tightly around his big belly with a rifle stripped across his back. His black beard covered most of his face and was touching the floor he was kneeling so low. The girl gave a look as if he had personally insulted her.

"Do you realize how much time you've wasted because of your stupidity? How anyone could mistake the target for that...boy...is just- Did you even pay attention to word I was saying when I asked you to do this assignment!? Are you incapable of hearing!?"

"N-No ma'am! I can hear perfectly clear! You said to grab the one that looked the most feral and-"

He hesitated as the the girl glared at him. "And-And that boy indeed looked feral. I should have known he was a part of the Inuzuka clan!"

The girl spat in disgust and stamped her feet slightly, as if having a tantrum. After a few moments she calmed herself down and lowered her right hand into the man's face. Her finger had a massive diamond ring on it bearing the initials 'FM'. The man suddenly sighed in relief and began to sloppily kiss the ring.

"T-Thank ma'am! You won't regret this mercy, I swear it."

"You'd best hope not. Bring me my pet before I feed you to the others."

~

Once Kiba and Hinata returned to the camp, everyone was very relieved and the search was called off. Gunther himself inspected Kiba's head.

"Well, you indeed have a lump on your head Kiba. But considering you don't know how it happened and are fine right now I'd say it's nothing to worry over."

Naruto laughed. "You probably tripped over your own clumsy feet and knocked yourself out."

It took a few minutes for the fight between Naruto and Kiba to die down, but thankfully they were both so hungry that once the food was brought out they stopped their fighting instantly. Everyone was enjoying themselves with helpings of cooked pork and grilled corn. But no matter how hungry everyone was, it was Hinata who ate the most out of everyone. In fact she probably ate more then Naruto, Shino, and Kiba combined. When she was finished at last (her new clothes already feeling tight her stomach slightly more bloated again) she let out a satisfying burp.

She blushed as the entire camp stopped to look at her. "E-Excuse m-me."

When the feast was finally over and the long day finally finished, the Konoha ninjas said their goodbyes and returned home. Hinata decided to stay behind, of course, and help clean up the campfire with Gunther.

"The changes appear to be coming along rather well." said Gunther.

Aside from being heavier since this morning, Hinata had grown several inches again putting her almost at five and a half feet tall. Thankfully, she had had the sense to pick up larger sized clothing when in the clothing store earlier so that way she'd have something to fit her. Her sharp nails also seemed to be darkening, but nothing so extreme that it was noticeable. Internally, Hinata felt very much at peace and comfortable. The fat was like an extra soft padding that provided an instant pillow when sitting down. It wasn't difficult to move at all, though that might have had something to do with her muscles growing underneath all the blubber.

"I t-think so too." she replied with a slight blush, poking her exposed stomach. "What will happen tomorrow?"

"Tomorrow? Hmm. Well, that's usually when the second part of the transformation begins. Bear's aren't bald you know. So aside more weight and height, expect something a little more hairier."

Hinata paused, trying to imagine herself covered in fur. But all she could picture was herself in a giant fur coat looking ridiculous.

"You can shave it off, don't worry. It won't affect the changes or anything. But it grows back like a weed."

Hinata bowed in thanks once again and turned for her home. What morning was going to bring to her the next day was still vividly burned into her mind, but if it was anything like it was today it wouldn't be so bad.
153332221121111122112.title: A bear and a bump.

1533322211211111221121.content:
It was hard to describe how Hinata felt the following morning. Heavy would have been a good word. When she opened her eyes she felt herself weighing down her mattress, sinking into the center like a bowling ball. Even her pajamas, which were very stretchy and had fit her comfortably enough last night, were now very much tight around her giant belly. Daring a look, Hinata turned her gaze down at her mountain of a stomach.

She wasn't exactly prepared for what she saw and let out a small gasp. Two enormous globs of flesh took up her immediate vision but beyond that if it was somehow possible her belly was even bigger than before. It took up so much of her vision that she couldn't even see her feet anymore. What was most noticeable, however, was the bits of dark brown hair growing out at the top of her stomach like moss on a rock. Hinata reached up and patted the mat of fur. It wasn't rough like normal body hair, but soft and fuzzy. Like fur.

Initially Hinata thought sitting up on her bed was going to be a challenge due to so much extra weight, but it was not the case. She was able to hoist herself up without having to grab on anything at all. The bed started to creak violently though, straining to hold up her great weight, she must have been nearing three hundred pounds at this point.

As Hinata stood up for the first time she was not prepared for just how much taller she had grown overnight. Having once been a measly four foot eight just two days ago, Hinata now stood at an impressive height of six feet two inches. She could now see over everything in her room. It was so bizarre and yet so exciting at the same time. She felt powerful. Strong.

"Wow..." she managed to say, looking at herself in the mirror.

She now looked like an adult very tall over weight woman attempting to fit into a pair of kid's clothes. It was a good thing she had picked out some outfits that were much bigger than yesterday's, else she'd have to go into camp naked.

Digging around in her bag, she picked the biggest outfit she could find. A plain blue shirt and some stretchy black pants. By some bit of luck everything fit her just perfectly. Not even her hairy belly was exposed. Hinata thought for a minute, unconsciously rubbing her stomach.

"My belly..." she thought out loud. "G-Gunther did say I could shave and it wouldn't do anything to effect the growth..."

With her mind made up, she waddled into the bathroom (with no one in the house seeing her of course) and found her mother's razor. She had never shaven before, but how hard could it be?

~

"Hinata, are you alright?" asked Gunther, when she arrived at the camp. "You appear to be bleeding."

She blushed. "I-I cut myself shaving the fur on my b-belly..."

He laughed. "Ah, of course. Here, we have some medicine for minor cuts like that."

Gunther retreated into his tent and briefly returned with a small vial that contained a wax-like material. When Hinata rubbed it over the cuts on her stomach, the bleeding ceased instantly and provided a sort of minty relief. She thanked him but he just shrugged.

"It's no trouble. That antidote is a mixture of beeswax and mint, it works very well with closing up small scraps. Huh."

He paused and looked curiously at her. Hinata didn't realize until that moment that she was almost standing at eye level with Gunther and he was a man who had towered over her just a few days ago.

"Indeed, I'd say tomorrow we'll have to separate you from Naruto before he catches on. He might not notice your changes, though I don't think you'll want your teammates seeing you like this. Just as well, I had something special planned for tomorrow for you anyway."

Hinata didn't know if she should smile or frown. Gunther folded his arms in a commanding sort of way. "In the meantime, you should finish up your tasks on the list from yesterday with Naruto. He's waiting for you just outside the camp entrance."

Bowing, Hinata dreadfully obeyed his wishes and headed for the start of the camp. Naruto was sure to notice something was off with her now, he wasn't that thick.

"Hey Hinata! Wow! Okay, now I know you did something with your hair!"

Hinata gave off a short laugh. "Y-Yes, I did."

"I knew it! And Kiba says I never notice anything..."

She was suddenly very glad that Naruto was her partner in this mission, for more reasons than just liking him. They talked briefly about the mission and what they were going to be doing today before consulting the list which Hinata had held on to from yesterday. The first task was...
1533322211211111221121.title: A hairy morning.

choices: They began to get to know Taizen as they did their tasks.
15333222112111112211211.content:
Their first job was to acquire some herbs for Gunther and his kinsmen. Both Shinobi went to a good spot to pick herbs. Hinata knew of it because of how gentle and serene the place was. She used it for when she wanted to train and had sometimes gathered the herbs. The trip wasn't particularly long so little was said.

When they arrived they saw the area was as picturesque as before. Light verdant grass shone brightly, a fine blanket of dew making them glisten in the morning sun. There was also the melody of songbirds, like something from a fairytale. Hinata suddenly felt at peace here, and even Naruto who was usually hyped up seemed somewhat more restful.

"Wow. This place is pretty nice." Naruto commented, in awe. He turned to face his plumpened friend, "You said you come here sometimes right?"

"Yes, I do, but not as often as I like." the giant girl said. Even as large as she was now it still looked magnificent. "It's like my own private place. It should have most of the herbs that we need."

"Alright. Then let's start looking." Naruto said, his usual energy back in place along with a rather large grin.

The two searched the ground all over for any sign of medicinal plant life, the whole thing was much more uncomfortable on Hinata who was still getting used to her new height and weight. Despite her changed body she managed to find some herbs, but much less than she expected. All Naruto was able to find was one single calendula and a few weeds. Together though the only had six herbs, the ursine lass knew something was up though because she noticed that there were spots where the ground was disturbed.

“I thought there would be more herbs than this…” Naruto sighed, rubbing the back of his head in confusion.

“I think someone else has been though here.” Hinata said sniffing the air. Her sense of smell was highly sharpened though, as if it was seven times as sharp as a bloodhound’s. She noticed the fragrance of the herbs. There was the scent of aloe, speedwell, and honeysuckle. As well as a foreign scent. It was another human. Moving instinctually she followed her nose wordlessly. Her orange attired friend seemed bewildered.

“Hinata? Where’re you going?”

“Oh. I noticed someone ahead with the herbs. “she explained.

“You did?” Naruto asked looing ahead and squinting. “I don’t see anything, did you use your Byakugan?”

“No I actually smelled them.” Hinata admitted.

“Hm…Oh! Did you pick that skill up from Kiba?”

“Er…Y-yes.” She lied. To be honest she didn’t know bears could smell so well. Even so she trusted her new skill. “Well anyway c-can we go?”

“Sure thing.” Naruto said. The two went onward silently for several minutes. Soon they cam across a clearing that had a boy around their age gathering herbs.

His skin was dark and his ebon hair was spiky, reaching to his shoulders. His eyes while gentle were practically glowing yellow. He didn’t seem to be from Konoha, and he had no ninja headband on. Silently he picked a few more herbs and put them into his basket, which was practically full. He seemed not to notice them until Naruto sneezed.

“Is anyone here?” he asked in a firm, yet curious voice. A moment later the two ninja revealed themselves. He inspected them closely, but his gaze was soft. “Are you two…ninja?”

“We sure are.” Naruto said boisterously. “I’m Naruto Uzumaki, and this is Hinata Hyuga.”

“We’re sorry to bother you, but we were wondering who had picked all of the herbs and noticed you had some.” Hinata explained. “I was worried that you might be an enemy ninja.”

“Oh, is that why?” the boy asked. “I didn’t realize I took so much. My name is Taizen, and I’m just a wanderer passing through. I’ll gladly give you some herbs.”

With that the stranger handed them his bag.

“Take as many as you need.” He told them, a faint smirk on his otherwise stoic face.

“Thank you. But if you don’t mind us asking why did you need them?” Hinata asked the stranger. So far he seemed kind enough.

“Well to be honest I’m running low on funds and I planned on selling them in the village…Though I’m a bit lost now.” He admitted looking embarrassed.

“Well if you want we can take you there.” Naruto offered. “It’s really not that far.”

“You two wouldn’t mind?”

“Not at all.” Hinata replied. “We have chores to do though in the village anyway.”

“Well to repay yout kindness I’ll help.” Taizen said. “I hope I can be of use.”

"I'm sure you'll help us plenty." Hinata said, a bit surprised by his formal words.

Soon they reached Konoha and...
15333222112111112211211.title: A friendly encounter.

choices: Finding an ex-member of the clan.
153332221121111122112111.content:
Having evenly split up the herbs, the group of now three turned and headed back down the path from where they came. With the first task done on their list already, finishing what remained before dark seemed completely possible, so both Naruto and Hinata were in a fine mood. It was Naruto, however, that chatted away most of the time with their new friend who seemed more content with silence than anything but kindly replied to each question the blond asked. No matter how foolish the question was.

"So, wear's your shirt?" asked Naruto, noting Taizen's lack of wardrobe.

"Finding materials to make a shirt is a waste, especially when your body is used to being in the sun all day anyway."

"You make your own clothes? I didn't know you could...How do you do that?" said Naruto, apparently he had thought clothing just grew on trees.

"Oh, its very easy. The forest gives you everything you need if you look hard enough, well mostly everything you need. With some yarn and a frame I think you could probably manage it too in an afternoon."

"Really?"

Though internally Hinata blushed in doubt of Naruto's capabilities behind the delicate art of knitting clothes, no matter how determined he was, she didn't mention that out loud though. What did interest her about Taizen was where he came from, but he was so laid back he didn't even seem to notice her. She tried to get an answer out of him.

"Uh, e-excuse me Taizen. You said you g-get things from the forest, does that mean you l-live near it or...?"

She was taken by surprise when he gave her his full attention, though his eyes seemed to wander beyond her as if he were looking through her or something. "You could say that, Hinata was it? I actually live within the forest itself, among all its bounty. Very rarely do I even get to see other people from outside it."

Naruto butted in. "Wow, I'll bet you and your family really like living off the land, huh?"

Taizen turned away from both of them, a sad smile on his face. "I have no memory of a family, unfortunately. I've been on my own in the woods since I can remember."

He grew real quiet after that, both ninjas knew they had touched on a difficult subject for their new friend despite the smile on his face. Hinata pretended to look over the instructions from Gunther while Naruto shot Taizen a sympathetic look.

There was no real approach in concerns of talking to be made in the group again until they reached the gates of Konoha. Hinata and Naruto walked forward as if nothing was unusual, but Taizen stopped in place and took in a huge gulp of air as if he were doing a very long gasp.

"Are you okay?" asked Hinata in concern. "It s-sounded like you've been in the city before, right?"

"Don't worry, I'll be fine." said Taizen who had a look on his face similar to that of someone who swallowed a watermelon whole. "I can never get over the initial feel of entering the city. So many people in one place...It overloads my senses."

Both ninjas shot him a confused look, Taizen seemed to catch on.

"Oh sorry, I forgot to mention. I'm blind."

Naruto reacted in a overly concerned manner. "Blind!? Are you alright!? Can we get you medicine!?"

Taizen spoke over Naruto's continued ramblings of 'Maybe Granny can fix him!' "No, you misunderstand me. I've been blind since birth. The retinas that should be in my eyes never existed. You can't heal what was never there in the first place."

"Then h-how are you able to get around?" Hinata asked in a confused tone. "I mean, y-you seem to be able to see us and e-everything..."

"Ah, just because one of my senses is gone doesn't mean I am senseless."

He pointed to his ear. "I can hear both of you."

Then he pointed to his nose. "I can smell both of you- No, not in that way Naruto. And..."

His hand did a sort of waving motion. "I can feel both of you as well."

"Feel us?" questioned Naruto.

"It's difficult to explain to someone else. You know how there's Charka in each of us, right? There's also your soul within each person too. That warmth, that life force leaves a..." he struggled to find the right word. "I guess you can call it a weight, or a pull, in the area around you."

A leaf blew past Taizen's hand. He seemed to notice it and waved his hand around it. In what initially Hinata thought was a trick of the eye, the leaf seemed to be following the boy's hand movements, bobbing up and down as if it were on top of a wave.

"Everything thing around us gives this pull, this force." he continued, using the leaf as a visual aid. "Once you feel it or sense it, you can eventually control it and manipulate it with practice."

He made a violent flicking gesture with his hand and the leaf snapped in half before fluttering to the ground in two pieces. He turned his attention back up to the pair who were ogling him in amazement.

"That about sums it up. That's how I can tell where you two are in the given space around me. I can also determine shapes, sizes, and even thoughts if the feeling is strong enough without ever needing my eyes. For example..."

He pointed at Hinata. "Your presence in the space for a human is unusually large."

Hinata blushed as Naruto paused to look at her. "Now that you mention it...She does seem bigger..."

Panicking, she tried to change the subject. "T-T-Then why is w-walking into t-the city a burden on your senses?"

"Well, it's like if someone placed an explosion next to your ears. So many life forces in one given place make it painful to stand. I'll get used to it eventually, but chances are I might bump into a few things by mistake."

"Hey, no problem!" grinned Naruto. "We'll lead you around!"

Taizen returned the smile. "Thank you. With any luck, I'd just end up getting lost on my own. I'm glad the two of you found me."

Intrigued but their curiosity satisfied, they marched into the village. Naruto had took it upon himself to wrap one arm around Taizen's and lead him on through the crowds of people while Hinata was focused mainly with not knocking anyone over with her massive gut. They were determined to focus on their initial task, which was...
153332221121111122112111.title: Getting to know each other.

choices: Is pretty weak. They easily handle him and go on with their day.
Is a serious threat. They're in for a tough fight.
1533322211211111221121112.content:
The main mission that the duo was originally intended to do was to locate a member of the Golden Feather clan that had abandoned a couple days ago.

The person was a young man with ruddy red hair and dark brown eyes named Sylas. According to a picture that Gunther showed them he was somewhere in his early twenties. Gunther had mentioned that he was one of the more radical clansmen, but probably wouldn't be much of a problem. Word had it he was still somewhere in Konoha, but no one had managed to find him. It was now up to Naruto and Hinata to find him.

Sadly they had forgotten this momentarily after meeting Taizen, but Hinata managed to remember as they re-entered the village. As they entered the market area she kept Byakugan-activated eye out for him. It wasn't long before Taizen had set up shop and began trying to drum up attention.

After laying some of them out front he wordlessly aced the large crowd of villagers until he called out to a woman walking with a slight limp.

"Excuse me miss, but are you in any pain?" he asked her in specific. The woman noticed his blindness and seemed surprised.

"Well yes actually. I hurt my leg a week ago and it hasn't gotten any better." she said.

"I'm sure some fresh medicinal herbs will help. Please try some." he said handing her a small fresh herb. "Rub it on your leg and I'm sure it'll be well."

Curiously she listened to what he said and did as instructed, she gasped as she felt her pain disappear.

"Wow it worked!" she said, "it's like a miracle!"

Naruto and Hinata seemed amazed as well.

"How did you know that medicine would work so well?" the puffed up lavender eyed girl asked.

"I could hear that there was an irregular walking pattern in the crowd and focused on it." he explained as the woman paid him before he pointed to a man with his arm in a sling. "I can tell he also has an injured arm, that there is a small child with severe allergy issues, and that you and Naruto aren't normal by ninja standards. As if there is more to both of you."

The two shinobi looked at Taizen almost bewildered. Hinata wondered if he knew about her changes, but she was unsure exactly what he meant about Naruto. Either way she wondered something.

"Say Taizen...Can you sense someone with negative emotions around? Like resentment for example?"

"Yes. If I focus." he said closing his already sightless eyes, momentarily ignoring the incoming customers that his "miracle" had attracted. After a minute he reopened his eyes. "There is a particularly bothered man headed towards a large building near what I believe to be the village's center. He seems to be angry judging by his breathing and stride...He also has the same kind of scent that's on you and Naruto that the others don't have."

"Alright. That must be Sylas." Hinata deduced. She then looked at Naruto. "We've got to go to the Hokage's office before he gets there."

"Right. Taizen, we'll see you later. We've got to find this guy."

"Good luck. I think I'll join you in a few moments." the blindboy said as he began handing out medicine and taking the customer's Ryo.

With that the two ninja set off and encountered their target who...
1533322211211111221121112.title: Natural talents.

choices: They heal the deserter and head back to camp.
15333222112111112211211122.content:
At first Hinata didn't even realize that the man quickly making his way to the Hokage's office was even a part of the gold-feather clan. He was dressed in relatively normal looking clothes of a typical villager, a stark contrast to the beads and feathers members of the clan usually wore. Naruto and Hinata weren't even sure he was the real target until he slipped out a wrapped oval shaped object and chucked it at the entrance of the building.

It was a bomb. The moment it hit the door, the two guards were thrown back by a gigantic fireball that seemed to whip through the air like a snake. Naruto cursed loudly and performed a few hand gestures.

"Shadow Clones!"

That instantly caught the attention of the gold-feather terrorist, who spun around and tossed a handful of red wrapped bombs in Naruto's general direction. Three loud explosions peppered the air as Hinata felt herself being thrown from mid air into the ground.

"Naruto!" she cried out, unable to catch a glimpse of the blond in the thick fog of red smoke.

The terrorist then turned to her and eyed her suspiciously. Perhaps he briefly recognized the process of transformation that were a part of their clan. But he spared Hinata no less than he did Naruto and tossed a big blue bomb right at her.

Hinata didn't have time to dodge, not exactly being as nimble as she used to be. She closed her eyes and felt something heavy slam into her protruding stomach, giving off a echoing 'BOING' sound. The bomb had collided with her belly and ricocheted harmlessly away from her before exploding.

When Hinata finally opened her eyes, believing herself to be dead, she stared dumbfounded at the ex-gold feather clan member who looked very annoyed and was reached into his back hip-pack for more explosives. That was when out of the red cloud in the sky came Naruto and one of his shadow clones, both looking completely unharmed, barreling towards the man with an odd blue light in the palm of his hand.

"Eat this, Rasengan!"

But the man had already pulled out an odd twisted shaped bomb, which he didn't throw but held outstretched at Naruto's oncoming attack. Hinata's brain finally came back from its five minute coffee break and she too ran for the terrorist, hoping to reach him in time before he could react to her as well. She found that she could not move quite as fast as she normally could with the extra weight. How she was going to perform Gentle Fist, she had no idea.

There was simply no way to reach them in time. Naruto and the gold-feather clan member's hand's smacked into each other. A blinding light flared up between the two, followed by a spiraling twister that consumed Naruto. The sound it gave off was similar to metal twisting and scrunching around itself. Naruto found himself spinning in mid air backwards and smashed hard against the wall of a building before slumping down, unconscious.

The clan member's hand was now smoking and charred, he flinched in pain as he brought it down to his side. It was probably going to be completely useless for the remainder of the fight. This didn't give Hinata a load of confidence though as she charged at him.

Her Byakugan was already activated and she gave a heavy jab forward straight for the man's shoulder. It connected far harder than Hinata had intended, she felt a hot liquid ooze over the tips of her fingers. Her fingernails had punctured the man's left shoulder, red blood was spraying all over the place.

The terrorist grunted in pain but pulled Hinata towards him. Hinata lost her balance and toppled forward, afraid that she was going to fall and crush the man. Instead, she felt a paralyzing push crushing right into her stomach. A deafening screech was all she could hear and she felt herself flipping backwards in a manner similar to Naruto just a few moments ago before landing hard on the ground.

She gasped a few times, despite the ferocity of the bomb she had only had the wind knocked out of her. At least all that new fat was gone for something, it had probably absorbed most of the attack. Across from her, the terrorist was looking disappointed.

"It figures...I had heard a rumor that Gunther had let slip one of their traditions yet again. I never dreamed they'd be the one to come and stop me..."

Hinata was coughing for air now on her knees. "W-What, d-do you mean...G-Gunther let s-slip-"

"It doesn't matter," he said firmly. "I have no quarrel with the ninja of the Leaf. Understand that what must be done must be done. For the better of all."

A loud 'Hah' caused the man to pause and look up at the Hokage office, Hinata did the same. Lady Tsunade and Lady Shizune were both looking down at the attacker from above, an angry look covered their faces.

"And just what do you think you're doing injuring MY villagers with no reason?" scowled Tsunade.

"Lady Hokage..." muttered the man. "I hadn't counted on meeting you so soon, it's an honor. I'm going to have to attack you though, you'll try your hardest to defend yourself. Won't you?"

Without any other warning, the man tossed the largest bomb yet in the direction of the Hokage. She just stood there though, as if only mildly impressed and prepared to deflect it in an instant. She never got the chance though.

The bomb suddenly stopped in mid air. The fuse on the top had seemingly disappeared and the ball tumbled to the ground, bouncing harmlessly away.

"I knew you two were fighting..." said a familiar voice. "I could feel the explosions."

The voice was coming from where Naruto had landed. The blonde was currently being supported by a boy with dark hair and skin, several shuriken were tucked away behind his fingers.

"Taizen!" called Hinata.

"I owe you two an apology." he muttered. "Couldn't smell the gunpowder on him, though its pretty obvious now."

"Were you the one that stopped my explosions?" asked the man, growing more and more weary looking.

The smile on Taizen's faced disappeared and he stared down angrily at the man. Hinata felt herself shivering, even though he was blind it felt like his eyes were staring through her very soul. It seemed to be effecting the man as well, he took a step back in fear.

"You are the one that hurt my friends. Your fear is immense, I feel it...In your heartbeat."

At that moment, the terrorist threw another bomb at Taizen. Taizen raised his free hand, releasing the shuriken he held into the air. It was at that moment, the sound of what seemed to be a thousand angry hornet rumbled in the air. It happened so fast.

A wave of large gray bees passed in front of Taizen and consumed the bomb in a giant fog. When the cloud disappeared, there was nothing left of the bomb. Hinata looked more clearly at the hornets as a realization hit her. They weren't hornets at all, it was a cloud of floating shuriken.

Taizen gestured for the cloud to come closer to him. It was like watching Gaara's sand techinque only with hundreds of sharp blades instead. The weapons spun around him in a circle like a predator waiting to pounce on its prey. Taizen again glared at the panic-stricken man below.

"You will not be able to defend yourself against this. No explosion can stop a cloud of a thousand spinning blades. Any last words?"

The terrorist just bit his lip. A great look of frustration spread across his face. He never gave his final words, he just reached into his pouch and froze. The cloud of shuriken suddenly materialized behind him.

At first Hinata thought it was just a scratch that happened to graze the man. But then dozens of different wounds appeared one after the other until the blood soaked his clothing and he collapsed in a heap on the ground.

Taizen spat. "I shouldn't have kept him alive after all that."
15333222112111112211211122.title: A battle of bombs.

choices: Hinata decided to question him after the traitor is gone
Hinata's hunger is too much. She and the boys eat after doing their duties.
153332221121111122112111221.content:
Time passed and soon the two Genin, their new companion and the Hokage were all gathered together in the office with the restrained terrorist.

While he was unconscious Tsunade had done her best to heal him to ensure he wouldn't suffer from injuries, her hazel eyes studied the spots where he was wounded. It made Hinata a little nervous.

"What's the matter Lady Tsunade?" she asked a little fearfully. The village leader sighed before speaking.

"Nothing now, but to be honest I'm amazed by the precision of those attacks. The lacerations he suffered were just shy of life threatening...If I didn't know any better I'd say this was the work of an advanced Chunin, maybe a Jonin." she explained before looking at Taizen. "And you say you're not from any village?"

"No ma'am. I cannot recall much of my past, but I know for certain I'm not a ninja." the foreigner explained before gesturing his useless eyes. "Besides I doubt a blind ninja is worth much."

"...I suppose, but whatever skills you possess, they are impressive. I want to personally thank you for helping to save the village, and trying to protect me."

"It was no problem. I appreciate your thanks." he said. "But Naruto and Hinata were the ones who told me to be alert, I'm just glad I came to help in time."

"In any case Hinata, Naruto, I don't want you to breathe a word of this to anyone else. I know this ninja is a renegade, but if word gets out the people may begin to distrust the Gold-feather tribe." Tsunade said before handing Naruto the man's unconscious frame, "Take him to Gunther and have him decide what to do. In the meantime I'll come up with an explanation for the events outside."

"Alright, trust in us Grandma Tsunade!" Naruto told her confidently as he lugged the heavy man. Taizen followed the blonde as if he could see him as clear as day and then Hinata followed.
