She was still wondering what he had meant by Gunther letting traditions slip? And why again? Were there others he had helped like Hinata? Either way she knew she shouldn't trust the word of a traitor, but a seed of doubt had been planted. As if sensing it the struggling Naruto turned to face her.

"Hey Hinata, is something the matter?" the aqua eyed boy asked, immediately the plus sized kunoichi replied.

"Um, nothing really...I just feel a little confused is all."

"Confused about what?"

"Just...I thought that a friend of mine may have lied to me, and I don't know why." she said, "It's really bothering me too and I don't quite understand."

"A friend?" Naruto said as he continued to lug the body, "Well friends really shouldn't lie in the first place, but sometimes they lie for good reasons. I'm not saying it's right, but people with really good intentions sometimes lie so good things can happen, y'know?"

"I suppose." Hinata said as her stomach growled, she wished she had some food, her stomach was bothering her focus. A second later Taizen spoke.

"There is food cooking a little further ahead at what I assume to be the Gold-feather tribe's camp. It should be five more minutes until it's at it's peak judging by the scent."

Within moments the trio arrived at the camp and saw Gunther. Once he arrived...
153332221121111122112111221.title: They heal the deserter and head back to camp.

choices: If he knew about the clan's bear transformation.
1533322211211111221121112212.content:
As soon as Hinata saw Gunther, she suddenly doubled over and started moaning. Her stomach had given off a stabbing pain as if it were trying to eat its way through her skin. She was completely famished. With all the excitement from the start of the day she had not only skipped breakfast but missed out on lunch as well. Though she was eager to question Gunther with what the traitor had meant, she was dying to get something to eat.

Gunther seemed to sense her discomfort as the group approached and said. "Hey guys, there's food cooking over the fire-"

He didn't get to finish his statement as Hinata tore off for the campfire, leaving Naruto and Taizen to deliver the unconscious ex-gold feather clan member. She didn't care, she'd apologize to them later. Right now her stomach had forced her brain to take a backseat.

Plopping down next to the roaring fire, she discovered a bounty of cooked fish on sticks as well as smoked corn and tasty looking fruits and berries in small baskets. She was in complete bliss as she violently shoved unhealthy amounts of food into her mouth, her hunger seemed to know no end. A few of the wandering clan members turned away with a mixture of both shock and disgust.

After finishing off about thirty sticks of fish, ten baskets of fruit, and twenty corn cobs, Naruto and Taizen finally made their way over to the fire. Thankfully, Hinata's sudden glutenous need to eat had been somewhat subdued and she was now eating slowly enough to be considered 'eating normally', so she wouldn't embarrass herself in front of Naruto.

"You know, I'd thought there'd be more food here." said Naruto, as he grabbed a pike of fish while Hinata buried her head in a blush. "I guess we're a little late to the feast."

"There's more than enough here," Taizen calmly replied as he sat next to Naruto with his own bit of fish. "Maybe you should give the notice to Hinata before you forget, Naruto."

"The what- Ah, right!"

Naruto reached into his pocket with a hand that was covered in grease from the fish. He handed Hinata a paper smeared with sauce with her name on it in simple writing. Opening it between mouthfuls of fish she discovered that it was a message from Gunther.

Hinata,
I trust that the 'process' is going quite well, judging by your sudden disappearance to race for food. That's quite understandable though, eat up. Tomorrow will be a bit rougher for you. I suspect you will be unable to continue your chores with your comrades so I will pull you away for a special assignment. Report to my tent an hour earlier than usual tomorrow. I'll explain everything then as I will be away for the remainder of the day. For now, good luck.
Gunther

Hinata read it over several times, the thought of what that clan member had said was resurfacing in her mind. But if what he said was true, she wouldn't be able to ask him until tomorrow. She turned to the boys who were busy devouring their own meals and asked.

"What b-became of that ninja?"

"Buno," said Naruto between big bites of food. "Bunter bust bok bem bnabay."

"I think what Naruto is trying to say is Gunther didn't tell us what would happen to the ninja. He just took him away after we handed him over."

"Oh."

Taizen wiped his mouth and gazed sadly at Hinata. "If I had to guess, I'd say Gunther took him to be immediately executed."

"What!?" both Naruto and Hinata yelled at once. Taizen just nodded.

"This clan has been known to deal with traitors rather...harshly. I wouldn't be surprised if he's already dead."

"Wow..." muttered Naruto, bits of sauce dripping down his chin. "They really don't fool around, do they?"

"Look at it from this point of view. They're a neutral clan, as a result they can trade and converse with the many different villages. If one of their members attacks a village, that neutral stance will do them little good. It's hard to say you're a peaceful clan when you have people attacking other people. They need to maintain a strict order over the do's and don'ts of their clan members."

Naruto nodded deeply, pretending he understood all of it when really have no idea what anything Taizen said meant. Hinata, however, was still slightly confused.

"How do y-you know so much about the c-clan, Taizen?"

"Huh? Ah, well. As a child of the forest, I need to also wander from village to village a lot. We've crossed path many times over the years. Even Gunther recognized me after you left for lunch."

Naruto smirked as if to say to Hinata 'It's true, they know each other'. Hinata smiled back in return, but was still slightly confused as to why Taizen hadn't bothered to mention his relationship with the clan before. She supposed he had his reasons though.

After the food, Naruto got up suddenly and ran off yelling something about "Feeling a turtle head poking out." Hinata took advantage of her brief time alone with Taizen and asked him.
1533322211211111221121112212.title: Avoidance.

choices: I need to go see Gunther about something
I was just thinking the same thing
15333222112111112211211122121.content:
"Say Taizen, can you tell me what you know about Gunther?"

"Gunther? I thought you knew about him yourself?" The blind warrior said, "As you have been working for him for quite some time."

"Well yes but you've known him longer, maybe you know more overall." Hinata lied quickly. Taizen seemed able to tell that something was amiss, but he held his tongue.

"Perhaps I would. I met Gunther several years ago during my wanderings, during that time I was rather weak, but the Golden feather clan took me in until I was well. During our first encounter I interacted with them very little although they were more than hospitable. When I was well enough I left and went about my business. It was several months later in another land when I met them again, this time though I was attacked by someone, but when I subdued her a group of hunter nin arrived and I found out she was a member of their tribe. Naturally I followed them back where they rewarded me. When I inquired why that person had done those things I was informed that she was trying to steal clan secrets and thought I was an enemy. They then told me that she had been killed, and that I was to see Gunther."

"Is that true?" Hinata asked, hardly able to think that her new allies would kill anyone, even a traitor. For a Leaf villager such thoughts were unbelievable, even for traitors.

"It is, but he wanted to thank me for what I did and said that he was amazed that someone my age could defeat one of the clan's stronger warriors. For a time he took me under his wing and I sensed that he had a warm spirit, but there was something even I didn't understand deeper inside of him. For a time I ignored it until I heard him mention my name one night to his elders and something about a ritual. I couldn't hear what they said exactly, which was odd, but I didn't like what I had overheard. Ultimately though I think that for whateer reason the elders rejected me due to my blindness, but what difference does a blind sacrifice truly make?" Taizen asked, more to himself than Hinata. Now he seemed concerned, his blank eyes staring uselessly as if trying to grasp some deeper meaning. "As far as I know he is a good man with good intentions, but he is not always entirely honest. I would recommend that you be wary around him."

Moments after Taizen told Hinata his story she felt some uneasiness well up in her stomach. She was unsure if it was her transformation or Taizen's story, but she showed no signs of unease, or at least tried not to. Taizen still caught her feelings.

"This is mostly my theory you know, I can sense intentions, but I could've been wrong." he added quickly in an attempt to make her more calm, it hardly worked, but the dark haired girl appreciated the sentiment. Moments later Naruto returned.

"So what did I miss?" Naruto asked them as he arrived back on scene. Taizen was the first to respond.

"Nothing. Hinata and I had brief conversation about Gunther is all." he said before gesturing towards the setting sun. "It's getting late, I think I'll head over to my own camp for now."

"Wait, you're going off into the woods all by yourself?" Naruto asked, even though he knew Taizen was strong he still didn't want to leave the blind boy alone."Hey why don't we go with you?" Naruto offered.

"You and Hinata?

"Yeah, just to make sure you get there safe and all." Naruto went on before turning to his ever growing companion, "Right Hinata?"

"Actually Naruto..."
15333222112111112211211122121.title: What he knew about Gunther.

153332221121111122112111221211.content:
"I need to go see Gunther about something." she said, her mind still elsewhere.

Naruto gave a slight frown as did Taizen who seemed to know exactly what she had in mind. But the blonde shrugged and grabbed the dark boy by the hand.

"Alright, suit yourself then. It's probably important anyway. Come on Taizen."

"Hinata, Gunther is a good man." added Taizen as he was being pulled away. "Keep an open mind."

Hinata waited and watched as the two boys disappeared out of sight into the thick of the forest. "A good man...," she repeated to herself, trying to measure the value of that sentiment. Would a good man lie? Would Gunther have lied after he said those nice things to her. Those uplifting and encouraging things.

She gripped her fists hard and felt the sharpness of her nails dig into her skin. There was only one way to determine the truth.

~

The sky glared fire red by the time Hinata made her way to Gunther's tent. She could have gone straight to him after leaving Naruto and Taizen but felt the need to wander around a bit and think to herself. Thankfully Shino and Kiba had left already too, as had most of the clansmen who were gathered around the main campfire for dinner. This made the camp feel very empty and lonely as she slowly waddled to the large tent on the hill.

Gunther was there skinning a caught deer over his own small campfire. He sensed her approach, which probably wasn't difficult with the weight of each of her steps as she approached him.

"Ah, Hinata!" he said. "Just in time, I had something for you to accomplish before you left this evening-"

"A-Actually...There was something I wanted to a-ask you."

He gave her a look as if he had not expected her to interrupt him like that. Like no one had ever interrupted him before. But he maintained a calm expression and plainly spoke.

"It will have to wait, I'm afraid. Whatever it is on your mind. This is vital to the process of the transformation."

Hinata gave a worried frown but nodded. Gunther seemed to sense her concern and quickly added. "I promise, whatever it is on your mind I will address vividly tomorrow morning. I wouldn't ignore your thoughts unless something was of the utmost importance."

Hinata faked a smile and nodded. Gunther then cleared his throat and crossed his arms. "Anyway, there is another reason we come to this forest every so often. Deep within it is a rare tree that gives off an unusual sap. It has fairly normal properties and appears unassuming until one tastes it."

"W-What happens then?"

"When consumed the sap gives more bear-like tendencies to the eater. In other words your mind, scent, and even personality changes ever-so slightly to a more bear-like nature."

"I-I don't understand...Why is t-that necessary?"

He paused for a moment, as if he were searching for the words to explain it clearly. "Well, for most members of our clan it isn't when they go through this rite. We live daily around our guardian bears and thus adapt to their nature over the course of our lives. You on the other hand..."

"Have not..." she finished for him.

"Right. You forget, in five days you will be living with a sloth of bears in the wild. Your success with hinge of if they accept you as a member of their group or not."

"So...I need it to g-give me the best chance of being accepted?"

"Exactly. The sap is called bearblood. We reserve a small supply of it for members who are not confident about their rites so that they don't end up being mauled or beaten alive."

Hinata winced slightly but nodded. Gunther continued. "Seeing as you need some of the sap yourself, I thought it would be a good task for you to acquire some for yourself and for the clan's stock."

"Why w-wait until the evening to assign this t-though?" asked Hinata. Wandering around in the woods at dark with bears in the forest was not her idea of safety.

"The sap only drips from the tree at dusk. I had been meaning to tell you about the task this morning but I forgot to mention it, so you have my apologizes."

He handed her a small vial. "After you collect the sap, just take one drop and eat it. Only one drop. Anymore and you risk losing your mind completely to the beast."

"One drop...R-Right." muttered Hinata. It could not be any more apparent that she was nervous. "Where's the t-tree in the forest though?"

Gunther gave her a reassuring smile. "It's just south of here deep in the woods. It's large, dark, and shaped like a bear. You can't miss it."

Hinata stared at the tiny vial in her hand for a moment, pondering if this was really the right thing she should be doing. Gunther finally spoke, waking her up from her thoughts. "Don't worry, this is all perfectly safe. I promise."

~

Somewhere further away in the woods, up a rather tall pine tree a large man was sitting rather uncomfortably near the tip of the top looking through a long black rifle's scope. In t he distance the sun was setting and his vision was going darker, but he could see his target perfectly.

"Good, she's on the move now..." he smiled.
153332221121111122112111221211.title: Unanswered Questions

choices: Told Grills the truth as they walked. There was no harm in him knowing.
Declined answering the question. She wasn't sure about telling anyone
1533322211211111221121112212111.content:
All seemed quiet in the woods as Hinata Hyuga progressed through the leafy locale. The dead of night made it hard for her to see, and even with her Byakugan activated the more massive kunoichi was having trouble navigating. Every time she moved she felt as if she was going to run into a tree or trip on a root somewhere under her clawed feet. Already she could feel her newly regrown fur underneath her clothing reemerge, as if on this journey to make her more bearlike, her body was already adapting itself. Perhaps to help make her journey less difficult.

Following her nose just as well as her eyes she created a path to allow her to get to the bearblood sap safely and quickly. Her senses helped her to avoid any unnecessary confrontations, as if she had continued on what seemed to be walkways made by other creatures she would've entered the territory of a few wolverines or a stream teeming with parasitic leeches. She had heard the expression treacherous paths before but had never thought that it would apply to a forest. Then again as a ninja she had to be prepared or anything that could be thrown her way.

As time passed she felt herself grow tired, partly from the trek and partly for having her Byakugan active for such an extensive period if time, and she sat back against a small rock formation. Exhaustion from the trip was taking it's toll on her, more than likely Hinata would end up not finding the tree, as dusk was dangerously near. She felt as if she couldn't even move a muscle from tiredness, when she heard the sound of footsteps. Turning quickly she saw that the rock she was leaning on was actually part of a cave entrance, and walking out she saw what looked to be a bear standing erect. She had spent enough time with Gunther's people to deduce that it was a male of some sort. She feared she had entered his territory unwittingly.

"Um...I-I'm sorry for disturbing you." she said gently to it, hoping it knew what she was saying. "I r-really shouldn'tve just plopped down here."

As Hinata prepared to flee the scene however she was surprised to hear a soft spoken yet strong male voice speak out to her.

"I am sorry as well. I should've taken up a dwelling elsewhere."

Turning to the source of the voice Hinata saw that the bear was actually more of a bear-man. He was a large humanoid bear wearing a simple beige cloak with a hood. He was much taller than Hinata, and that was quite a statement given her growth spurt. He looked meek, yet powerful. Something about seeing him felt nostalgic to Hinata. As if they had met in another world.

"E-excuse me sir, d-d-do I know you?" she asked. The creature before her looked surprised, but actually seemed to think on this.

"I am unsure. I do not think this is the first time we've met, but I have no idea who you are. Sorry about my poor memory. In any case my name is Grills."

"I-I am Hinata Hyuga." Hinata said bowing nervously. She didn't know what to say exactly after such an awkward meeting, when a thought occurred to her. "Are you a member of the golden feather tribe?"

"Sorry but no, I do know of them however." Grills apologized needlessly. "You probably thought that due to my appearance, but this form is from an unrelated source..."

"Would it happen to be the bear blood sap?"

"Sorry, but that's not correct either. I also know about the sap though, it comes from the tree atop the next hill. I learned about it from an acquaintance of mine named Ichikuma during one of my stays here in the winter a few years ago. That is how I know of the tree and the Golden Feather tribe."

"I-I see." Hinata said, her eyes on the ever shrinking sun, now a slight pink color on the western horizon. "Well may I ask you to show me exactly where the tree is? I need to get the sap relatively soon."

"Of course." Grills said walking out before her. "It would be a pleasure. Though can you tell me why you have come to look like that?"

"W-what?"

"Like you yourself have begun to change." He explained further, "I am sorry to intrude, but I do not often see other humans becoming more ursine in nature like myself so I was curious as to why you have taken your current form, and wish to become even more like a bear."

Hinata...

choices: She decided to take the bearblood sap.
She decided not to take it. Gunther couldn't be trusted.
15333222112111112211211122121111.content:
A little later Hinata and Grill were walking up the hill, Hinata had explained most of her situation to Grills. The bear-man was seemingly interested in the tale, he said nothing but paid close attention. His eyes shined with wisdom as Hinata finished.

"...Then Gunther sent me out here to find the bearblood. That's how I met you."

"I see." he muttered. "I'll admit it does sound suspicious, I have to say Gunther's actions are less than understandable. I do not know him, but I know his tribe generally praises him and openly despises all dissenters."

"But they're all such good people." Hinata said, thinking of the Gold feather tribe and the time she spent working with them. "And they hate people who attack Konoha."

"But does that truly make their leader good? he inquired. "They could have their own views, but Gunther could be using you in his plans or be deceiving you. As I recall deception was a key trait among ninja."

Hinata stopped at this once they reached the massive tree seeping with bearblood sap. Her sudden halt had more to do with a realization over the fact that Gunther very well could be evil.

Hinata stood there quietly for a long time until Grills touched her to grab her attention.

"Hinata, I'm sorry but I must go now. I suggest you take the sap and leave. The woods can be quite dangerous at night."

"Er, right." Hinata said as she quickly vialed the sap. She wasn't sure she should take it yet, so she decided to only take a sample for now. Once she was done she looked at Grills. "Thank you for listening to my problem and guiding me. It helped alot."

"No problem." Grills said. "I'm just sorry I couldn't help more. Until we next meet."

With that he left, as did Hinata.

When she returned to Konoha....
15333222112111112211211122121111.title: Told Grills the truth as they walked. There was...

15333222112111112211211122121112.content:
Hinata opened her mouth and paused before closing it again. Though this bear...man...person seemed trusting enough a last bit of loyalty to Gunther prevented her from divulging the issue. She just bowed her head in respect.

"I-I can't tell you, I a-apologize."

The bear-man didn't seem angered by her response and instead appeared sincerely remorseful. "I'm sorry as well, I shouldn't have pressed the issue."

The two remained quiet with each other after that, the sound of crunching leaves was all that could be heard as the moved through the thick of the forest. Grills led the way, crashing through branches that stood between them and their destination. Hinata was suddenly very glad that this creature was friendly. Yet even with the raw strength the both of them had together, she couldn't help but feel like something was off.

Maybe that someone was watching her...Though her senses told her nothing, not even her Byakugan detected any presence.

"There it lies, straight ahead." spoke Grills at last, pointing a clawed finger at a large mass in front of him. "Have a safe night, my lady. I'm sorry but I have urgent matters elsewhere that cannot be delayed further."

"N-No, it's fine. It's enough that y-you even brought me this far."

The bear- man bowed and stomped off back into the forest. It was when his steps could no longer be heard did Hinata turn to face what he had been pointing at. Even she was not fully prepared for just how large the tree was. It wasn't the tallest tree in the forest, the overgrowth above neatly hid it from a topside view. However, it was massive in bulk making it seem almost like a large boulder. But the twigs and leaves growing off it in various directions said otherwise. The shape of it could only be considered as one form. A giant bear roaring into the sky.

Hinata gulped, now that she was here alone the tree looked very imposing indeed. She half-wanted to run to find Grills again but shook her head. She had come this far already and she couldn't just turn around and run away when the goal was right there. With renewed determination, she stepped up to the bulky tree.

At first, Hinata wondered where she was supposed to draw the sap but then she noticed that the "claws" of the bear-tree were dripping with some red liquid. Hinata shuddered and immediately thought it was blood until she took a closer look at it. It was too thick to be blood, it dripped like honey almost.

"This m-must be the sap then..." she whispered, unpacking a vial from her side pouch.

The sap ran slowly into the vial, it only seemed to swirl violently when collected as if it were a beast that could not be contained. When she felt she had enough, she screwed the cap back on and turned around into the blackness of the forest. Dusk was over. There was nothing but darkness now, so much that Hinata couldn't see two feet in front of her.

She had grown too tired to use the Byakugan she so reached into her pouch again and pulled out a flare. As the warm light lit the area surrounding the tree, there was something out of place. There was a dark figure directly in front of her and the exit to the grove.

"Nicely done," spoke a voice.
15333222112111112211211122121112.title: Arrival.

choices: That night hinata had a strange dream.
153332221121111122112111221211122.content:
Turning about Hinata saw Taizen, who was smiling in her direction as if he had simply run into her around the village rather than in the woods. While Hinata could just barely make out his features, she recalled his sensory skills were intact.

"Taizen? How did you get here?" HJinata asked timidly.

"I go out into the woods often, especially when I cannot sleep. I was surprised to see you though, in a manner of speaking." he chuckled. "What brings you out so far?"

"Oh, erm...Just a bit of personal training is all." she lied quickly. Despite his inability to see it she flashed a quick smile, filled with sharp fangs. Taizen seemed to buy it though if his countenance was anything to judge by.

"I see, well I can definitely tell you worked hard. Sadly we won't be able to make it back to the Gold Feather Tribe or Konoha tonight. I am setting up a camp soon though, would you care to join me for the night?"

"Sure." Hinata agreed when she felt him take her hand.

"Please let me guide you, step carefully." he told her. Agreeing Hinata and her blind guide brought her through the forest. Though she couldn't see where she was going, she ached badly enough to know that they walked quite a ways. Eventually he stopped.

"Okay, there's a boulder here you can sit while I set up." the impaired youth said putting her hand on the sizable stone. Finding her seat Hinata finally rested, letting her feelings of tiredness wash over her. As she did her stomach rumbled. She was hoping that Taizen had some food ready.

"Don't worry, I caught some wild quail earlier." Taizen said as he lit a fire, the flames radiating warmth and enabling Hinata to see with it's light. "I couldn't catch any fish, but I do have some water ready to boil."

"Oh, well thank you, I don't have many provisions left." she said as she watched him begin to roast the small birds. They had already been plucked and cleaned. As time passed it began to give off an enticing scent. As she inhaled the scent she heard Taizen speak.

"You know, I hardly ever have company. I'm glad to have you here." he said to her quietly.

"I am glad I ran into you too. Thanks for helping me."

"No problem....Can I tell you a secret?"

"A secret?" Hinata asked, feeling a bit awkward. She wondered what it was. "S-sure."

"On quiet nights like this I feel at one with natre. I can hear the animals far off, feel the wind and earth. If I stay utterly still...Sometimes I forget I exist." he said, almost dreamily. "You know, people sometimes pity me for being blind, but when I can feel and sense so much...I feel I am blessed. A part of nature."

"You do?"

"Yes, I know you understand it a little. After all if you stay on the path you are on, and if everything goes as it should you will really know what I mean."

"What are you talking about?"

"Hinata, the changes you are going through are beyond the Gold Feather's Rite of Passage. It is different, it will make you more in tune, possibly because of your bloodline. Unlike me, your sight will advance along with your senses, in addition to you actually becoming a creation of nature."

"Wa-wait Taizen, h-"

"All will be explained in time, for now I must rest. Goodnight Hinata." he said giving her pillow and pointing to the one tent he set up. Immediately he himself went to sleep.

After that All hinata knew for sure was that Taizen knew something and, as crazzy as it sounded, made some sort of prediction about her future.

'Maybe it was just his tiredness...' she thought yawning and crawling over to the bed. 'Still, I better rest too.'

And so hinata slept soundly.
153332221121111122112111221211122.title: Kind words from a friend

choices: Naruto. Had he come searching for her?
A feral bear, had she wandered onto it's territory.
1533322211211111221121112212111222.content:
The next day Hinata awoke from her slumber early. Her mind felt hazy at first, but slowly she came to her senses, recalling partaking of the bearblood sap the previous night and Taizen's cryptic message to her. With the back of her hand, she rubbed her eyes, opening them slowly, only to see the odd sight of a snout on her face, covered with lavender colored fur. She gasped, surprised by it. She saw her new, black nose on the snout's tip. It was animalistic, much like her ears, which she felt had changed not only shape but position on her body.

"What's going on?" Hinata asked, glad that she could at least still speak. Her voice wasn't different, but as she tried to stand she noticed she was taller. Looking down at her body, the fur had covered it, her clothes once more ripped from her increase in mass. She looked at her hands, to discover there were pads on her palms, soft to the touch, but protective, while her fingers had claws. The same was done to her feet, the soles being padded, now slightly pawlike and too large to fit in her now broken sandals. The last change she noticed was her tailbone having become an actual tail.

There would be no easy way of judging how much her form had changed at the moment, so Hinata called out for Taizen.

"Taizen? Taizen aree you here?" Hinata asked, only to be met with silence. She looked about, but saw him nowhere. His scent was gone, as well as any trace of where he went, though his tent and camp were still there. It was almost as if he had disappeared into thin air. She wondered where her blind friend had gone.

She stood, happy to see that she could still walk erect, though she had no idea if she was fully a bear or not. She tried to walk, though it was more like lumbering. Her form was awkard and she was unable to determine whether or not she was fully changed or if it was just a partial one.

All she knew for sure was that she needed to determine how much she had changed and make her way back to the golden feather tribe.

As she travelled through the woods, she found her senses had increased. Though her sight was already grand due to the byakugan, she could also hear better. She could locate the birds from their calls, high up in the treees, the few wilf foxes, squirrels and mice that scurried about on the ground, and smell where they had been in the area around her.

Using that very smell, she smelled the scent of water in the air. she approached and saw her reflection. She still had human eatures, as if she was at the midway point between being a human or bear, but why had she changed so much and so fast? It was a mystery she couldn't quite solve.

*GRUMBLE*

Especially not on an empty stomach.

Hinata felt herself grow embarassed as she realized just how hungry she was. She felt as if she needed something in order to quell her newfound hunger.

Being close to water, she saw many fish. Though she knew bears preferred rivers with fish, she decided it would be easiest to go with what she had.

Taking a deep breath, she dove in, activating her byakugan. It made it asier for her to see every fish in the area, and making catching them much easier.

Within half an hour, she had five fish in hand and had thrown them on shore. Her first instinct was to eat them there as they were, but her human sensibilities demanded she cook them. She soon built a fire and prepared them, practically salivating at the smell.

That was when Hinata heard a noise, one not too far from where she was. She tried to detect what it was and discovered that it was...

15333222112111112211211122121112222.content:
Hinata gasped in surprise, seeing that a wild bear had come, approaching her. She could only guess that she was in it's territory and was disturbing it. She felt her adrenaline pump, her fight or flight instinct engage as her old fear reared its head. It reminded her of so long ago, when she was small.

Her new senses were almost too much to bear. While not nearly as great as her sight, her other senses were in hyperdrive, so much so that she had to focus in order to calm herself.

By that time, it had become obvious that the bear meant her no harm. It merely wished for the food Hinata had caught and roasted. It looked at the fire curiously, and the fish before seeing Hinata.

The bear wasn't quite sure what to make of her, all it knew as there was food and another member of its species perhaps. Hinata could see its confusion, but decided to show she was no threat. Carefully plucking a cooled, roast fish from near the fire, she placed it near the bear.

After a few apprehensive sniffs, the bear took a bite, before consuming the fish whole, enjoying it. Hinata smiled to herself upon seeing its happiness and ate as well, sharing her meal with this new ally.

It was within minutes that they finished their food, and Hinata was more than satisfied by her catch. All she needed now was to rest, as she felt far too tired to go back to Konoha or the Golden Feather tribe.

She noticed the bear with her seemed eager to go, as if it had some place to be. Hinata followed and was soon led to a sloth of bears, a strange and small community of them. Hinata was intrigued by them, but wanted to fit in. This was a chance for her to learn about bears, but she needed to blend in with them in order to get to know them better.

As such, she got on all fours, trying her best to look like a normal bear. To her surprise, her legs had changed so she could walk either on all fours or erect whenever she wanted. This revelation surprised her, but she felt as if this was natural.

She looked for a place of rest and saw that there was a hollowed out tree, one that was empty and free for her own use.

Happily, she crawled inside and tried to make a place for herself. As all the other bears readied themselves for slumber she decided that it would be in her interest to do the same.

Once inside, Hinata slept, her mind again wandering to where Taizen went, what Naruto was up to, and if Gunther would be proud of her progress. Those very thoughts continued into her sleep and influenced her dreams.

When Hinata awoke the next day, she found she was still in the woods with the bears, each of them going about their lives as needed. The mothers tended their cubs, watching them as they went to play while the males went off and foraged for food.

Hinata knew little about bears before now, but she was certain that they didn't live in such communities and that their behavior wasn't exactly what they had seen. Then again those were typical bears she had learned about, and there were a fair number of creatures that acted differently from their feral counterparts. All she could do was wonder and try to fit in as best she could with the current group.

A week passed, and in that week Hinata learned many of the trials of being a bear. Among the chief lessons was to avoid going in areas with disturbed bees. Though she could easily do away with them, it was exhausting and her balance took some getting used to.

Still, she had good times getting to know the other bears and their habits, using identifying traits with scents and making mental notes of who they were. Likewise, they had taken her in and things were peaceful.

This new state of being had its trials, but Hinata was growing stronger for it and more content, though she needed to occassionally go off on her own and perform a few exercises in humanity, such as taijutsu training or writing, using her claws to scratch words into bark. She couldn't do it much, so she only wrote important things, such as important lessons of the day or a warning to stay away for other humans.

After eight days...

153332221121111122112111221211122222.content:
Hinata’s time among the bears continued to change her as she lived in day to day life. It seemed she was getting more and more comfortable with her new place in life.

Being with the bears, she was starting to grow more attached to them. She started to identify with them not by names, but by sense of smell, relying on animalistic instincts more than her human ones. She found her mind focused less and less on memories of home and her loved ones, but more on survival. It wasn’t that she was purposefully forgetting, but she had begun to feel her memories get pushed back to the back of her mind, just under the surface.

She had vague awareness of being human formerly, but otherwise she believed herself to be a bear. She had lost her anthropomorphic status, her arms and legs becoming totally ursine and indistinguishable from theose and others. Her hands and feet now completely paws as she began to feel a heavier coat of fur grow over her body. Her fur had a passing similarity to her hairstyle, but if one did not look closely, they would not consider her to have any relation to her former self.

She continued with her day to day routine, walking about foraging for food and making sure that the other bears in her sloth were alright. She eventually saw them separate out though and into their own territories. As it turned out bears were asocial for the most part. The ones she had been with were merely relatives come to see the cubs. She was fortunate enough to learn the basics from them before she began to look for food of her own.

It started with her climbing trees in search of acorns. Being the bulk of a bear’s diet, she had to start there. She found a reasonably good haul and soon took her fill of the food. When she had gotten as much as she could, she went down from the tree and back to walking around. She found herself looking for berries in the area next as she was not in the mood for fish. Her sharp sight thanks to the byakugan enabled her to find everything she needed and she led a very content life for some time. It wasn’t until three weeks after she had given herself over fully to being a bear that she noticed something…

There was an intruder in her territory, one that had passed through, but not too long ago. Hinata had also learned part of a bear’s nature was to be more territorial. Hinata began to look around, following her nose. She prepared herself for any or all threats, but she didn’t notice any come by. She knew it wasn’t the other bears. She could recognize them easily if she had seen them, but she had not found anything to indicate it was them.

She was utterly puzzled, wondering what it could have been. Putting it behind her, she returned to her den around nightfall.

Unbeknownst to Hinata, the forest of death where the chunin exams were held had been opened lately, a few of the animals clawing at the gates for unknown reasons. Because of this, many of those creatures had spilled out. Ninja from the Leaf village had done their best to wrangle as many as possible, but many more had evaded their grasp. This was a problem that Hinata would soon be dealing with as she continued her new life.

The next day, she woke early and with a loud yawn, rising sluggishly at first, bur soon facing the new day. She walked outside, smelling the scent of flowers, herbs and other plantlife and the tweeting of birds in the area. Hinata did also hear the buzzing of bees. They weren’t making honey yet, but they would be soon. For now she decided it was best to leave them be and look for more filling sustenance.

She had noticed deer in the area and was hoping to bring one down so she could eat. Being omnivorous she ate what she could, but she felt as if today was a good day to go for meat. She went onward out to a clearing where some deer were grazing. She could see them and how skittish they were, a few stags on the alert. In a way she felt as if the does and their fawns reminded her of her old self. However they were animals, no, prey and they had to fall so she could thrive. Her hunting of them was not malicious or personal, but just nature necessary for her to survive.

Taking that chance, she began to draw closer to the ungulates. With a leap, she bounded out, only to see a great tiger come around, pouncing on the fauna and trying to consume it. The sight shocked Hinata, it was a surprise to see such a large tiger so close to the woods. It was five times her own size and it was ripping into the deer with gusto, consuming it and ignoring the others. It had ruined Hinata’s hunt, but she was not in the mood for conflict. She tried to walk away, but was surprised when she found that the tiger has seen her.

For their environments, Bears were typically apex predators, ones who were at the top with no contest, however tigers were the one exception to this rule. They would sometimes prey on bears and while Hinata did not know this, she could certainly sense the creature’s intent. No mere deer would be enough sustenance for it, and it was hungry for more.

Hinata could feel herself gearing up for conflict with the giant tiger, the great feline baring his fangs. Hinata watched as he rushed up at her, only for her to sidestep. Even with just her instincts, her muscle memory from her time as a ninja remained, and with it she had adapted some of her moves. Her ability of sight enabled her to predict the creature’s movements and intentions. She dodged the first claw strike flawlessly before following up with a slash of her own, scoring on it’s face. The creature roared in pain before Hinata roared too, telling it to go back before she attacked again.

The creature chose to ignore the threat, and instead pounced harder, once again being met with defeat. This continued for some time, several minutes.

Hinata did have a few admittedly close calls, but it wasn’t long before the large foe was sufficiently wounded. Her claws dug deep. Blinded in one eye, blood matting its fur, and several deep slashes in it’s limbs and body made the tiger begin to fall. It slumped over slowly, no longer able to limp after her or run away. Hinata could tell it would be dead soon, but she was exhausted as well. She slowly limped back to her home to rest.

It was a large, bipedal looking, light purple dragon. It was also critically wounded, blood was all over it's scaly body and looked like it was breathing heavily. It was larger than most of the trees, but wasn’t visible due to being on the ground.

Hinata found herself sitting in the nexus of the flight, calmly watching the formations as if it were a dance. Next to her sat a much larger scared dragon; half a horn was missing as well as the majority of his snout. A giant fiery red dragon, eyes full of age and experience. Hinata shuffled in place. Something was pulling her into a black void.

"WAKE UP HUMAN!" Screamed the voice of Princess Inanis.
~

"Dragons...dragons..." She muttered, half dazed.

The figure turned out to be her sister, Hanabi. "Hinata! Father said for you to wake up! This is the fifth time already!"

Hinata quickly sat up and rubbed her sand filled eyes. It was a dream. It felt so real though. It was like she really was a...dragon. Yesterdays events with Anne suddenly flooded the young ninja's mind. She looked down the collar of her bed shirt. Sure enough, there was a glowing purple scar on her stomach in a letter Hinata could not recognize. Hanabi was looking more and more annoyed.

"Are you through checking yourself out!? Get up and eat breakfast!"

Hinata decided to not test the patience of her sister and father further. Hanabi left her sisters room in a huff while Hinata quickly got changed into her usual outfit. There was a strange warm feeling in the pit of her belly but she ignored it. In a matter of moments she was standing in front of her father, who looked very cross with her.

"Hinata! This is the third day in a row we've had to wake you!"

"S-sorry father." Hinata winced slightly. Partially at his scolding, but mostly at the warmth in her stomach getting hotter.

"Stronger, must be stronger."

Hinata breathed harshly, her head too heavy to hold up. She had been at her new training for days now, and nothing she did seemed to make her any stronger. Staring into the eyes of her opponent, she struggled to ready herself for battle.

"You are beyond your limit. Surrender before the damage becomes permanent."

Hinata looked into the black eyes of a shadowy version of herself, the result of a forbidden jutsu she had stumbled across in her family's treasury. It had taken all the courage she could muster to read from the scroll, but now the training it offered required something more than bravery.

With a gulp of air, Hinata charged at the shadow. She seemed to pass through it like it was made of mist. Her face was greeted by the taste of dirt as she felt the shadow step on her back, posing for victory.

"Admirable. But misguided. Your attempts at attacking me were more impressive at the start of our fight."

Hinata wanted to tell the shadow she had only lost her edge because she was tired, but she knew even if she was at full strength there would be no way to damage this thing. She felt the hand press at the back of her head.

"Game over. For today."

Hinata felt a cold sensation at the back of her neck and the shadow vanished. A presence entered her mind, something that could speak in her thoughts. It sounded the same as the shadow she had been fighting just moments ago.

"I grow tired of these pointless exercises. You said you would release me."

"Not until you make me stronger,"Hinata replied mentally.

The voice seem to ponder Hinata's response for a moment. "It's true, you are the heir to the Hyuga clan, and also true you are the one who found me trapped within the scroll. Were it anyone else, I would have turned them into ash. But at the rate you're going, you'll never succeed in mastering the hidden jutsu of the Gentle Fist."

Hinata flinched. "I refuse to believe that."

"Believe it, Hyuga. We need only look at your last attempt to best me. Charging right at me without grace or form. That's something only an elephant would do."

"You promised me you would teach me the secret Hyuga arts."

Hinata had at last found the strength to rise from the ground. Glancing around the training grounds, she found no one watching her. Every time she had these conversations in her head, she worried that someone was listening in on them.

"You will learn nothing continuing as you are and I don't have the time or patience to continue to train you. You need to learn to be more gentle if you're to succeed in the simple task of hitting me."

Being more gentle was a complaint Hinata never thought she'd hear. If anything her father would tell her the exact opposite. But every attack against her shadow clone resulted in passing through it, like it was nothing. Hinata sighed. She needed to learn this jutsu if she wanted to become useful in the coming battle.

"Then how? How do I be more gentle?"

"Offer me your body. I will mold it into a form more ideal for training of this caliber. It will be a unique sort of training, one that you will have to practice every second of every day."

Hinata paused in her limp home. The shadow from the scroll was essentially a trapped demon. She had agreed to give up her body as a temporary host, similar to many of the tailed beasts. No one in the Hyuga clan knew what this thing was, only that it was dangerous and deserved to be locked up. Making a deal in exchange for freedom was one thing, but making a deal to surrender her body...

"Choose or I will leave you."

The little river horse was a gift that her late uncle gave her on a trip to the zoo, it was the last thing they did together before, the incident with Kumo.

Even before that day hippos were her favorite something about the heavy semi-aquatic mammals drew her to them, they seemed unimpressive but in the land they were from they were one of the most feared animals around. Something about that made her wish she was strong like them, then maybe 'he' would notice her.

"Excuse me, young lady."

Hinata snaps up like coming out of a dream at the voice calling to her. Mentally bemoaning her lack of focus, knowing it could get her killed in the field, she turned as saw a street vendor stand, not uncommon in the village but a little odd this time of year, and sitting at it was an elderly gentleman, wearing a clean but simple kimono, his paper white eyebrows knitted in focus.

"I couldn't help but notice that headband around your neck, that means your a ninja doesn't it?"

Perhaps in the loosest sense of the word, she thought to herself. But nodded all the same.

"I knew it, I bet a fine upstanding ninja like yourself would appreciate a little something like this."

The man reaches under his booth and pulls out a scroll. Even in the fading light Hinata could read the kanji, inner beast style jutsu.

"This my dear girl is a rare ninja technique scroll, it is said that those who use these techniques can use the power of their inner animal, it is said that every person has one and that no two are alike."

Hinata pauses for thought, her hand holding her beloved figurine tightly, it seemed almost to good to be true. But on the other hand it sounded eerily similar to Kiba's family's techniques so it might not be so farfetched.

"I see you're having trouble deciding, understandable so I'll tell you what, you buy it now and I can guarantee this one time price of 20 mon."

Hinata almost stumbles over from the shock, even the ninja libraries couldn't go that low for their fees.

"Tick tock, my dear I've got other business to consider do you want it or not?"

Hinata took one last glance at her figurine and made her decision.

Hinata tried to hide from the creature as it sped towards her, using one of the eggs as cover. Within minutes, it arrived and let out a deafening roar.

Hinata held her breath as she tried to think of some sort of jutsu that could save her from ending up in the belly of this monster. It looked like a giant lizard, with an over-sized head and tail. "Don't know yet. That note's to her fokes to let them know what's going on so they don't worry." Naruto said.

The son of Gamabunta nodded, realizing that being sure to keep this quiet was also part of why he was getting paid up front. He took the letter and hopped off as Naruto opened the bunker again so they could get out.

"You ok Ino?" Naruto asked as he handed Ino a hooded cloak and she put it on. She nodded and affectionatly rubbed his cheek with her paw. As soon as the two left the bunker, Naruto closed it again, leaving no trace of the intrence as it melded seemlessly with the alleyway wall.

"Well, Mr. Secret Passageway-expert, where to now?" Ino asked.

"Up to you. between how well I know the back alleys and passageways hidden all over the village and the maditory parkour training they give in the accademy, we can head anywhere you want Ino."

"Anywhere I want huh?" Ino mulled over before she grinned at him "Alright. if its anywhere I want...take me to your place."

"HUH?!" Naruto cried, his face going red from embaressment and shock.

Ino laughed "You heard me Darling, I. Want. To. Go. To. Your. Place." she said with a smile on her muzzle, he was too cute.

"W-w-w-well if you want to..." Naruto pulled at his jumpsuit's collar and gulped "F-f-f-fallow me."

Giggling at how flusterd he was, Ino followed him and they soon made it to his apartment. Ino had to hold Naruto's hands to keep them steady as they were shaking too bad for him to get his key in the lock. Once the door was open, Ino stepped into the small apartment, her first reaction to the room was that of surprise. She had expected that Naruto lived in a pigsty or something, but the apartment room wasâ¦almost cozy. Sure, the floor needed to be swept and there was a picture of Sasukeâs head that had a couple of kunai stabbed into it, but otherwise it seemed like a normal house. She slipped out of her ninja sandals. She couldn't see anything from the hallway, so she slowly walked a little further until she came to a large door on her right.

"That's my room," he said. Nodding, she opened the door and flipped on the light. Immediately, her eyes were met with the sight of dozens of scrolls, books, and wadded up pieces of paper on his bed and on the ground. A few ramen cups sat on the floor, and it was painfully obvious that he hadn't done any cleaning in at least a week.

She smirked at him. "I didn't know you studied," she teased, causing him to scratch the back of his head sheepishly.

"Yeah, well, I was just reading up on seals and stuff. Ero-sennin said if I learned the basics, he'd teach me how to do the cool stuff later. It kind of come natrually to me for some reason."

The blond girl glanced back at the scrolls and frowned.

'Seals, huh?' she thought, scratching her head slightly. She'd learned how to seal small things like weapons and clothing from her dad, but anything larger than a meter was out of the question. She briefly considered teaching him how to do it but decided to take a look at the rest of the apartment first. Ino turned around and walked the rest of the way down the hall until she came to another door.

"What's in here?" Naruto looked up to side as Ino opened the door.

"This is the bathroom. It's not that dirty, I don't think..." She turned on the light and smiled. While it certainly wasn't the cleanest bathroom in the world, it was definitely better than what she expected. She turned around and walked towards the final opening at the end of the hall.

This room was easily the biggest in the entire house, being both the kitchen and the living room. A small stove and refrigerator sat in the corner closest to them, and a small table with a large basket on top was set up right in the middle. Numerous plants sat on a shelf next to the icebox, causing her to raise an eyebrow at the genin.

"Gardening?" she asked, motioning towards the pots. He crossed his arms across his chest defensively and shrugged, his cheeks pink from embarrassment. Ino had to admit, he'd done a good job with the plants, mabye she could convince her parents to give him a part-time job at the Yamanaka flower shop...

Shaking her head, she turned back to finish her investigation of the room. There wasn't much left; a couch sat against the opposite corner of the wall, and a small TV rested on a black apple crate. "Not bad. I don't mind crashing here until I'm normal again."

"HUH?!"

Ino giggled, "I said I want to stay with you." she teased.

Naruto turned as red as that weird super-chakra she'd seen him use in the Chunin exams.

"A-a-are you s-s-sure...?"

"Yep, why do you ask? Hiding something from me?" Ino teased

"Its not that, I just...its the first time I've had anyone be here with me, much less a goddes..."

Ino giggled. Naruto really was too much of aa sweetie for his own good. She sat on the couch and pat the spot next to her, clearly wanting him to join her. Still blushing enough to put any shade of red Hinata had ever turned to utter shame, Naruto sat down next to her. Once he had, Ino leaned against him and sighed blissfully. If being a skunk-girl was the price for such a sweet-heart to be with her, then she'd accept being this way forever. While she DID want to be normal again, the thought of what her and Naruto's kids would look like if she was still a humanoid she-skunk made her giggle.

"Huh? You alright Ino?" Naruto asked, his blush having faded away.

Ino just smiled happily, brushing his face gently with her tail, her fur tickling his nose and teesing him with the threat of a sneeze.

"Nothing to worry about...its just you're a good guy and I'm feeling happy right now." Then she kissed him gently.

Naruto found the whole thing pleasant. Ino's fur didn't get in the way, it actually made the hot kiss even warmer. The jinchuuriki then kissed her back, wrapping his arms around her furry body.

It was right then that Ino decided, she was going to keep Naruto. Either as a pet, a posession, or as a person...she wasn't going to let him be taken from her. She breafly wondered if she could combind her skunk-spray with jutsus to see if that was possable.

Our story starts off simply enough.

Ino was in the backyard of one of the elders in Konoha. A guy by the name of Nuishi had filed for someone to find his lost dog, a golden retriever named Oshii.

At first Ino whined about being given such a trivial mission, especially all by herself, but in the end orders were orders.

Ino headed towards the old man's house, where she found him sitting and drinking tea. He was a bald old man, he had a somewhat wrinkly face, but friendly gray eyes. He wore a man's kimono, colored orange and white.

"Hello, are you the one they sent to get my precious Oshii?" Nuishi asked.

"Yes, could you tell me the last time you saw her?" Ino asked.

"Three weeks ago. She was digging in the backyard and I sent her to her doghouse for messing up the garden, she never did leave, and I called her plenty." he said sadly, starting to ramble. "She was such a young thing two, barely two years old, fourteen in dog years. She was one of the litter my old dog Nanashi had before she passed, had her since I was your age, as a matter of fact she was a strange stray, had this old collar that dissapeared once she died, but she had it with her before I found her..."

Ino sighed impatiently. "Well, I'll check it out."

"Alright young lady, I'll just lay down for a nap." He said, shuffling inside. Ino headed out back to find what would've been a well kept yard, aside from various half dug holes.

There were fruit bearing trees, tall, healthy, and well kept, as well as some cosmos plants, and multiple patches of brown land, with cabbage, carrots, and the occasional melon.

"Wonder what Oshii was trying to find..." Ino said, when she went near the doghouse, which was large enough for her to enter on all fours.

When Ino did enter, she found herself falling from great heights into a giant hole.

====

What felt like hours later, Ino awoke. She opened her eyes and found herself looking at the sky.

“Didn’t I fall down a hole? Ino thought to herself, when she noticed a terrible scent. Ino looked and discovered she had fallen on a pile of garbage. “EEW!” Ino yelled, standing as quickly as she could, when she noticed…

In another pile of rubbish next to the one she was standing up was a figure squirming through the trash. Ino nearly jumped back in surprise. It was a giant sloth that wore a small vest and had its hair done up in a ponytail at the top of its skull. Strangely enough, it sounded and looked just like Shikamaru!

"You mind keeping the noise down, dog? I don't mind you trespassing in my home but at least let me get my sleep..."

Ino feel flat on her butt. "Y-you're a talking sloth!"

"Very observant. Is it my turn now? You must be...a talking rat. No?"

"Wh-what's happening!? Where a-am I and why am I like this!?" She started pulling on the yellow fur, it wouldn't budge.

The sloth sighed. "You aren't very bright are you?"

Ino growled at the sloth and yelled at the top of her lungs. "Shut up! I think I have a right to be confused, you garbage dwelling monkey!"

The sloth put a finger to its lips. "Alright, alright! Shhh! If you make anymore noise they're gonna-"

"What's going on over here!?" Yelled an approaching voice.

"Now you've done it! Get under some trash, quick!"

~

A tall human in traditional samurai armor approached the half asleep sloth. He pointed the large sword he was wielding at the lazy animal as it gave a huge yawn.

"Again with the noise, Kanji? Me and the other soldiers are tired of investigating every single happening here."

"Hey, it's not may fault. You jerks just had to have your battle right near my home."

The human glared at Kanji. "Watch it, beast. What was it this time? Get a nasty bed sore? Fell asleep on a fork?"

Kanji looked at the soldier with dazed eyes. "I saw a mouse..."

"A mouse?"

"It was a big mouse."

The soldier knew he was being mocked and jabbed a finger at the sloth-man. "You listen to me, you animal. You're lucky the commander was kind enough to let you stay here, considering our battle with the rebels. Show some gratitude or we'll beat it into you. Got that?"

"Yes sir..." Saluted the sloth.

The soldier spat on the ground and turned to leave. Kanji waited until he was out of sight before whispering to the trash pile next to him.

"Alright, the coast is clear."

~

"So your name is Kanji?" Asked Ino as the two of them walked down the broken back-alleys of an abandoned city.

"I can see how dogs got their reputation for hearing well..."

She gave him angry look but continued. "Okay then...Where am I exactly?"

"Ushi, or what's left of it."

The ruins around them were vast and maybe once well built. Chipped away stone and blood splattered on the walls suggested that the reason it was abandoned was due to a terrible battle not long ago. The area was dry, like it was sitting right on the edge of a desert. Kanji sighed and started rummaging through some trashcans, eating scraps of remaining food.

"That's disgusting!"

"What?" Muttered the sloth with a half eaten chicken bone in his mouth. "Want some?"

"Absolutely not! I just want to get out of this place! You still haven't told me where I am!"

"I told you, you're in Ushi..."

"Where the hell is Ushi!? And why is everything destroyed!?"

Kanji sighed again. "You know...this is why I hate women. They ask too many questions..."

This guy was every bit like Shikamaru! The only difference was he didn't seem to know her at all. Did she fall through some kind of portal where the world was ruled by animals? No that wouldn't make sense...that soldier was human for some reason. Maybe she'd have better luck explaining what her situation was to him.

"Okay, look! Let me explain something to you Kanji..."

1551322122.content:
Ino's first reflex was to jump back in surprise when she saw a strange creature's reflection in the pond.

"Gah! What the-!?" She yelled to no one in particular.

Scanning the surface of the water, she found that she was entirely alone. There were no animals or people for that matter in sight. With that in mind she decided to brave another look into the murky depths.

What she saw in the water was her own face...except not quite! Her mouth had gotten more bulbous and wider. Her nose was also flatter, her nostrils were clearly visible now. Strangest of all, her ears had somehow extended slightly and were peaking out of her blond hair. In fact her entire body seemed to have gained 50 pounds of fat!

"Wh-wh-what's happening to me!?" Ino shrieked, grabbing her ears in disbelief.

This was no mere trick of reflection on the rippling water, these changes were real. Ino was able to look down with her eyes and see her new "snout" slowly expanding before her eyes! She was actually changing by the second, into what she didn't know.

Fear gripped her, nothing but pure panic jolted through her mind. What the hell was happening to her? Was she going insane!? Was it something she ate!?

Wait...Perhaps it wasn't something she ate but something she......

"The tea!" Exclaimed Ino, realizing now what must have happened. "Why that no good fat little bi-"

Her cursing was interrupted by the sounds of ripping. Her now massive butt had ripped through the back of her pants. The changes were not slowing down at all! Coming to the quick conclusion that time was running out, Ino turned and waddled back to Lady Abura's home.

~

The faster Ino tried to run, the faster the changes seem to take hold. Her overall body fat seemed to increase like air being blown into a balloon. As her hands and feet plumped up, her fingers and toes almost merged together into one massive entity. But it was her stomach and chest area that seemed to be taking the most damage.

Within minutes after starting her sprint her, she felt her blue shirt begin to rip in several places. Plus, her pants weren't doing well in the fight to hold together either.

Thankfully the house was now just a few yards away. Ino was doubly lucky in the fact that the others had already went home for the day. Ino pounded at the front door with her pudgy "fist".

"Who is it?" Came an almost sickening sweet voice on the other side.

"You know darn well who it is, you fat old cow! Open up!" Replied Ino, as her pants finally snapped off her legs. The insult only seemed to speed the changes.

Lady Abura opened the door and did her best to be surprised. She clearly was enjoying every moment of this.

"Why Ino! I dismissed your teammates for the day already. You don't have to be here until tomorrow...Oh, I see you got my gift."

Ino could feel her shirt strain under the building pressure of her body's added girth. She had to weight at least 300 pounds by now!

She wasted no time in barking her command. "Fix this!"

"Fix what, exactly?" Smirked the lady. "You have a big mouth, this only proves it."

"Why you-"

"Ah, ah! I'd be careful if I were you. You see that flavor of tea was a special brand your teammates found while doing the work YOU earned for them. Can you guess what it does?"

"Hell if I know!" Yelled Ino as her shirt finally ripped into pieces, leaving her big and naked. "Just please, fix this!"

Lady Abura sighed. "Let me give you a hint then...If a person tended to be stubborn and rude, they would probably transform into a donkey. While if a person were gluttonous and greedy, they might become a pig..."

"Then what has that got to do with me!?"

Abura finally realized she would have to spell it out for the girl. "I told you before...You have a big mouth. Therefore, you're becoming a hippo."

Ino felt around her new snout, noticed that it had extended a good six inches from her face. That's when she realized that old woman was probably telling the truth.

"Please! Make it stop! You can do that can't you!?"

"Sorry, the tea will run it's course until you come to terms with your faults. There is, however, a way to return to normal temporarily."

It was getting harder to stand on two feet. "I'll do anything! Just please tell me!"

"Apologize to me for your earlier comment." Answered Lady Abura with a "matter of fact" tone.

"What!? Why!?"

"Very well then...I suppose you'll wallow around like a hippo for weeks until you learn your lesson..." The old woman turned to close the door.

"No! Wait! I'm....I'm sorry, okay!? I didn't mean it! It was just a joke!"

And with that, in an instant Ino felt the changes all over her body begin to reverse. The mountains of fat on her just were suddenly absorbed. Her mouth receded and her ears returned to normal. Of course, she was still standing naked on the front doorstep.

"Well now...That's better isn't it?" Abura folded her arms.

"Wh-what happened?" Asked Ino staring at her old form, it was as if nothing had happened at all.

"You apologized, therefore the effects reversed themselves. You see each time you insult someone or 'open that big mouth of yours', you'll begin reverting into the form of a massive hippo. It won't stop until you apologize for your actions to the person DIRECTLY."

"But that's so unfair!" Whined Ino.

"You should have been more mindful of what you said then...Toodle-O." Replied Abura, closing her front door on the still naked Ino.

Desperately, she tried knocking on the door. But the woman pretended to not hear Ino.

"Come back! Fix this, please! At least can I have some clothes or something!?"

Ino grabbed a handful of her long blond hair in frustration for the tenth time. It had been the tenth time she had read this passage in the scroll, the tenth time she thought she had comprehended it, and the tenth time she realized she didn't hold onto a word of it. This had been going on for the past four hours, an entire beautiful spring afternoon wasted because she had to study for the Ninja Academy mid term exam.

"ARGGGH! I've had it with this stupid thing!" she yelled and threw the scroll across the room. It collided hard against the wall of her bedroom before collapsing into a heap on the floor.

Ino didn't bother to pick it up, she was in no mood after this constant fruitless studying. She loudly stomped across her floor and slammed her head into the pillows on her bed. To the casual observer, one might assume she was angry. But if one really got to know her better, they'd understand that she was scared. Terrified even.

"What am I gonna do...?" she whispered to herself under the pillow.

There was a good reason for her to be afraid. These mid terms weren't just a big exam, they counted for fifty percent of their total grades. If Ino didn't pass there was a chance that she wouldn't graduate or worse end up in a cell with the class idiots like Naruto.

A knock at the door snapped her back out of her nightmarish daydreaming. "Ino? Is everything alright in here?"

Her father looked in the room with a worried face. Ino didn't even bother to take her head out of the pillows. "I'm going to fail and not become a ninja, that's the problem daddy."

"Oh, come on now. You've been in your room for four hours now. Surely that time hasn't been wasted."

A bloodshot and annoyed looking eye glared at her father from under the pillows. He knew his daughter well enough that talking to her right now was just going to cause them to go in circles. So he just shook his head and gently closed the door.

"You'll do fine. Just don't stomp around like that, you sound like an elephant from downstairs."

With that, the raging blond girl was left alone to her horrible studying. But something her father said had sparked a memory within her mind. She could not tell if he had chosen his words carefully or not to provoke such a memory, secrets of the mind were her clan's specialty after all. Something about one word in particular such to her thoughts like glue.

"Elephant." she repeated several times, as if trying to get the memory to materialize right in front of her.

Suddenly, she sat up in an instant. "Of course! Elephants!"

She went to her bookshelf and began to dig around it's contents, looking for something very specific she had remembered seeing. It was something that she was sure was going to help her with her exam...

It was underneath Ino's many beauty magazine, crushed and mangled but edible enough to read from. What she had been looking, an old scroll from her family's archives, had seen better days especially after Ino had looked at it. A single character was painted on the cover "脳". Brain. Or in this case, memory.

"Pay dirt," she whispered with a grin.

Without further hesitation, she undid the binding and pulled open the parchment. The inside was even more decrepit then the scoffed and scratched outside. Mold and dust blanketed the soggy pages, this scroll hadn't seen the light of day for some time.

Reading through it and brushing the paper clean at the same time, Ino scanned for the passage she was looking for. "Elephants...Elephants...Ah, here we go!"

Section 3. Article B:

Elephants are among the world's most intelligent yet underestimated creatures. It wasn't until recently during studies did humanity discover the untapped potential of an elephant's memory in particular. The process in which they did so involved...

"Blah, blah, blah..." she muttered, skimming on ahead with careless disregard. "Skip to the jutsu."

Several paragraphs down from the initial text, she came across what seemed to be instructions. In a heading it read "To Gain an Elephant's Memory" or "To Be More Like an Elephant", the translation could have meant either. She prayed in thanks to whatever gods were watching over her now as most of the instructions were shown through pictures, but even so this ritual seemed very odd and complicated.

"I gotta do it...This is the only way I'm going to be able to pass that test."

The first steps showed the proper hand signs for completing the ritual. Simple enough, though most academy students couldn't perform complex jutsu Ino had to try. Thankfully each hand sign was shown in its own picture. Monkey. Tiger. Dragon. Tiger. Horse. And finally Ram.

There was an odd release of chakra Ino felt flow through her body as a slight breeze filled the room, scattering some loose papers on the floor. Other then that though, nothing happened. Ino looked at the scroll for what was next.

The headline read "Physical Ritual" in what appeared to be the next section of the rite. What was odd about the pictures in it though was that they had the person in the drawings acting out in an unusual manner. The first one, for example, had the person grabbing their nose then in the second the person's nose stretching out in front of their face like a giant tube.

"Odd..." thought Ino as she tried to mimic the photo.

She pinched hard but for some reason her nose didn't have any feeling of it. Humoring the picture, Ino gave her nose a slight tug if just so she'd feel a little resistance from her nose. No such opposition occurred, however.

When Ino pulled forward on her nose, it stretched while still remaining in her hand.

She yelped and quickly let go, hoping that her nose would somehow snap back into place like a rubber band. Instead it flopped down in front of her face, resting comfortably on her chin. A sudden chill made Ino realize what the "Physical Ritual" had entailed.

"Oh no. Oh no. Oh no." she kept chanting as she stumbled for a mirror.

With teary eyes she looked at herself in the reflection. Her nose had comically stretched out like a tube and covered her mouth. In fact if she didn't know any better, her nose looked a lot like an...

"...Elephant's..."

Ino...

"Ahh...It's still Saturday. I'll come up with something by tomorrow...I hope."

Ino would no doubt be spending it locked in her room again struggling with the monumental task she faced.

She envied the little kids that ran around the streets, enjoying the last few hours of sunlight before turning in for the night. They were so carefree, but soon enough they would be in the same boat she was. Ino suddenly felt very old just thinking about it despite being only age twelve.

"Hey Ino!" called a voice, breaking up her internal contemplation.

Ino put on a forced smile and turned to see a head of pink hair. It was Sakura.

"How's studying going?" she asked, as if reading the blond girl's mind.

"I know, I know. Iruka-sensei has told us a thousand times already..."

"And if you're caught cheating, you'll be ejected from the school."

"I get it Sakura!"

"Enjoy your weekend, Ino."

Ino glared at Sakura as she strutted away, half hoping that a meteorite would fall from the sky and crush her and her smug attitude. She was more determined than ever now to succeed and pass this stupid exam. If she could, she'd try to bet Sakura in grades so she'd never have an ego again.

"Keep smiling Sakura-bitch..."

Tenten had had just about enough of Temari. The obnoxious ferret servant had a look that said "Bring it on." Tenten rattled her brain to think of the most creative form of punishment befitting for the stubborn rodent. That was it. Stubborn! A sly smile grew across her face as she thought of something.

"I'm sure you are very sorry Temari...You know, I'll bet most servants would have given up by now trying to resist me. But not you, still you stubbornly cling to resistance. In fact I do think you're as stubborn as a mule..."

"What are you saying mistress..."

"What I am merely ORDERING is that you assume the form most fitting for you. Temari, you shall be my trusty stead, a mule!"

There was a twinge of fear in Temari's eyes as her already long snout expanded. Her neck lengthened to bizarre proportions. Even her tail was changing; thinning and growing black hairs at the end. Hooves began to take shape on both her hands and feet, Temari was forced to drop to all fours in order to balance. Bones in her body shifted and cracked, reshaping her form into a horse-like one. Her once long stomach shrink inwards, all the length went to her arms and legs. Conveniently, a large saddle formed on her back. Temari was a complete mule, while maintaining her hairstyle and yellow fur color.

"Well Temari," Smirked Tenten. "You've certainly made an ass of yourself, haven't you?"

"Good one mistress..." Grunted Temari.

"Ah, mules don't talk. Not another word from you."

Tenten mounted the saddle while Temari finally had a defeated look on her face. It was good to enjoy a moment of victory for once.

"Now let's head into town my trusty steed! Hinata, would you like to hop on too?"

"Nonsense! Temari, have another saddle appear on your back."

The yellow mule sighed, and a brown saddle appeared behind the one Tenten was riding on. Tenten gave a hand to Hinata to help her into her seat. Temari was sweating under the weight of both her master and another ferret girl, each her own size. But somehow she managed to wobble along the path.

"Good girl! Now let's see what there is to do in Konoha!"
155221211112121111111.title: Working her like a mule.

As Temari carried her passengers into Konoha, Tenten saw a familiar figure beneath an even more familiar tree.

"Temari, stop for a second." Tenten said peering off, when she saw that it was indeed the Magical ferret from before.

"Hinata, stay here and watch out for travelers, I'll be back soon." The brunette said running to the tree.

"Y-yes mistress."

Soon Tenten came upon the rodent, who sat there humbly.

"Nice to see you again Tenten, are you well?"

"Better than ever, thanks to you and the fruit."Tenten said happily before pointing at Hinata and Temari "I've even gotten a couple of followers out of it."

"Ah, and both are quite the beauties, but I need for you to...repay my favor." The ferret muttered.
