"You are to be my bride!"

Tenten's jaw was partially on the ground. Get married to a freaking rodent!? Even if she herself were part ferret, that would be just going too far. There was absolutely no way she would be a life partner to a magical talking ferret.

"Dumbstruck are we? I'm not surprised. I know...I'm quite the catch aren't I?" He flexed for her.

"Y-yea...Uh, why didn't you mention this when you gave me the fruit?"

"I forgot." He said, blankly.

She was tempted to flatten the overgrown rat, but decided to see what her options were. "If say- And this is all just from curiosity- I decided to...not marry you...What would happen?"

He laughed. "Well of course, you would be cursed to the form of a small powerless ferret for all eternity. But that would never happen. I can tell you're already swooning over me."

She laughed nervously. She needed to get as far away from this maniac as possible. Searching her mind for excuses, she eventually came up with one. "Well listen...If we're going to get married we have to do it properly. Two need to declare there vows in front of people to make it official...so let me go get my servants. Okay? Just wait right here and I'll be right back."

"But of course! I'll be right here." Hook, line, and sinker.

"Now wait there okay....I'll be back...I promise..." She slowly backed away out of sight.

"Waiting here my love."

When the ferret was away from view, Tenten made a made dash for Temari and Hinata. Both of whom had a concerned look on their faces.

"M-mistress? W-what's wrong?"

"No time! Go! Let's go! Fast!" She hopped on Temari, as did Hinata and took off. She didn't have much time to escape the ferret. Thankfully Temari had taken her order to go fast and was literally sprinting down the street. Tenten hoped she would be able to get away.
15522121111212111111112.title: There goes the bride.

"B-but mistress, we're ferrets..."

They eventually found a nice inn in the mountains and hid outside to take human shapes. Tenten already had the special clothing Temari had gotten for her, so she was fine on disguises. Hinata was returned to her human form but seemed slightly disappointed.

"I-I liked my ferret form better..b-but it can't be helped I g-guess..."

Tenten considered returning Temari to normal as well. But she still had not forgotten that she nearly overthrew her. She stood over the mule and sternly said.

"Temari, I will return you to normal on one condition...You must never challenge my authority again. Is that understood?"

"I didn't break our agreement. I said I'd change you back, I didn't say anything about letting you speak again though."

The ferret girl trio went into the inn and had dinner. No one seemed to bother them, on the outside they were believed to be an average ninja team probably on a mission. In fact, even several males started flirting with them. Of course they had to decline in any 'sexual' activities, least their secret get out. As she did, she awoke to see a much larger room.

'Weird. ' Tenten thought as she tried to rise, only to fall on her back.

"What?" she said, she then looked in a nearby mirror to find that she was a normal brown ferret, her hair and eyes were the only remnants of her human form.

She then noticed a nearby note:

'Dear fianceè,

I realize that you must not have returned for reasons beyond your control. I am sending this letter to you via magic to tell you that your becoming a ferret this morning was not my doing, but rather part of tradition. As of now you have lost all magical powers and are only capable of speech and normal ferret actions.

Your powers will return upon our marriage, or an agreed annullment, but I doubt that the latter will happen.

For now you must rely on your servants to aid you, may they serve you well. Although they still have their powers, all commands you gave them still stand, but nothing binds them to obey you now.

I'll be waiting on a special Island in the land of ferrets. You'll know it when you see it.

With love, Shin Ferret.'

Tenten's body gave an involuntary shiver. The ferret really expected her to marry him? Even at the cost of her powers, it still wasn't appealing...But could she live as a ferret for the rest of her life?

"Hinata! Temari!"

Tenten explained the situation to her servants and...

On the way to the island...

1553321.title: Tsunade

15533211.content:
It was another boring day at the office for Tsunade. A mountain of paperwork glared down at her while she lazily picked her nose. All was quiet, save for the clock ticking away in parallel to her life wasting away in this boring office. She wished something exciting would happen for once. Wish granted; a giant slug materialized landing right on her desk in a sticky mess. It looked like one of her familiars.

"Lady Tsunade you must come with me please! It is my mistress Katsuyu! She is deathly ill!"

Katsuyu was the slug leader Tsunade had made a contract with. She had saved many comrades in the past and was a strong ally. She was also adept with medicine, even more so than Tsunade herself. If she was as ill as the messenger slug said, there would probably be little Tsunade could do for her. Still Tsunade grab hold of the slug and was teleported to their realm.

The slug realm was an ideal place for the creatures. A dark and wet swamp like land with plenty of green grass. There were ancient tablets all around them, each with secrets to hidden medical jutsu. The slug lead Tsunade to a large clearing in the swamps with a giant stone altar nearly a mile long. On this altar lay the leader of the slugs Katsuyu, who looked extremely pale. Her mouth was dripping green mucus and her eye stalks were red.

"L-lady T-Tsunade." spoke Katsuyu,"I-I am sorry for the short notice in summoning you b-but I am in dire need of your help. I-it might be dangerous though and you could forever b-be altered in the process...d-do you still wish to help?"

"Don't be ridiculous Katsuyu, you and I have been through thick and thin together. Whatever it is I'll help you in any way I can."

"V-very well, listen to my tale. E-every one thousand years we slugs must die. H-however, rather than forever perish we can choose to inhabit t-the body of a human and share their life force. This h-human becomes our avatar and will take the shape o-of one of us over time. A-after one month, if the rebirth is successful, we leave the body of the human and both of us return to o-our normal forms. But t-there is sometimes a-a problem that occurs. O-our bodies can sometimes become too intermingled and w-we become one. I-I myself was once a w-woman like yourself who offered m-my body to the l-last slug queen. I-It is a gamble but I must find someone binded to us or I-I will surely perish. I c-can understand if you don't want to take such a risk my lady. But I-I feel you are the only one I can trust."

Tsunade didn't have to give it any thought if it meant saving her friend, "Katsuyu, if it will save you, you may use my body. I will just have to explain to Shizune the situation. When will this transfusion begin?"

"R-right now."
15533211.title: The sick slug, Katsuyu.

choices: Someone else is in her office.
155332111.content:
Katsuyu began to shrink in size at an alarming rate. She beckoned Tsunade to step up to her as she shriveled away. The slug that was once the size of a building was now only about the size of a small room, and she still continued to reduce in size. By the time Tsunade had reached her, she was the size of a watermelon. At last she stopped shrinking.

"I-I must be eaten by you my lady. There is no ritual. J-just bring me to your mouth and I can enter you body"

Tsunade grabbed the shrunken slug and did as she was told. She was wet and slimy with mucus but Tsunade didn't mind. She opened her mouth as wide as she could and Katsuyu poked her head inside. It felt like Tsunade was chewing a very wet and wide piece of gum as the slug worked its way down her gullet. Despite her throat being clogged by a giant mollusk she could still breathe, and Katsuyu created a huge bulge in her skin as the rest of her body wiggled its way down.

"It almost tastes like chicken..." Tsunade thought to herself.

The slime of Katsuyu made the transfusion extremely easily as she slipped down into Tsunade's belly. Her tail was all that was outside Tsunade's body as it shook to wedge itself in. Tsunade helped by pushing it in. She gave a huge gulp and feel the slug plop down in her stomach. Katsuyu curled up inside of her, Tsunade's stomach stuck out a good foot almost. She would have looked pregnant to anyone.

"Lady Tsunade," spoke one of the other slugs, "Lady Katsuyu and you are now one. You may call on us at any time through will alone. We can teleport you back here whenever you wish as well."

"Thank you," said Tsunade, still trying to comprehend the fact she just swallowed a giant slug, "I-I think I'll return back to work now."

"As you wish my lady."

And with a flash of smoke, Tsunade was back in her office.

At first Tsunade thought she should get back to work or find Shizune and explain her new condition. But she felt extremely drowsy for some reason, maybe her body needed time to readjust itself. Whatever the reason she could not keep her eyes open much longer, she sat down in her comfy office chair and collapsed on the table.

She had strange dreams during her nap. She saw herself eating piles of pink and yellow pantries without care of gaining weight. There was even a dream where she was rubbed her eyes and they popped out of their sockets, she had to go around holding them up to see where she was going. By the time she woke up, it was well past midnight. No one had entered her office yet.

"That was a good nap...", said Tsunade stretching.

Tsunade felt different. She looked down at her body and saw that it looked like she had gained tons of weight just like in her dream! Aside her slug filled belly, her arms and breasts were wider and bigger. Even her face felt fatter. She must have weighed over 200 pounds now, it was just like her dream! This didn't feel like normal fat though, it felt liquidy and slimy in a way. The changes to her body Katasuyu was talking about must have taken effect during her rest.

Tsunade felt her eye view was higher too. Could she have gotten taller as well? Her clothes weren't going up her legs or arms like she had grown, maybe it was just her imagination. She turned to the mirror and nearly screamed. Her eyes, if they could even be called eyes now, were stuck in two long skin colored tubes. Both stalks had grown over her head, they were just like a slug's eyes.

"Well so much for being able to go out in public now."

Tsunade was completely unaware of the amount of food going down her gut, it was almost like she was asleep and eating at the same time. All that was on her mind was food.

A pile of dirty dishes over stacked her paperwork as the Hokage licked her fingers after finishing her giant meal. Tsunade returned to reality and stared blankly at the stack of plates in front of her and then at her now massive gut that extended over a foot outwards.

"What the hell is this?!", yelled the Hokage at the top of her lungs.

Her belly had pushed itself from under her blouse and was now hanging out in the open. Tsunade poked it gently and felt it wobble with fullness, this was real! She had to do something! But for some reason she felt exhausted again and yawned loudly.

"I-I-I c-can't k-keep my e-e-eyes o-open..." mumbled Tsunade as she feel back into her chair and passed out.
15533212211.title: Quite an appetite you have...

155332122111.content:
Tsunade awoke to a slight itchy feeling coming from her stomach. Yawning she began to scratch the spot but winced in pain. She opened her eyes to see her hands and nearly screamed. Her once nail polished fingers had giant black claws! Panicking, she pulled her her blouse to reveal that her bloated stomach was now covered in light yellow hair and was spreading! The golden fur was carpeting her entire chest and moving on to her arms and legs.

Tsunade began to tear off her clothes in some desperate attempt to make the spreading cease. There was no such luck as the fur wrapped itself around her hands, which were being to look like paws now. From her thighs to her feet she was completely covered in the same yellow hair.

"What in the world is happening to me?" said Tsunade, her voice was getting deeper almost like a growl.

The fur showed no signs of slowing down as it made it's way up to her face. But Tsunade felt a strange pressure residing in her jaw. Her mouth and nose lengthened a good few inches forward, she felt her nose flattened and turn black. The fur covered her entire head besides her mouth and nose, and pushed her ears to the top of her skull. Her old hairstyle remained, but she stood there naked and shivering wondering what was happening to her.
155332122111.title: Awake and hairy.

1553321221111.content:
What seemed like a slight pause in the transformation turned into painful bone snapping. Tsunade doubled over her massive tummy as she felt all the bones in her body rearranging themselves. Her hips gave a large crack and she fell on all fours and had difficultly getting back up. It felt strange to walk on two legs now, walking on four legs seemed far for natural...NO! What was she thinking!? She was able to push herself up with almost no effort and struggled to balance on two feet.

Her shoulders were broadening outwards and her spine and limbs were lengthening. Tsunade shot up almost a foot in height in a matter of seconds. Every bone in her body was thickening and becoming much stronger. She felt the fat in her stomach spread over her body, making her larger limbs look even more massive.

She tried to speak the words, "Someone help me!", but all that came out of throat was a series of mournful roars. She couldn't speak. She felt her hands shrinking and form soft pads in the middle of her palms. As a massive amount of fat ballooned her rump outwards, a study tail poked it's way over the top of her crack.

Over her torn clothing stood a full-grown female yellow haired bear with a diamond shaped black dot on it's forehead.
1553321221111.title: The Hokage bear.

choices: Decided to make her his pet
To use her as a ride
15533212211112.content:
Soon Tsunade managed to escape her office without anyone seeing her. Her shinobi skills seemingly hadn't dissapeared, but she was getting hungry.

'...What I wouldn't give for some fish or honey...man I'm starving!'

Just then Tsunade came across Naruto, who was holding three sticks with smoked fish on them.

"Aww man! I can't believe Ichiraku's closed for the week, now all I have are dumb fish!" He whined, when he noticed Tsunade, panting and eyeing the fish.

"Huh? A bear... Hey bear, you want these fish?" He asked her.

Tsunade nodded, and Naruto gave her them. She then roared gently and rubbed against Naruto's head, forgetting about her issue.

"Aw, what a cute bear..you remind me of granny, so I'll call you Tsuna!" he said petting her.

Naruto then...
15533212211112.title: Naruto and Tsuna!

choices: Tsunade had returned back to human form.
155332122111121.content:
Naruto then decided it was time to go home before it got dark. As he turned and went on his way, the Tsunade bear decided to follow him.

"I must be completely out of my mind...but maybe he has more fish...", she thought to herself.

Naruto noticed the giant mass of yellow fur following him and turned to face the bear.

"Whaaat? Come on go home Tsuna. I don't have any more fish."

Tsunade was persistent though and nudged Naruto with her nose. Naruto gave a huge sigh and said.

"Alright, alright, fine you can come home with me. My landlord says no pets though, but I guess a bear doesn't exactly qualify as one."

The two new friends walked home together, earning many concerned whispers from the local villagers they passed on the way back. There were also fliers on the lamp posts that said the Hokage was missing, but Naruto wasn't concerned she was probably out drinking again. He unlocked the door to his room and collapsed on the bed. Tsunade was tired too after her meal of fish and curled up on top of the pillows.

"I have an early mission to go to tomorrow Tsuna so I have to get up early in the morning. I'll introduce you to my team then. I'll bet they've never seen a trained bear before. Hah!"

Tsunade had no complaints there as she already fell fast asleep. Naruto rested his head on top of her soft warm stomach and caught up to her in sleeping. The room grew quiet save for the slight snoring from the giant bear.

The next morning...
155332122111121.title: It followed me home, can we keep it?

choices: Go with Naruto on his mission. Maybe she can find clues.
Take a nap to return to normal and find Shizune.
1553321221111211.content:
Tsunade felt cold when she woke up to the dawn's light. She tried to remember what exactly happened yesterday. She tried to sit up only to be stopped by the drooling head of Naruto who asleep on her naked body. Tsunade's face twitched and she let out an ear piercing scream that woke up the entire street. Naruto fell on the floor completely dazed from what just happened and stared half asleep at Tsunade as she quickly covered herself with his bed sheet.

"Wha-what? Granny? What the heck are you doing in my room naked? And where's Tsuna?", asked Naruto as he looked around the room for his new pet bear.

Tsunade sweated furiously as she struggled to remember what she had been doing up until this point. She remembered being VERY hungry, then fur and claws sprouted all over her body, and she found Naruto who offered her fish and took her to his home.

"Hello? Granny? Are you hungover or something? Where the hell's my pet bear?"

"N-Naruto," said the Hokage with as much dignity as she could muster, "I think I was...the bear. I don't remember much of what happened yesterday. I can't explain it b-but..."

"Oh come on Granny, how stupid do you think I am?" spoke Naruto ironically.

"I-I can prove it, I remember you offering me fish, right? And I followed you home...you said something about a landlord. Then we went here and fell asleep."

"How do I know you weren't just following me last night. Come on enough jokes now, I need to get to my mission."

Tsunade tried to think of more proof but something lingered in the air. There was a sweet smell coming from Naruto's cupboard. Ignoring Naruto completely Tsunade's appetite clouded her mind again as she fumbled through the cabinet looking for the source of the tasty smell. It was HONEY! Licking her chops, she quickly unscrewed the cap of the giant jar and began to messily eat away at the sweat syrup.

"Uhh Granny...why are you eating my honey?"

Naruto was about to ask even more pointless questions until he noticed something funny was happening to Tsunade's ears. They were moving to the top of her head! Not only that but Tsunade's stomach was bloating outwards like a balloon. Her hands began to look more like paws as she remained blissfully unaware at her changes. She grew right out of her bedsheet and rose off the ground a good foot as the blubber worked it's way to her butt again. Patches of yellow fur were appearing all over her body and her mouth grew longer and wider so she could fit it in the jar to get the last drops of honey. Tsunade looked like a swollen blow up doll as she snapped back to reality.

"Naruto! It's happening *grr* again...Please help me!" said Tsunade in a much deeper voice.

A cute stubby tail poked from her backside. She felt bloated and warm as the fur mercilessly covered her body. Within seconds Naruto's pet bear Tsuna had returned. Naruto put two and two together and asked the bear some questions.

"Granny, can you understand me?"

Tsuna growled sadly and shock her head.

"Okay, I think I know why you transformed like that. It's the honey! I'll bet every time you eat bear food like honey or fish you turn into Tsuna! And maybe if you fall asleep like you did last night, you return to normal. Of course I don't know why it's like that..."

Tsunade was distraught. How could she be Hokage of her grandfather's village as a bear? She had to find out why this was happening.
1553321221111211.title: That next morning...

choices: "There have been some strange individuals sighted around the village."
"We've been tasked to find the missing Hokage."
15533212211112111.content:
As much as Tsunade hated to admit it, Naruto was her best chance of finding a way back to normal. She had to keep this secret between as few people as possible. If word got out to the village that the Hokage was cursed to transform into a bear every time her had a little bit of honey, there would be chaos and possibly war. No matter what, she should hide with Naruto and follow him. It would be best for the village to stay hidden and missing rather then discovered and found out.

"So Granny, what are we going to do?", asked Naruto.

Tsunade moved up to him and nudged his chest with her snout, trying to convey the message "I'm going to stick up you." Naruto seemed to understand.

"Okay, but just to remind you I have a mission today. Kakashi-sensei is going to wonder why there's a giant bear following me around."

With their day planned, Naruto changed into a fresh pair of clothes and made breakfast. Tsunade munched on a piece of toast while Naruto had leftover ramen. With their bellies full they set out for the meeting spot for Team 7. Sasuke and Sakura were both there, waiting for Kakashi as usual. Both greeted Naruto and jumped at the sight of the massive yellow bear following Naruto.

"Relax guys, she's trained and won't hurt anyone." said Naruto, trying to offer them comfort.

"You don't train bears you idiot." snarled Sasuke, "Why are you wasting time practicing circus tricks when you should be training to get stronger?"

Naruto and Sasuke were about to go at again but thankfully Sakura broke it up. Tsunade sat blissfully in the sun, smelling strange new scents that her new nose enabled her to sniff. Two hours later Kakashi finally showed up, giving a meager excuse of having to free a cat from a clogged toilet. He noticed Tsunade and asked his team.

"What is a bear doing here?"

"Her name is Tsuna. I found her and she won't stop following me around." answered Naruto, resulting in an angry growl from Tsunade.

"Odd...but whatever. Alright gang, here's today's mission...", said Kakashi.
15533212211112111.title: "Tailing" Naruto.

155332122111121111.content:
"C'mon Tsuna! Kakashi-sensei'll be mad at us if we don't find these guys!" Naruto scolded as he tried to get his pet/Hokage to speed up. She was looking at some fish in a sushi shop, and began to grumble as she was dragged off.

Tsunade and Naruto were told by Kakashi that on this mission, they'd be searching for at least three ninjas from the Land of Dust. One was supposedly an old man who was the leader of the three rouge-nin, and rumors had it he bore some sort of grudge against Konoha. Supposedly they kidnapped the Hokage. Of course Naruto and Tsunade were ordered to keep an eye out for anything odd.

Still, Tsunade, or rather Tsuna, was still hungry. Soon she began to paw at Naruto to say. 'Buy me some food, and soon!'

The blonde rolled his eyes. "Fine..." he whined as he bought some fish for her. She growled happily, just then she sniffed the air and smelled a familiar scent...

Suddenly she began to run after an unknown Ninja and Naruto began to follow, still carrying the food.

"Wait up Gra-uh, Tsuna!" He yelled, running after her. Soon the two were....
155332122111121111.title: Misshaps with Tsuna!

choices: The leader had left the animal dust behind.
Naruto is forced to reveal Tsunade's identity.
1553321221111211112.content:
...caught right in the middle of a trap. A net from below hoisted them up into the air. Laughing, the ninja whom they were pursuing as well as two others moved from out of their hiding spot in the trees.

"Well, well, well." said the leader who looked like an elder chap, "Look what we caught gentlemen. A bumbling bear and a brat."

"Who the hell are you?", yelled Naruto.

"Dust Ninja, from the Land of Dust. I don't need to bother asking who you are Naruto Uzumaki. We have been watching you and your friend Tsuna the bear. Or should I say Lady Tsunade?"

"How-how did you know it was her?"

"Because my dear boy, I was the one who broke into her office and cursed her to this state!"

"What!? How?!"

"With this," the old man held up a brown sack,"Bestia pulvis, Latin for animal dust. A mere handful of this will change any being into their inner animal. In the case of our lazy Lady Tsunade here, she is quite fitting as a bear wouldn't you agree?"

Tsunade roared at the man and bit furiously at the rope to break free and snap the man's neck in half. Naruto took out his kunai knife and tried slicing away at the net.

"Don't bother, the rope is infused with diamond dust. Anything methods you use will not break-"

"RASENGAN!" yelled Naruto.

The blast of the jutsu left a huge gap in the netting and allowed the pair to escape free. Tsunade lunged at the old man but one of the other ninja got in her way. Biting into his arm, Tsunade brought him to the ground and began to maul him. Naruto attached an explosive note to a kunai and tossed it in the air to make a makeshift flare to alert the others. Dodging the kunai being thrown at him, Naruto joined the fray.

"I won't forget this brat! You mark my words, Tsunade shall never become human again! And neither shall you!"

Naruto brought down the second ninja but was unable to stop the leader from using a handful of smoke dust to escape. Just as the dust cleared Kakashi and his teammates arrived at the scene.
1553321221111211112.title: The enemy.

choices: They had already breathed some in
15533212211112111121.content:
"Naruto what happened?" Kakashi asked as Naruto's other comrades captured the trapped ninja.

"Um...I fought the leader, he kidnapped granny Tsunade..." The blue eyed boy began, looking to his pet for approval. Tsunade nodded slightly, condoning his lie at the cost of her pride.

"They did?" his sensei asked.

"Yeah, and he tried to use this weird dust that turns people into animals."

"You didn't breath any in...did you?" The copycat-nin asked.

"I'm not su-" he began, when Tsunade poked at him. "What is it?"

She motioned towards a small pile of dust that Sasuke and Sakura were looking at. Out of fear that they'd breath it in, Naruto tried to call out but...
15533212211112111121.title: A handful of Beastia pulvis...

choices: Tsunade tries to talk with Sasuke and Sakura.
155332122111121111212.content:
"YOU GUYS GET AWAY FROM THAT STUFF!" yelled Naruto.

Too late, the blue dust was already in the air. Sakura and Sasuke were coughing it in, unaware what exactly it was. Kakashi and Naruto both spoke at the same time.

"Oh crap..."

Both of Naruto's teammates began to shrink at an alarming rate. Sasuke started to sprout jet black feathers all over while Sakura grew whispers and developed a pink cat nose. Her ears became pointed and moved up her head and Sasuke's mouth puckered up and hardened into a beak. Naruto took a deep breathe and grabbed both of them and pulled them away from the pile of dust on the ground. Nothing could be done to stop the transformations though.

"Dammit it all, Kakashi is there anything we can do?"

"This is beyond my area of expertise Naruto. If Lady Tsunade were here she might be able to cure them."

Tsunade shook her head, she had never even heard of the Dust Village before yet alone a product of theirs. Sakura's body was dwindling to that of a pink cat's, a pink tail appeared from her rear. Sasuke was still shrinking though, he was becoming a small raven. They had both lost their ability to speak but clearly showed signs of great concern.

"Don't worry guys!" said Naruto, "When you fall asleep you return to normal."

"...How do you know that Naruto?" asked Kakashi.

"Oh uh...the...their leader said something about it...I guess..." He almost gave Tsuande away!

"Hmmm." said Kakashi. Sasuke had completely become a black little raven while Sakura had become a pink tabby cat. Both looked a bit dazed as to what just happened and were exploring their new forms. They looked unharmed otherwise though.

"Listen you four." spoke Kakashi referring to Naruto, Sakura, Sasuke and Tsunade. "I'm going to go get a clean up squad to take the dust and examine it. While I'm gone you are not to go anywhere near the dust and allow no one else near it either. Do I make myself clear?"

They all nodded.

"Good now camp here. It will take until tomorrow for me to return."
155332122111121111212.title: Too late.

choices: Tsunade is caught when she wakes up normal.
1553321221111211112122.content:
Kakashi took off quickly. He knew that the dust was of great danger to any in the area. So before he went he put a sealing jutsu over the bag. Hopefully Naruto would be alright and the dust ninja would not return. This left the blond ninja alone with a bear, a bird, and a cat. Not exactly the most chatty company. Sakura had adjusted well to her feline form and was perched up in a tree. Sasuke on the other hand had not been able to grasp the concept of flying yet. He crashed several times much to Naruto's amusement, but got him back by pecking at him. Tsunade on the other hand rested lazily against a tree.

"Alright you guys." said Naruto, "I'm going to go get us some food for dinner. Come find me if there's trouble."

Tsunade licked her lips at the thought of grilled fish and honey. Her appetite for food seemed to only increase each passing day. Naruto left and the camp grew quiet. It was awkward to not have anyone to talk to. All Tsunade could do was nod, growl, or shake her head when she wanted to say something. Sasuke fell from flying again, swearing loudly. "Wait a moment..." she thought to herself.

"Can you guys understand me?", she growled at the pair.

They seemed shocked that the bear that followed Naruto around was talking to them. But Sakura answered.

"Y-yea. Are you cursed like us too or are you just a normal bear?"

"Just a normal bear dragged into this mess. How are you two dealing with the changes?"

"It actually isn't that bad." said Sakura, "A little furry but I kind of like being quick and agile. How about you Sasuke?"

"Flying...is difficult..."

"Well don't worry." said Tsunade, "You should be back to normal after a good night's rest. Just don't eat any food that a cat or bird would normally eat. You'll become like that again."

"Is that what those dust ninja said?"

"Err...Yes."

It was nice to have someone to chat to at least, it also provided a window into Naruto's personal life. She became well acquainted with Naruto's teammates asking them about themselves to pass the time. Sakura did most of the talking. Sasuke was far too busy trying to master flying, Tsunade could swear his beak was becoming dented after slamming into a tree too many times. They both seemed to be handling their changes better than she had, recalling when she first became a bear in her office. She was sure to lure them away from questions about herself though, trying her best to not give away her cover. Eventually Naruto came back with fresh fish and they ate.
1553321221111211112122.title: Animal Communication 101

15533212211112111121221.content:
As time passed medic ninjas came to collect the dust, carefully they put on special air filter masks, as well as handed Naruto one.

"So what are you guys gonna do?" The blonde asked. One of the shinobi turned to him.

"For now we're going to analyze the dust and conduct some tests. We'll need to do the same your teammates once we've finished though, just to see if we're on the right track to healing them."

The blonde looked a bit worried, tests on animals had a reputation of being inhumane, but the hidden leaf ninjas were trustworthy.

"Sure then.." Naruto said, as the ninja's collected the strange dust and left. He then faced his companions. "Well, since you guys can't really get home yet, why not stay at my place for now?" The jinchuuriki asked.

The animals nodded and followed him home and prepared for bed. Tsunade curled up near Naruto once more, while Sasuke slept on Sakura's head.

The next morning Tsunade awoke to hear Sakura screaming.

"LADY TSUNADE!!!! What are you doing in bed with Naruto?" She questioned. Tsunade looked afraid.

"Well..."

Lucky for Tsunade Sakura says "Well I really missed you." Tsunade replies, jst noticing that Naruto had his arm wrapped around her as he slept.

155332122111121111212212.content:
"I didn't mean to deceive you two. I really mean it but..." she said nervously.

"You didn't want to cause panic." finished Sasuke who was sitting in the window sill, "If we knew you were effected by the dust, there would be massive rioting and outrage in the village."

"So wait a minute Lady Tsunade..." interrupted Sakura, "You were the bear that's been following Naruto around?"

She nodded and was thankful that Naruto's teammate kept as much levelheadedness about the situation as he had. She went on to explain to them her worst nightmare as to what would happen if the village learned of her curse.

"If Konoha knew that their Hokage had been affected by this...animal dust...There would be war. War is the last thing we need right now considering our problems with the Sound Village and Akatsuki. There will be those who will try to usurp me as well, claiming that I have no right to rule the village in my condition. You three must understand this. I must NOT be found out by anyone, not even Kakashi. Discuss this with no one but ourselves when we are alone. Please...as your Hokage, I ask this of you."

All three ninjas smiled, relieving Tsunade. She knew they would not betray her trust, they were all in this together.

"But Lady Tsunade." spoke Sakura, "If you're with us, the village will still be looking for you. Isn't that worse?"

Naruto quickly proposed his own solution. "I can use one of my shadow clones to cover for granny! I've been practicing and can keep it up for several days now."

Sasuke spoke, "But where exactly will we be going, Lady Hokage? Those medical ninja be looking for us you know."

Tsunade considered the best course of action. She had read nearly every scroll and book in the entire Konaha research center. If she didn't know anything about the dust, neither would Konoha's finest medics. They needed answers from the source.
155332122111121111212212.title: Bear is the word.

choices: They come across on old hermit.
They are ambushed by the Dust Ninja.
1553321221111211112122121.content:
"We will go to the Land of Dust." said Tsunade, with her mind made up. "From there we will scout around for information."

"Sounds like a plan." said Naruto, as he did the jutsu for a shadow clone.

"We will travel lightly so we don't waste time. Naruto, grab some fish, bird food, and cat food." ordered Tsunade.

"What?" he answered as his clone turned into a perfect match of Tsunade, "What for?"

"Because we might need it..."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------

An hour later, the four ninjas were on the road to the Dust Country. Naruto had successfully deployed his clone and the village leaders did not realize it was a fake Tsunade. Sasuke had returned to the shape of a raven and was flying in the air to scout, having mastered flying after much practice last night. Sakura was busy reading a map of the country and leading the team on. Tsunade felt her faith in Team Seven would be well placed.
1553321221111211112122121.title: To the countryside.

choices: He said he would help, go ahead.
15533212211112111121221211.content:
It took a day to reach the Land of Dust. Tsunade and Sakura found it uncomfortable to sleep normally again without a large mass of fur to keep them warm, but they managed through the restless night. It wasn't until the next day in mid afternoon did they finally have any luck with their information hunt.

"Jees." said Naruto, panting heavily, 'I'm exhausted..."

"You're maintaining a jutsu miles away while talking a country long walk. I'd be surprised if you weren't fool..." muttered Sasuke, who had returned to human form for today.

"I'd punch you in the face bastard...but that would take too much work..."

Sakura detected something up ahead and gave a sharp "Shhh" to allow the others to hear it too. They all quickly hid themselves up in trees above the pathway, waiting for whatever was up ahead to move towards them. Seconds ticked by as they all held their breathe, praying it wasn't the Dust Ninjas. An old man with a long white beard, dressed in rags was humming his way down the path. He had a small squirrel that was chewing on a large acorn while sitting on his shoulder. Though he did not seem hostile, the group did not reveal themselves to him. Deciding it would be best if they allowed him to continue on his way.

"My, my." the old man said to himself, pausing at the tree Tsunade was in. "It certainly is a wonderful day today, wouldn't you agree Mr.Donguri?"

Tsunade had a much look at his face. He was very old indeed, many wrinkles covered his face. Though his glasses did a good job of distracting people from them. They could do nothing, however, to hide the three giant scars going down his right eye all the way to his neck. His white beard was yellow around the mouth, suggesting he smoked often. But he had such a kind and trusting face, harmonious to nature itself. He opened his gray eyes. It was almost like he could detect Tsuande's stares, and he glanced up exactly where she was hidden in the leaves.

"Mr.Donguri says he could smell you four people from miles away. Why don't you come on down? I am but an old man, and you are clearly traveling ninjas. You have me outnumbered and overpowered."

The others turned to Tsunade, awaiting orders. She sighed and jumped down from her hiding place, she hadn't been caught in the arts of stealth since she was a child. This old man was no ordinary person, possibly a great retired ninja. Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura jumped behind him, preparing for any sign of trouble.

"Now why don't you tell me who you four are? Sneaking around in the tops of trees like a bunch of birds..."

He looked down his nose directly at Tsuande. It was almost like he could see right through her. Any lie she said would be detected. She decided it would be wise to be honest to a man with such a powerful presence. "My name is Tsunade, and I am the Hokage of Konoha. We have come to find out about a particular type of dust that is native to this area. It is vital for the safety of the village..."

"Indeed..." replied the old man with a stern look on his face. His eyes were surveying Tsunade's every motion, he was reading her like an open book. There was a giant pause of silence that seemed never ending. The wind howled in the background. And the atmosphere was so thick you could cut it with a knife.

Suddenly the old man busted out laughing. "Hohohahahaha! That's far too serious for me to hold a straight face! Sorry to scare you youngsters!" They all sweat dropped, wanting to punch the old hermit for creating such unnecessary suspense.

Tsunade's fist quivered and she asked through gritted teeth. "Now...would you mind telling me your name, PLEASE!?"

"Me? Why I don't have a name."

Naruto and Sasuke had to both comically hold back Tsunade from tearing the man's head off, as he stood there laughing away.

The old man wiped tears from his eyes. "Ohohahaha...Sorry...I haven't laughed that hard in ages...I don't have a name, but I am know as the Animal Hermit. Most folks just call be Hermit for short though."

"Animal Hermit?" asked Sakura, "Why do they call you that?"

"Well take Mr.Donguri here." the old man pointed to the squirrel on his shoulder, "I can communicate with any animal and have them help me in return for reward. I suppose to have it make sense to you ninja folk, you could call it summoning without the obligation."

Naruto and Sasuke could release Tsunade who had gotten over her blood lust. The old man took out a cane from his backpack and leaned on it. "I'm sorry for causing you trouble. Why don't I make it up to you four? You can to my hut and we'll have a cup of tea. Maybe I can help you with your quest...or mission...or whatever it is you're on."
15533212211112111121221211.title: The animal hermit.

choices: I can teach you to control the curse.

"We'll follow him...I trust something about him..." muttered Tsunade. The three genin nodded and ran to catch up to the old man.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------

The Hermit led them to a run down hut near a gushing waterfall. It looked like it had been put together with sticks and moss, hay and animal droppings were all over the floor. Of course the latter came from the sheer number of animals inside the small building. Where a dinning table would stood a large cow, birds of all sorts sat up in the rafters of the ceiling. On every single piece of furniture was some manner of four legged creature. The group understood why the geezer had been called the Animal Hermit now.

The hermit hummed the same merry tone as he gathered cups for the hot tea. A flock of birds laid a table cloth over the log that would serve as a coffee table and a large dog gathered the boiling teapot with it's teeth.

"Now then my friends from Konoha." said the old man sipping the tea given to him by a raccoon, "Tell me what it is you people are searching for here in the Land of Dust."

Tsunade grabbed the tea cup handed to her by a bouncing monkey. "Well Mister...err...Hermit. We have come looking for information on something a ninja from this land had on his person. He called it...Animal Dust."

The old man seized up between a sip of tea, causing a few raised eyebrows. The hermit slowly lowered his glass with a shaking fist before producing a goofy smile saying.

"Animal Dust? Why I've never heard of it! Hohohahaha!"

"YOU ARE SUCH A LIAR!" the four Konoha ninjas said at once.

He laughed for several seconds before calming down. "Heheh...You four mustn't mention such a thing so openly. Animal Dust is an extremely rare bit of material in this country. Usually any name connected to it is involved in dark arts or assassination. You're saying a ninja from our country left such a thing with you?"

"Well...not so much left." said Tsunade, "More so dropped. He tried to use it on some of our ninjas but escaped, leaving it behind."

The hermit played with his beard. "Answer me this. Would those ninjas happen to be you? And he inflicted it's curse on you?"

Tsunade winced and he laughed again. "Hohohaha, I'd say that's a bulls-eye."

Sakura asked. "You know what it does then? And is there a cure?!"

He shook his head. "I'm sorry my girl but there is no cure for it."

They all felt like they had just swallowed a rock. No cure? They'd be stuck like this forever! Sakura was nearing tears. Sasuke looked like he had just been punched in the gut. Tsunade shivered in her chair. Never before had she felt so afraid and unsure of the future. This was probably the worse than any of them could imagine. The old man took another sip of his tea.

"Why the down in the dumps look? You should consider this a blessing..."
155332122111121111212212111.title: Information from a Hermit.

"I can teach you to control the curse."

Instantly, the mood shifted from that of a funeral parlor to one of excitement and joy.

"YOU CAN WHAT?!" They all said at once.

"Hohohaha...Surely you did not think we would have such a powerful substance in our country without finding ways to cure its curse? Why I myself was very experienced with it in my past life."

"So you're saying there's a way to control it? Is there like a potion or jutsu?" Asked Sakura.

"No, there are no such things. The animal dust taps into your deepest primal aspects. When you lose yourself, you lose to your inner animal and it manifests itself using your body. Don't any of you recall that when eating the food of your designated animals? Food...Gluttony, it is one of the most savage and primitive desires in our human soul. You all felt the animal within feed off of your hunger and you lost the battle of dominance."

"So is there a special ritual to beating the inner animal?" Asked Naruto.

"There is only one way to beat your inner beast. You must have the will of a human being. You must want to be human. It is a mere test of self control."

Tsunade would have preferred a complicated jutsu to learn over this. She wasn't nicknamed the Legendary Loser for nothing. In the past she would gamble and drink for hours until she ran out of money. To her knowledge, she probably had the worst self control out of any ninja ever. But this was the only way.

"The best way to do this," said the hermit, breaking Tsunade from her thoughts. "Is like this."

After noise of rummaging, the bird swooped over the table and dropped a piece of a large fish in the center. Tsunade could feel her mouth salivating at the fresh salted salmon lying in front of her.

In this elephant graveyard, their bodies become part of the ground and fertilize the surrounding land, including the plants. This caused the local rice fields to grow to enormous size. According to the tales, it just so happened that one day a traveling sake maker came across the gigantic monocot plants. Amazed, he collected as much rice he could carry and brought it back to his home, where he created a barrel of the strongest sake he had ever tasted.

Unfortunately, shortly after creating the drink, he disappeared without a trace. He left no recipe or location on where to find the rice, so "The Elephant Sake" as it was dubbed was his last and greatest work.

Myths surrounded the barrel of sake. Some said it was a cursed drink because of the sake maker's defilement of the elephant graveyard. Any who tasted its sweet nectar simply disappeared. So it was sealed away and erased from history, never to be drunk by man again.

"Lady Tsunade," said Sakura as she carried their medical supplies. "Where should I put the equipment for the training?"

Okay, so it wasn't a complete vacation. But that was one good thing about having a new apprentice, you could take them anywhere under the guise of 'training.' Truth be told, this trip to the world famous Elephant Hotsprings wasn't about studying the longevity of the local inhabitants, which is what Tsunade gave as a flimsy reason. This was about spending as much time as she could in the hotsprings, taking a wonderful mudbath, and drinking as much sake as her body could take.

"Don't worry, Sakura. We will have our own room in the inn to store everything."

"We won't be staying out in the fields?"

"I need to go clear my head," she said out loud to Sakura and handed her the key to the room. "Here, room 182. Drop off the baggage then do whatever you'd like."

Sakura gave a worried look, but obeyed. She was probably just happy to see that Naruto was at least doing alright with his training and didn't see what the problem was with sharing a hotel with those two. She didn't know that they were going to have to spend the whole week worrying that someone might be watching them in the bath or checking their underwear drawers to make sure nothing had been stolen in the night. Jiraiya had always been a pain on trips when they were part of a team, Tsunade could only imagine how badly he had taught Naruto in the subtle arts of perviness.

As Tsunade returned to the lobby, she was tempted to visit the bar but decided that getting hammered and then waking up with a hangover would only add to her frustrations. A walk around the complex would be a better way to cool off, followed by a trip to the spring baths.

She stepped outside. It was a beautiful summer night, though a bit muggy and hot. This quickly became a factor after she walked down the path for a few minutes, as Tsunade found herself growing parched. She tired to distract her thirst by looking around and marveling at the sights.

This place was in no way like Konoha in that there weren't a forest of trees around for miles. It was just a flat valley with dozens of rice fields and a few huts scattered around for storage or escape from the sun. Everything looked to be very well maintained, except for one rice farm.

Tsunade stopped as she passed it. It was a rundown place, the rice fields were all turned over with rocks and couldn't grow anything. The house which stood on the property was rotting with the wood planks falling off. Generally it looked abandoned, save for the candlelight coming from the window. Curiosity took the best of Tsunade and she went up to the door and knocked.

"Is anyone home?"

But the knock at the flimsy wooden door caused it to fall right off it's hinges.

"Oh my," said a voice from within the hovel. "We haven't had guests in ages. Come in, dearie, come in."

Hesitant, but wanting to make amends for breaking the door, Tsunade reluctantly stepped into the home. It was just as bad as it looked on the outside, with most of the furniture neglected and rotting. In the center of the house was a giant pot over a fire and a small old woman cooking something in it.

"I'm just boiling the stew, darling. Be with you in a couple of minutes."

"Uh...Hello," said Tsunade as she sheepishly stepped into the light. "Sorry about the door."

"What door?" asked the old woman. "Oh, what are beautiful young lady you are."

Tsunade smirked, knowing full well in the back of her mind that she was probably looked like the old woman in her true form. "The door I busted. I didn't mean to break it when I knocked."

The old woman scanned for what Tsunade was talking about. She shrugged. "I don't see any broken doors."

"The one right behind--" But when Tsunade turned around to point it out, she saw that the door had somehow repaired itself. "...Me."

The warning lights went on immediately in Tsunade's head. This old woman was clearly not what she seemed but for some reason Tsunade found herself drawn to stay there. The old woman smiled as her cauldron continued to boil.

"You seem like a kind girl, a lot like our daughter."

"You don't live alone?" perhaps there was someone normal she could talk to, Tsunade thought to herself.

"Oh, I do know. He disappeared so long ago thanks to that..." the old woman stopped suddenly and shuddered. "But I hid it, you see. No one will ever find it so long as I'm here."

"Hid what?"

She glared at Tsunade. The mood of the hovel changed instantly. "Don't you ask of it. You don't believe me, do you? Just like the others. It caused him to disappear! I just know it, but could never prove it. He grew and then vanished. They said I was insane. You think I'm crazy, don't you?"

"I never said that--"

"Liar! shrieked the woman. She threw her stirring wand at Tsunade, but it somehow missed. "You think I'm crazy! I'm not! Get out! Get out!"

Tsunade wasted no time in leaving. She hurried out the door, only for it to fall off its hinges again, and didn't stop walking until she was on the dirt road again. Feeling guilty about just fleeing like that, she turned to yell an apology to the old woman but was shocked to discover the house had just completely vanished. In its place was what seemed to be a smoldering ruins with charred earth.

"What in the..." Tsunade said to herself.

Something wet filled her mouth. At first she thought it was the water she was drinking, but there was a taste to it. It tasted like iron. Blood. That's when her alarm clock woke her up and she realized that her mouth was filled with blood. She spat as much of it out as she could. Apparently she had bitten her tongue very badly while asleep. She quickly went to a nearby mirror and opened her mouth to see how bad the bite was. When she opened her mouth, she nearly screamed in surprise.

"What the heck is this!?!?" Her teeth were now gigantic sharp knives lining her jaw. That wasn't all. Her tongue, still red with blood, had become longer and pointed like a lizards.

She winced in pain and felt more blood filled her mouth. More sharp teeth were growing in the back of her mouth! And worse, to fit them all her jaw surged forward inch by inch. It felt like someone had taken her jawbone and was trying to rip it off her skull. Even her upper row of teeth were extending outwards, making it look like she had a snout. She hadn't noticed yet, but a bony appendage was sticking out of her lower back as well. She was growing a tail!

"What's happening to me?" She cried. It was becoming too difficult to talk now. Her mouth was becoming heavy and harder to hold up.

"RIIIIP" Something had torn out of her socks. Temari tried to look around her new giant muzzle to see what happened. Her feet were growing as were her toenails! The nails were sharp like her teeth, and had a blackish hue to them. That's when she noticed that her fingernails too were looking the same way. Right before her eyes, her fingers were fusing together like they were made out of clay. Her hands were now menacing three fingered claws!

"CRASH" The sound of broken glass filled the air. She spun around only to hear a loud BANG. This time, she titled her head around and finally noticed the giant tail growing out of her posterior! It was swinging around, batting things in her tent. Her feet were now fusing together as well, forming into a leaf-like shape. Her nose had long ago sunk into her protruding mouth, now nothing more than two dark holes at the tip. The tail allowed her to balance herself better.

There was something else wrong now. Her legs felt different. More powerful, stronger. Like she could run a five hundred mile marathon and not lose, similar to in her dream. Her height was increasing as her legs grew in muscle and bone. The muscle seemed to spread to her tail, chest, and neck as well, for they too grew in size. Strangely enough, the only body parts that didn't grow were her arms. In fact they seemed to shrivel away into her chest as the rest of her grew. Despite the increased muscle, her head was difficult to hold up like a normal human would. It was much easier to bend over, almost making her body parallel to the ground.

Soon enough, the only thing left of Temari the human ninja was her hairstyle perched atop of her massive head. Her skin had become rough and scaly. Streaks of colors went down her spine, her skin had shifted from a peach color to dark green. This was exactly like her dream! She roared with new found energy.

The tent was becoming less and less roomier by the second. Her body swelled with muscle and strong bones. She was towering over trees and buildings at this point. When her head bumped the top of the tent, she violently ripped it out of the ground. Terrified archeologists ran away in fear at the sight of her. She could almost laugh at the pathetic men, fleeing for their lives. Bloodlust filled her.
1553322211111.title: The rex walks again.

1553322211112.content:
Temari sensed approaching footsteps behind her. She turned and came face to face with the bald old man from yesterday. Only he seemed much smaller, like everything else around her. He was laughing as well.

"Well, well, well." he spoke, "Unsubtle, loud, and all the finesse of a bull. I would say this is a fitting form for you my dear."

Temari gave a questioned look. To much the man laughed again.

"Oh? You did not know? Well let me tell you...you are now a...."

She could not hear what the man had said. The last word was mumbled and her eyesight was becoming foggy. A bright light appeared and Temari could only see whiteness. "Temari!" a voice called out. She tried to see who it was but only saw the old man's face laughing at her. "TEMARI!" came the voice again.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------

"Temari! Wake up!" said Kankurō, "It's almost noon already! Come on!"

Temari slowly opened her eyes. She wasn't monstrous like she was in her dream, and the old man was no where in sight. Instead the painted face of her brother loomed over her with an annoyed expression.

"What the hell Temari? I never have to wake you up."

"Oh shut up...I was having a bad dream..." she replied rubbing her eyes.

"Well listen. Someone destroyed one of the skeleton the expedition put together so they're all in a bad mood. It's your turn to scout around the site, I've had enough of the angry glares from them. They all seem to think WE did it."

Temari laughed nervously. "Yea...how about that...Just let me get changed alright Kankurō?"

The puppeteer left the tent to give his sister privacy. Oddly enough though, when she tried putting her sandals on they wouldn't fit. She didn't even notice that her feet were bigger.

"Didn't I just get these fitted for me? Oww..."

She bit her tongue on something sharp in her mouth. Her felt around and it was her teeth, she were all sharper than usual. But Temari just dismissed these changes as tricks of her mind. This boring mission must have been going to her head. She left the tent and began her scouting barefoot, which was much more comfortable than walking around in shrunken shoes. During her patrol she came across...
1553322211112.title: Awakening.

15533222111121.content:
Temari kicked sand around with her giant feet, which did little to relief her from the heat. Being midday, the sun was unforgiving to all at the site. Objects in the distance flickered and danced, mocking those forced to work outside. Temari groaned and pulled her jacket over her sweating head. As she passed a dune she noticed something in the distance. A mirage perhaps? No this seemed very real. In one of the larger dunes there was a big door. Temari rubbed her eyes but the door did not disappear as she expected it to. She started walking over to it, expecting it to vanish. But instead it only grew larger and cleared the closer she came to it.

"...Why in the world is there a door in the middle of the desert?" she asked to no on in particular.

It was a stone brown door and looked almost like it belonged in some ruined temple. There was a large hand print in the center. Temari blinked. The hand in the center was glowing! It was calling her. She felt a desire to press her hand against and feel it's warmth. Slowly she reached her hand out until she made contact. The door exploded with a bright light and she was thrown aback, landing in the soft sand. The door had disappeared and instead had a gaping maw of darkness in it's place. It was a black entrance way. Without thinking for the second time in a row, she decided to step inside. However where she expected to be solid ground was a slippery ramp like surface, and she fell screaming down a giant slide leading to the depths of the dark below.

As the cries of Temari drifted further away from hearing, someone approached the doorway. The old man Temari had yelled at earlier stood there shaking his head at the sight of the opening.

"So unsubtle and brute-like...I'm beginning to wonder if I made a mistake choosing this one..."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------

Temari had finally stopped screaming as she descended further down. Particularly because there was no hope of anyone outside hearing her now. But mostly because opening her mouth resulted in several mouthfuls of sand that filled the air. With a thump and another mouthful of the stuff, Temari had finally stopped sliding and landed face first into a mountain of sand. Spitting and coughing madly, she looked around to try to piece together where she was. It appeared to be an underground tomb, filled to the brim with dusty old pillars and piles of sand.

"I suppose trying to get back up would be a waste of time..." she said to herself. The slide was far too slippery to even step on, despite being down here for what appeared to be ages.

Temari noticed a shaft of light coming from the ceiling. At least there was an opening somewhere. At the bottom of the beam stood an alter holding two large tablets. Temari sighed. This would be the THIRD time curiosity would get the better of her but she had to see what those tablets said. She made her way down the stone path to the alter. The entire place seemed incredibility durable. The altar hardly looked aged at all. Perhaps this place was still in use...

"Good." she thought, "That means at least someone will find me down here."

The tablets had no words, only pictures divided into four parts between the two slabs of stone. The first picture looked like a man holding a skull much like the one on the dinosaur skeleton she had broken yesterday. The second had seemed to be the man, only quite a there were major differences in his appearance. He seemed to have adapted a large tail, his feet and legs were greatly larger as well. But the biggest change was his head, which had almost taken the form of the skull itself. The third picture seemed to be the man again completely changed into the likeness of the skeleton. The final one showed the former man with a shield in front of him. There appeared to be a temple in the background as well.

"What is this exactly...?" Sweat dropped from her head.

"You will find out in time." spoke a familiar voice.

Temari felt a pain in the back of her head before everything went black.

Hanabi Hyuga was wandering through the forest surrounding Konoha. Her classes were out, her teammates were playing ninja (when she arrived, both teams were already filled), and Hinata was on a date with Naruto. Currently, she was bored stiff.

"I'm the heiress to the Hyuga clan." She sighed to herself, "There has to be SOMETHING. Maybe I'll spar with a Branch Member..."

This thought no sooner entered her head than she caught something from the corner of her eye. She wheeled around and activated her Byakugan. There was something close by. She knew she should just walk away, but curiosity overtook her. She HAD to find out what was doing this.

She ran into the forest, following the figure. Eventually, she arrived into a clearing. She then saw that the figure was...
15533222212221.title: Hanabi the Ostrich

choices: Her neck was a little longer than normal.

155332222122212.content:
Hanabi blinked several times, testing to see if her eyes deceived her despite their perfect ocular vision. What stood in the clearing was perhaps one of the most unusual animals she had ever seen before.

It was clearly a bird, judging by its big black father and beak. There was an impression of wings but the animal seemed too large to fly. Its neck and legs were elongated to almost bizarre proportions, which threw her off the most. It was also huge, much taller then she was by a good two feet or so. The bird was almost intimidating.

Almost.

Upon closer inspection, Hanabi noticed that one of its long legs was being lifted off the ground in a cradled position. The bird was clearly injured and was limping along trying its best to avoid Hanabi.

She relaxed, realizing now why it had taken off in such a hurry.

Hanabi spoke in the most soothing voice she could. "Don't worry...I'm not going to hurt you."

The bird creature paused and stared awkwardly at the girl. Testing her luck, Hanabi cautiously began approaching the animal. Making slow and easy steps as to not startle it.

"That's it...You're hurt pretty bad, huh? Don't run off. I'll take a look at it."

The bird looked at her with eyes of understanding and cooed slightly. Sensing Hanabi's intent, it rested its legs and sat softly on the ground, sticking its bad leg out from under its feathers.

Getting a close look, Hanabi was able to see just how severe the injuries on the bird were. A giant gash at the base of the top of its legs suggested that the bird was probably in pain from walking. Though Hanabi knew a little bit of medical training, there was no way she could fix something like this. Something was bugging her though.

Why was this strange bird all the way out here in the middle of a clear field?

Her question was quickly answered when she stepped over the tall grass next to the animal. To its side was a large mound covering a oval like object which was as white as snow. It was a giant egg.

Hanabi got momentarily distracted. "Whoa...Look at the size of that thing..."

She hadn't so much as turned her attention away from the bird fro five seconds, before looking bad and seeing that it was gone. It wasn't dead. It had simply vanished into thin air. There was no trace of it even being there.

Looking around, Hanabi called out for the bird. "Hello!? Birdie? Where did you go?"

But it was long gone. Hanabi could just stand there, dumbfounded. Not even her Byakugan could see where it went. Then, she remembered the egg.

It was still in the mound of sand and dirt, a white blemish amongst the drab and course ground. Something was drawing about the egg; its simple perfection and shape, its humongous size.

She couldn't just leave it there in the middle oft he field. Maybe that was the bird's intent all along. Hanabi reached down and scooped up the white orb, it was heavier then it looked. With as much tenderness as she could muster, she slid it into her backpack.

~

"I'm home." Muttered Hanabi to no one in particular as she stepped into the Hyuga mansion.

The emptiness of the house was not to be unexpected. Her father had left for an important meeting with the clan leaders of Konoha and another village, the other members apparently all had missions to take care of, and Hinata was of course still on her date with Naruto.

However, at least now she had something to do. The egg she had collected gave a warm glow from inside her backpack, but she'd have to build an incubator for it before it cooled down.

Walking to kitchen, Hanabi began to gather the necessary materials needed for her little construction project. A light bulb, a large box, some soft cloth, she quickly found everything she needed. She turned to leave, with the items in hand, but paused when she noticed a small note on the side of the refrigerator.

"Hanabi, There's a nice tray of food in the oven that I made for you if you'd like. All you have to do is heat it up for ten minutes. I know you're training, but please try to remember to keep your strength up. You'll need all the help you can get. Love, your sister. Hinata."

Hanabi grunted and ripped the letter off the fridge, crumpling it up in disgust.

"Shut up. I'm not weak like you..."

~

After a few hours of diligent planning and construction, the incubator was finally complete. Hanabi removed the large egg from her backpack and rested it in the box. She turned on the light and watched it glow off the egg shell.

For some reason, that was something captivating about the egg. It was like a little voice inside her head had told her to take it home with her and care for it. Then waste her entire afternoon making a nest for it...

It was then she realized just how late it now was.

"Seven O'clock? Great..."

By now everyone was probably home and had finished dinner, but it was too late in the day to start doing anything new. Plus, even though she did almost nothing today, Hanabi felt exhausted. She was about to pass out.

Getting one last look at the egg, she laid her head down on her pillow. Her stomach growled several times, angry with her because she hadn't eaten her meal her sister had made for her.

"Shut up Hinata..."

The next day...
155332222122212.title: The Egg.

1553322221222122.content:
Hanabi slowly opened her eyes to see that the egg was still in the incubater. Her muddled mind could tell something was different, but she was still half-asleep. She got out of bed and went out for her daily training exercize.

--

About an hour later, she walked back into her room and noticed the egg again. It was at that point that she realized what was wrong...

The egg had grown! It was already big enough, but NOW, it barely fit in the incubator.

Hanabi quickly adjusted the lightbulb so the egg would continue to receive its necessary hest. She then stared at it.

"How'd you get so big?" she asked it (for some reason, she was sure). She reached out her hand and gently touched the egg.

She immediately gasped as she felt a strange warmth course through her. She withdrew her hand and stared at it. Nothing different.

Boy was she wrong...
1553322221222122.title: One Big Egg

choices: She finds more throughout the day.

15533222212221221.content:
Touching the egg was almost like touching a hot stove. It didn't burn, but it was strangely warm and left a residing tingle in the palm of Hanabi's hand. Nothing hurt though, it just felt weird, almost numbing.

"Huh." She flexed her fingers slightly, making the strange feeling disappear. "Odd..."

She turned her attention to the egg again. It had to be the size of a basketball now and was pushing the walls of the cardboard box apart. She'd have to go get a new one to contain it.

She left headed downstairs into the kitchen once again.

Because it was still pretty early in the day, there still was no one up yet. The kitchen was still and tidy, as always. Hanabi had used a small box from some new appliance the family had bought for the first incubator, but clearly she'd have to find something bigger this time. Without hesitation, she began snooping around the garage for something useful.

"Hanabi, what are you doing?" Said a soft voice behind her.

Instantly, Hanabi jumped up in surprise, hitting her head on the counter over the garage can. She hadn't been expecting someone to catch her digging through trash, especially at this hour in the morning.

Rubbing her head, she turned and looked at who had caught her. "Hinata?"

Her older sister was still in her night clothes, she had a worried look on her face as always.

"Did you lose something in the trash?"

Hanabi paused and tried to think of a quick excuse. "I-I was just looking for a box."

"A box?"

"Yes...It's for a project in the academy."

Hinata thought for a moment. "Well, there's an apple crate in the storage room. Would that work?"

"So long as it's big enough..."

Hanabi stood up and brushed herself off, her older sister continued to give her a strange look making Hanabi nervous somewhat.

"What are you staring at?"

"Is something...wrong Hanabi?"

She lied. "No, it's nothing."

"Because you know...You can tell me if-"

Hanabi snapped for a brief moment. Mostly out of irritation but somewhat because of something else. "I'm fine! Nothing's wrong, okay!?"

She stomped out of the kitchen heading for the storage room.

"You're not mom, Hinata! She's gone already!"

~

Hanabi didn't know if she should feel bad about lashing out at her sister like that. In fact, she didn't know why she felt like keeping the egg a secret anyway. It just seemed like a natural response for her, she felt strangely protective about it.

She found the box Hinata had told her about, it was a perfect size with plenty of room to spare.

Hanabi used the excuse of being in a bad mood to justify snapping like that. She wasn't normally the emotional type, while she wasn't afraid to give her opinion on something she'd be mostly quiet.

It was probably because she hated being treated like a kid, especially by her older sister. Especially after their mother had died.

She grunted her way up the stairs with the bulky box getting jammed through the hallway. If no one was up at this point in the morning, they'd sure to be now with all the noise she was making.

At last, she managed to squeeze into her room with her prize. The egg was still sitting in the same spot she had left it in, looking no different then before save for its abnormal size. She placed the crate on the desk next to it and grabbed the egg.

Unlike last time, there was no strange tingling feeling when she touched it this time. Maybe it had cooled down somewhat since earlier. She scooped it in one arm and laid the towels from the old box into the new one with her free hand. At last, with everything in place, she gently placed the egg back into its protective nest.

She could relax again now. Hanabi wiped her forehead clean of sweat.

Her hand brushed against something odd in her hair though. Puzzled, she parted her long black hair and pulled the obstruction out, holding it in the light for her to see.

It was a short black feather.
