155332222221.content:
Leaves cluttered together in the air, like bright red and yellow fireworks exploding on New Years Eve. Of course, fall was a still a far season from the freezing cold month of January. It was the first day of October in fact; the air still smelled faintly of pumpkin pie and wet leaves and the ground looked aflame with all the colors of the dying trees. Sakura sighed as she stared out of her window, waking from sleep on this fine autumn morning in Konoha.

Fall just meant more work. Plain and simple. People needed to get their houses mended for the upcoming winter, people needed leaves raked and gathered, people needed to gather food in the fields before winter's frost came. Grunt work. Dull work. If she were Naruto she'd be angrily voicing her opinions to anyone with the bad fortune to possess ears.

"Another day...Another yen..." She muttered to herself, stretching her legs out and placing them barefoot on the cold floor. Complaining about everything wasn't going to get it done any faster.

She looked at the picture of her two teammates and their sensei, that was all the motivation she needed to get the day started. Like a jolt of electricity, she jumped into place. Ready for the daily grind.

~

Half an hour later, Sakura had eaten breakfast, gotten dressed, and combed her hair. She was presently walking along the streets of Konoha, humming merrily and trying not to think about what sort of mission they would have to do today.

The villagers seemed different today than they normally would be. Cheerier and happy. Maybe it was the bright cloudless sky contrasting with the colors of the leaves that brightened everyone's mood. That's when Sakura noticed them setting up decorations. Colorful figures and designs of bright orange and midnight black aligned the buildings and store windows.

"Huh...Is there a party going on or something?" Sakura asked to herself, stopping from her walk to her team's meeting place.

If she had been paying attention, she would have noticed the large container of pumpkin slowly backing up towards her. The driver hadn't seen her and continued in his attempt to pull into the street corner Sakura was standing in front of. Just as he was inches away from running into her, a quick black blur swooped her up and pulled her out of the way.

"Gah!" Was the only thing she had time to say, only just releasing she had been so close to being run over. She looked up at her rescuer. "S-Sasuke?"

The raven haired boy huffed a breath of air. "You're usually at least a little bit more alert than this in the morning Sakura..."

As he put her down on the ground again, Sakura started blushing madly. Sasuke had actually HELD her! She continued to absentmindedly stare at him until he seemed to get annoyed by it.

"What is it?" He said gruffly.

"It's...nothing. Sorry. Wh-what's with all these decorations? Is there some sort of event going on?"

Sasuke sighed. "You're as bad as Naruto...Don't tell me you two forgot about the talk with Kakashi yesterday."

"The talk?"

"Yes, it's-"

~

"Halloween!" Shouted Lady Tsunade to Team Seven as they stared blankly at the over-excited Hokage.

"Err..." Said Naruto, with a look on his face that said he just woke up. "What is Hollow e'?"

Tsunade cleared her throat. "Well, HALLOWEEN, is a tradition created in some other countries. It's the day where ghosts and other horrors are rumored to become intertwined with our own world for just one night."

"I don't like the sound of that." Said Sakura.

"Oh, it's nothing to be worried about. Those are just stories. Really, it's a holiday that celebrates autumn. Its a giant celebration of the mysteries of the night, with carving pumpkins, wearing costumes, and eating candies."

"Eating candies?" Said Naruto.

"Wearing costumes?" Asked Sakura.

"Ugh." Muttered Sasuke.

Kakashi spoke up from behind the group. "Perhaps it would be wise to explain why it is you're telling us about this Lady Tsunade."

"I was just getting to it. Basically, this is our attempt to assimilate an outside culture's traditions into our own for the benefit of the village, possibly resulting in a boost in trade and outside income."

Naruto looked like his brain short circuited. "What?"

Sakura sighed. "We're trying to become familiar with the holiday so we can attract other country's business."

"Oh."

Tsunade continued and pointed at Naruto, "And I need young folks like you to be on top of things, making sure all goes well. This holiday generally focuses on kids your age and younger. I'm depending on the younger genin to make this a smashing success. That includes getting involved with it yourselves." She stared at Sasuke who grunted.

"Who else is working with us?" Asked Sakura.

"Let's see...I asked all of the Rookie Nine so far...I thought that would be enough by Guy INSISTED that his team was youthful enough to be put up to the challenge, so there's Lee, Tenten and Neji too."

"What do you want us to do, exactly?" Sasuke reluctantly asked.

"Help around. There will be events during the month that I'd like you to attend. Plus you'll need costumes." Grinned Tsunade.

Sakura looked over her teammates, Naruto seemed generally excited with doing something new for once. Though anyone could tell Sasuke was not enjoying the idea of dressing up in costume, nor being involved with these activities.

"Oh, and before I forget. I need you three to head over to the local abandoned inn for starters. You'll meet the others there and you can starting setting it up for the first event. The Pumpkin Ball..."
155332222221.title: 1. Seasons Greetings.

choices: The trio goes in to meet their comrades, and some share Naruto's sentiments!
1553322222211.content:
Shortly after their enlightening meeting with Tsunade, Sakura, Naruto, and Sasuke departed from her office and traveled towards the inn, a crisp autumn wind travelling with them.

The trio of Genin had to go into the older section of Konoha to get to the forsaken hotel. Many of the proud village's structures seemed decrepit, all of the old timbers now warped and rotting, with ancient paint chipping away.

Although it was only noon, the sole blonde of the group began to shiver. This fact was noticed by both of his peers as they trod on, demolishing numerous dead leaves with their sandals.

"Jeez Naruto, it isn't that chilly out," Sakura said peevishly, her breath slightly visible now, "so you really shouldn't be shaking like that."

"I-it's not the cold, it's this part of the village," Naruto explained, looking at his surroundings fearfully, "It's just so old and creepy..."

"Hmph, what's the matter you big chicken?" Sasuke taunted, more out of boredom than true malice, "Do a few broken down houses and shops scare really you?"

"Sh-shut up you jerk!" Naruto yelled at his onyx haired rival, his aqua eyes showing anger. "I bet your scared too!"

"As if." The avenger of the Uchiha clan stated evenly. "Let's just get to the Inn already."

And with those words spoken, the group's lone wolf jumped from the ground to a nearby roof, and hopped into the distance.

"Hey Sasuke, wait for us!" Sakura called out, not wanting to be abandoned by her object of affection, before she imitated his actions, she called out to the trio's wild card, "Hurry up Naruto!"

"Yeah yeah, I'm comin'."

----

Within minutes, the three young teens found themselves before an immense building. Before it, there was an archaic sign that read 'Fright Inn', the words freshly painted onto faded timber.

In it's glory days, the place might've been a quality lodging, but in it's current and ruined form, it seemed far from hospitable...like a spirit it housed within.
1553322222211.title: Welcome to the Fright Inn!

15533222222111.content:
They entered the grand entrance hall, complete with a large marble stairway leading to the upper levels of the inn. The way up was draped with an old velvet red carpeting that looked like moths had been at it. The waiting room had plenty of furniture, old and decrepit just like hotel. The other team members had made themselves comfortable on it.

"So the last team arrives, finally." Said Neji who was leaning against the rock wall fireplace.

Lee had run up to Sakura, taken her hand and kissed it. "Hello Sakura, my sweet! Fear not, we would have waited months for you!"

Sakura frowned in disgust, wiping her 'contaminated' hand on her shirt. "It's good to see you too Lee."

Sasuke looked around, everyone was there. Neji, Lee, Tenten, Ino, Shikamaru, Choji, Kiba, Hinata, and Shino. All perched in or near a couch gathered around the fireplace with a decapitated moose head overlooking the group.

"They really needed this many people for this?" Said Kiba with an annoyed tone as Akamaru barked in agreement.

"Well someone has to do it...As tiresome as it is..." Muttered Shikamaru.

"How long do we have to be here? This place gives me the creeps..." Asked Naruto as he shuddered. The air seemed...haunted.

"Same..." Replied Choji as he shivered. "I can't even eat...It feels like we're being watched."

"Oh stop it please." Tenten said trying to act tough, but in truth she had the same bad feeling as both of them. "What are we waiting for anyway? Shouldn't we get started?"

Neji took the role of leader. "Agreed. I believe Lady Tsuande mentioned Kakashi will be coming here with supplies to decorate the building. In the meantime, we should split up and start cleaning the inn. Let's go in groups of two."

The ninja shuffled around the room trying to find partners. Naruto went to go with Sakura but she had already chosen Sasuke, much to the raven haired boy's dismay. Hinata, however, worked up the courage to ask Naruto to go with her to which the blonde happily agreed to. After cursing at Sakura for several minutes, Ino reluctantly chose to go with Shikamaru. Choji was stuck with Lee, as Neji and Tenten already partnered up. Lastly, Kiba and Shino decided to go together.

"Alright. Let's take time to look around, meet back here in an hour. Don't touch anything that looks dangerous."

~

"A-are you a-alright Naruto?" Asked Hinata as the pair traveled through the halls of the inn. The place was like a maze.

Naruto had bundled up in his jacket, he was freezing for some reason. "I just can't shake the feeling that...something's wrong about this place."

"I-It's okay...I feel the s-same way."

"Well that's comforting..." Said Naruto as he poked a small fancy vase facing a window. "You try using your eyes?"

"Y-Yes...I couldn't find anything a-abnormal about the house...We're c-completely alone..."

Maybe it was just the nine-tailed fox, but it felt like there was a heavy presence hanging over the entire area. Like someone had left the window open, causing a draft. It was a chilly sensation. The kind of feeling that shook you to the bones.

"Come on. Let's head back to the entrance hall. Maybe it's been an hour already." Shuddered Naruto, knowing full-well it had only been 15 minutes.

As they hastily walked back to the meeting place, a small dark figure peaked a tiny red out out of the vase Naruto had been poking moments ago.

~

"Shikamaru, I swear! I'm more of a man than anyone else on my team!" Yelled Ino, as Shikamaru stopped to grab his head from a sudden pain. "Don't tell me you're falling for this 'bad feeling' crap too!"

"I'm not...just...have a sudden headache...Troublesome..."

"Whatever! When you feel more like a man, you can catch up!" Ino still seemed pretty peeved about missing the chance to be alone with Sasuke.

"Don't know what's scarier...Ghosts...or Women..." Muttered Shikamaru.

~

Despite having the time alone with her lover, like she desired, Sakura couldn't help but not feel any joy at all. Maybe the others were right. Maybe there WAS something here, something watching them.

Besides Sasuke wasn't much for conversation at the moment. He seemed too interested in getting this mission done and over with so he could move on to more important things, like training.

Sakura sighed and they continued their search through the inn.

~

An hour later, they all met back in the main hall. Somewhere along their search, each of them felt something off about the hotel, though none of them said a word about it. Again, Neji took charge of the group.

"Alright. Anyone find anything out of the ordinary?"

They all shook their heads.

Kiba said. "Nothing at all, just a really creepy old house."

"Creepy is an understatement." Replied Tenten. "Look! We can actually see our breathes!"

Neji stopped the conversation. "Enough. I've already used Byakugan at every inch of the house. There's nine trained ninjas in this place, if anything WAS here we'd know about it."

As if things couldn't get cliched enough, right after Neji's outburst loud thunder was heard out, followed by the pelting of raindrops on the roof. Lee walked over to the window and looked up at the sky.

"That's odd...There wasn't a cloud in the sky when we came here."

"This place is haunted." Muttered Naruto.

"Look, it's not haunted for the last time." Said Neji, getting angry. "We've clearly all had a long day. Kakashi should be here at any moment. Let's just get a fire going and try to find some food."

The group collected some firewood and lit up a roaring flame under the moose head. Even the bright fire was not enough to cheer the ninja's spirits. Most of them kept to themselves, eating some hardened ramen they found in the storehouse of the inn.

Suddenly there was a knock on the door of the inn. Kakashi was standing there dripping wet with two giant backpacks full of what was presumably decorations. He plopped down the massive containers and greeted the teams.

"Oh hey. Good to see everyone made it. Sorry I'm late, I was stopped by some robbers and-" He paused and looked in the distance as if sensing something. He then turned pale.

"Err...Kakashi-sensei? Are you alright?" Asked Sakura with increasing concern.

"What!?...Oh...Yes...Apologizes Sakura...I...I think I need to sit down for a moment. We'll start work on the inn tomorrow, everyone pick a room and get some sleep."

With that he walked off to the upper rooms, leaving the rest of the team looking at each other nervously. Like any of them could sleep now.
